1.verse_text: Blessed [fortunate, prosperous, and favored by God] is the man who does not walk in the counsel of the wicked [following their advice and example], Nor stand in the path of sinners, And on His law [His precepts and teachings] he [habitually] meditates day and night. Which yields its fruit in its season; Its leaf does not wither; And in whatever he does, he prospers [and comes to maturity]. But they are like the chaff [worthless and without substance] which the wind blows away. Nor sinners in the assembly of the righteous. But the way of the wicked shall perish. Nor sit [down to rest] in the seat of scoffers (ridiculers).
But his delight is in the law of the L ord ,
And he will be like a tree firmly planted [and fed] by streams of water,
The wicked [those who live in disobedience to God"s law] are not so,
Therefore the wicked will not stand [unpunished] in the judgment,
For the L ord knows and fully approves the way of the righteous,

2.verse_text: Why are the nations in an uproar [in turmoil against God], And why do the people devise a vain and hopeless plot? And the rulers take counsel together Against the L ord and His Anointed (the Davidic King, the Messiah, the Christ), saying, And cast away their cords [of control] from us.' And terrify them with His displeasure, saying, Upon Zion, My holy mountain.' He said to Me, "You are My Son; This day [I proclaim] I have begotten You. And the ends of the earth as Your possession. You shall shatter them [in pieces] like earthenware." ' Be instructed and take warning, O leaders (judges, rulers) of the earth. Rejoice [yet do so] with trembling. For His wrath may soon be kindled and set aflame. How blessed [fortunate, prosperous, and favored by God] are all those who take refuge in Him!
The kings of the earth take their stand;
'Let us break apart their [divine] bands [of restraint]
He who sits [enthroned] in the heavens laughs [at their rebellion]; The [Sovereign] Lord scoffs at them [and in supreme contempt He mocks them].
Then He will speak to them in His [profound] anger
'Yet as for Me, I have anointed and firmly installed My King
'I will declare the decree of the L ord :
Ask of Me, and I will assuredly give [You] the nations as Your inheritance,
You shall break them with a rod of iron;
Now therefore, O kings, act wisely;
Worship the L ord and serve Him with reverence [with awe-inspired fear and submissive wonder];
Kiss (pay respect to) the Son, so that He does not become angry, and you perish in the way,

3.verse_text: O L ord , how my enemies have increased! Many are rising up against me. My glory [and my honor], and the One who lifts my head. And He answered me from His holy mountain. Selah. I awakened, for the L ord sustains me. Who have set themselves against me all around. For You have struck all my enemies on the cheek; You have shattered the teeth of the wicked. May Your blessing be upon Your people. Selah.
Many are saying of me, 'There is no help [no salvation] for him in God.' Selah.
But You, O L ord , are a shield for me,
With my voice I was crying to the L ord ,
I will not be intimidated or afraid of the ten thousands
Arise, O L ord ; save me, O my God!
Salvation belongs to the L ord ;

4.verse_text: Answer me when I call, O God of my righteousness! You have freed me when I was hemmed in and relieved me when I was in distress; Be gracious to me and hear [and respond to] my prayer. How long will you [my enemies] love worthless (vain, futile) things and seek deception and lies? Selah. The L ord hears and responds when I call to Him. Meditate in your heart upon your bed and be still [reflect on your sin and repent of your rebellion]. Selah. Trust [confidently] in the L ord . Lift up the light of Your face upon us, O L ord . More than [others know] when their wheat and new wine have yielded abundantly. For You alone, O L ord , make me dwell in safety and confident trust.
O sons of men, how long will my honor and glory be [turned into] shame?
But know that the L ord has set apart for Himself [and dealt wonderfully with] the godly man [the one of honorable character and moral courage–the one who does right].
Tremble [with anger or fear], and do not sin;
Many are saying, 'Oh, that we might see some good!'
You have put joy in my heart,
In peace [and with a tranquil heart] I will both lie down and sleep,

5.verse_text: Listen to my words, O L ord , Consider my groaning and sighing. For to You I pray. In the morning I will prepare [a prayer and a sacrifice] for You and watch and wait [for You to speak to my heart]. No evil [person] dwells with You. You hate all who do evil. The L ord detests and rejects the bloodthirsty and deceitful man. At Your holy temple I will bow [obediently] in reverence for You. Make Your way straight (direct, right) before me. Their heart is destruction [just a treacherous chasm, a yawning gulf of lies]. Their throat is an open grave; They [glibly] flatter with their [silken] tongue. Let them fall by their own designs and councils! Cast them out because of the abundance of their transgressions, For they are mutinous and have rebelled against You. Let them ever sing for joy; Because You cover and shelter them, Let those who love Your name be joyful and exult in You. You surround him with favor as with a shield.
Heed the sound of my cry for help, my King and my God,
In the morning, O L ord , You will hear my voice;
For You are not a God who takes pleasure in wickedness;
The boastful and the arrogant will not stand in Your sight;
You destroy those who tell lies;
But as for me, I will enter Your house through the abundance of Your steadfast love and tender mercy;
O L ord , lead me in Your righteousness because of my enemies;
For there is nothing trustworthy or reliable or truthful in what they say;
But let all who take refuge and put their trust in You rejoice,
For You, O L ord , bless the righteous man [the one who is in right standing with You];

6.verse_text: O L ord , do not rebuke or punish me in Your anger, Nor discipline me in Your wrath. Heal me, O L ord , for my bones are dismayed and anguished. But as for You, O L ord –how long [until You act on my behalf]? Save me because of Your [unfailing] steadfast love and mercy. In Sheol (the nether world, the place of the dead) who will praise You and give You thanks? Every night I soak my bed with tears, I drench my couch with my weeping. It grows old because of all my enemies. For the L ord has heard the voice of my weeping. The L ord receives my prayer. Let them turn back, let them suddenly be ashamed [of what they have done].
Have mercy on me and be gracious to me, O L ord , for I am weak (faint, frail);
My soul [as well as my body] is greatly dismayed.
Return, O L ord , rescue my soul;
For in death there is no mention of You;
I am weary with my groaning;
My eye grows dim with grief;
Depart from me, all you who do evil,
The L ord has heard my supplication [my plea for grace];
Let all my enemies be ashamed and greatly horrified;

7.verse_text: O L ord my God, in You I take refuge; Save me and rescue me from all those who pursue me, Dragging me away while there is no one to rescue [me]. If there is injustice in my hands, Or without cause robbed him who was my enemy, And let him trample my life to the ground And lay my honor in the dust. Selah. Lift up Yourself against the rage of my enemies; Rise up for me; You have commanded judgment and vindication. And return on high over them. Judge me, O L ord , and grant me justice according to my righteousness and according to the integrity within me. For the righteous God tries the hearts and minds. Who saves the upright in heart. And a God who is indignant every day. He has strung and bent His [mighty] bow and made it ready. He makes His arrows fiery shafts [aimed at the unrepentant]. And he conceives mischief and gives birth to lies. And has fallen into the [very] pit which he made [as a trap]. And his violence will come down on the top of his head [like loose dirt]. And I will sing praise to the name of the L ord Most High.
So that my enemy will not tear me like a lion,
O L ord my God, if I have done this,
If I have done evil to him who was at peace with me,
Let the enemy pursue me and overtake me;
Arise, O L ord , in Your anger;
Let the assembly of the nations be gathered around You,
The L ord judges the peoples;
Oh, let the wickedness of the wicked come to an end, but establish the righteous [those in right standing with You];
My shield and my defense depend on God,
If a man does not repent, God will sharpen His sword;
He has also prepared [other] deadly weapons for Himself;
Behold, the [wicked and irreverent] man is pregnant with sin,
He has dug a pit and hollowed it out,
His mischief will return on his own head,
I will give thanks to the L ord according to His righteousness and justice,

8.verse_text: O L ord , our Lord, How majestic and glorious and excellent is Your name in all the earth! You have displayed Your splendor above the heavens. Because of Your adversaries, That You might silence the enemy and make the revengeful cease. The moon and the stars, which You have established, And the son of [earthborn] man that You care for him? And You have crowned him with glory and honor. You have put all things under his feet, And also the beasts of the field, Whatever passes through the paths of the seas. How majestic and glorious and excellent is Your name in all the earth!
Out of the mouths of infants and nursing babes You have established strength
When I see and consider Your heavens, the work of Your fingers,
What is man that You are mindful of him,
Yet You have made him a little lower than God,
You made him to have dominion over the works of Your hands;
The birds of the air, and the fish of the sea,

9.verse_text: I will give thanks and praise the L ord , with all my heart; I will tell aloud all Your wonders and marvelous deeds. I will sing praise to Your name, O Most High. They stumble and perish before You. You have sat on the throne judging righteously. You have wiped out their name forever and ever. You have uprooted their cities; The very memory of them has perished. He has prepared and established His throne for judgment. He will execute judgment for the nations with fairness (equity). A refuge in times of trouble; For You, O L ord , have not abandoned those who seek You. Declare among the peoples His [great and wondrous] deeds. He does not forget the cry of the afflicted and abused. See how I am afflicted by those who hate me, You who lift me up from the gates of death, That in the gates of the daughter of Zion (Jerusalem) I may rejoice in Your salvation and Your help. In the net which they hid, their own foot has been caught. He executes judgment; The wicked are trapped by the work of their own hands. Higgaion (meditation) Selah. Even all the nations who forget God. Nor the hope of the burdened perish forever. Let the nations be judged before You. So that the nations may know they are but [frail and mortal] men. Selah.
I will rejoice and exult in you;
When my enemies turn back,
For You have maintained my right and my cause;
You have rebuked the nations, You have destroyed the wicked and unrepentant;
The enemy has been cut off and has vanished in everlasting ruins,
But the L ord will remain and sit enthroned forever;
And He will judge the world in righteousness;
The L ord also will be a refuge and a stronghold for the oppressed,
And those who know Your name [who have experienced Your precious mercy] will put their confident trust in You,
Sing praises to the L ord , who dwells in Zion;
For He who avenges blood [unjustly shed] remembers them (His people);
Have mercy on me and be gracious to me, O L ord ;
That I may tell aloud all Your praises,
The nations have sunk down in the pit which they have made;
The L ord has made Himself known;
The wicked will turn to Sheol (the nether world, the place of the dead),
For the poor will not always be forgotten,
Arise, O L ord , do not let man prevail;
Put them in [reverent] fear of You, O L ord ,

10.verse_text: Why do You stand far away, O L ord ? Why do You hide [Yourself, veiling Your eyes] in times of trouble? Let them be caught in the plots which they have devised. And the greedy man curses and spurns [and even despises] the L ord . All his thoughts are, 'There is no God [so there is no accountability or punishment].' Your judgments [L ord ] are on high, out of his sight [so he never thinks about them]; As for all his enemies, he sneers at them. For throughout all generations I will not be in adversity [for nothing bad will happen to me].' Under his tongue is mischief and wickedness [injustice and sin]. In hiding places he kills the innocent; He lies in wait for the unfortunate [the unhappy, the poor, the helpless]. He lies in wait to catch the afflicted; He catches the afflicted when he draws him into his net. And the unfortunate fall by his mighty claws . He has hidden His face; He will never see my deed.' Do not forget the suffering. He has said to himself, 'You will not require me to account.' The unfortunate commits himself to You; You are the helper of the fatherless. Seek out his wickedness until You find no more. The nations will perish from His land. You will strengthen their heart, You will incline Your ear to hear, So that man who is of the earth will no longer terrify them.
In pride and arrogance the wicked hotly pursue and persecute the afflicted;
For the wicked boasts and sings the praises of his heart"s desire,
The wicked, in the haughtiness of his face, will not seek nor inquire for Him;
His ways prosper at all times;
He says to himself, 'I will not be moved;
His mouth is full of curses and deceit (fraud) and oppression;
He lurks in ambush in the villages;
He lurks in a hiding place like a lion in his lair;
He says to himself, 'God has [quite] forgotten;
Arise, O L ord ! O God, lift up Your hand [in judgment];
Why has the wicked spurned and shown disrespect to God?
You have seen it, for You have noted mischief and vexation (irritation) to take it into Your hand.
Break the arm of the wicked and the evildoer,
The L ord is King forever and ever;
O L ord , You have heard the desire of the humble and oppressed;
To vindicate and obtain justice for the fatherless and the oppressed,

11.verse_text: In the L ord I take refuge [and put my trust]; How can you say to me, 'Flee like a bird to your mountain; They take aim with their arrow on the string To shoot [by stealth] in darkness at the upright in heart. What can the righteous do?' His eyes see, His eyelids test the children of men. And His soul hates the [malevolent] one who loves violence. The upright shall see His face.
For look, the wicked are bending the bow;
If the foundations [of a godly society] are destroyed,
The L ord is in His holy temple; the L ord " s throne is in heaven.
The L ord tests the righteous and the wicked,
Upon the wicked (godless) He will rain coals of fire; Fire and brimstone and a dreadful scorching wind will be the portion of their cup [of doom].
For the L ord is [absolutely] righteous, He loves righteousness (virtue, morality, justice);

12.verse_text: Save and help and rescue, L ord , for godly people cease to be, For the faithful vanish from among the sons of men. With flattering lips and a double heart they speak. The tongue that speaks great things [in boasting]; Our lips are our own; who is lord and master over us?' Now I will arise,' says the L ord ; 'I will place him in the safety for which he longs.' Like silver refined in an earthen furnace, purified seven times. You will protect him from this [evil] generation forever. As vileness is exalted and baseness is prized among the sons of men.
They speak deceitful and worthless words to one another;
May the L ord cut off all flattering lips,
Who have said, 'With our tongue we will prevail;
'Because of the devastation of the afflicted, because of the groaning of the needy,
The words and promises of the L ord are pure words,
You, O L ord , will preserve and keep them;
The wicked strut about [in pompous self-importance] on every side,

13.verse_text: How long, O L ord ? Will You forget me forever? How long will You hide Your face from me? Having sorrow in my heart day after day? How long will my enemy exalt himself and triumph over me? Give light (life) to my eyes, or I will sleep the sleep of death, And my adversaries will rejoice when I am shaken. My heart shall rejoice and delight in Your salvation. Because He has dealt bountifully with me.
How long must I take counsel in my soul,
Consider and answer me, O L ord my God;
And my enemy will say, 'I have overcome him,'
But I have trusted and relied on and been confident in Your lovingkindness and faithfulness;
I will sing to the L ord ,

14.verse_text: The [spiritually ignorant] fool has said in his heart, 'There is no God.' They are corrupt, they have committed repulsive and unspeakable deeds; There is no one who does good. To see if there are any who understand (act wisely), Who [truly] seek after God, [longing for His wisdom and guidance]. There is no one who does good, not even one. Who eat up my people as they eat bread, And do not call upon the L ord ? For God is with the [consistently] righteous generation. But the L ord is his safe refuge. When the L ord restores His captive people, Then Jacob will rejoice, Israel will be glad.
The L ord has looked down from heaven upon the children of men
They have all turned aside, together they have become corrupt;
Have all the workers of wickedness and injustice no knowledge,
There they tremble with great fear,
You [evildoers] shamefully plan against the poor,
Oh, that the salvation of Israel would come out of Zion!

15.verse_text: O L ord , who may lodge [as a guest] in Your tent? Who may dwell [continually] on Your holy hill? And speaks and holds truth in his heart. Nor does evil to his neighbor, Nor takes up a reproach against his friend; But he honors those who fear the L ord [and obediently worship Him with awe-inspired reverence and submissive wonder]. He keeps his word even to his own disadvantage and does not change it [for his own benefit]; And does not take a bribe against the innocent. He who does these things will never be shaken.
He who walks with integrity and strength of character, and works righteousness,
He does not slander with his tongue,
In his eyes an evil person is despised,
He does not put out his money at interest [to a fellow Israelite],

16.verse_text: Keep and protect me, O God, for in You I have placed my trust and found refuge. I have no good besides You.' They are the majestic and the noble and the excellent ones in whom is all my delight. I will not pour out their drink offerings of blood, Nor will I take their names upon my lips. You support my lot. Indeed, my heritage is beautiful to me. Indeed, my heart (mind) instructs me in the night. Because He is at my right hand, I will not be shaken. My body too will dwell [confidently] in safety, Nor will You allow Your Holy One to undergo decay. In Your presence is fullness of joy; In Your right hand there are pleasures forevermore.
I said to the L ord , 'You are my Lord;
As for the saints (godly people) who are in the land,
The sorrows [pain and suffering] of those who have chosen another god will be multiplied [because of their idolatry];
The L ord is the portion of my inheritance, my cup [He is all I need];
The [boundary] lines [of the land] have fallen for me in pleasant places;
I will bless the L ord who has counseled me;
I have set the L ord continually before me;
Therefore my heart is glad and my glory [my innermost self] rejoices;
For You will not abandon me to Sheol (the nether world, the place of the dead),
You will show me the path of life;

17.verse_text: Hear the just (righteous) cause, O L ord ; listen to my loud [piercing] cry; Listen to my prayer, that comes from guileless lips. May Your eyes look with equity and behold things that are just. You have visited me in the night; You have tested me and You find nothing [evil in me]; I intend that my mouth will not transgress. I have kept away from the paths of the violent. My feet have not staggered. Incline Your ear to me, hear my speech. O Savior of those who take refuge at Your right hand From those who rise up against them. Hide me in the [protective] shadow of Your wings My deadly enemies who surround me. With their mouths they speak proudly and make presumptuous claims. They set their eyes to force us to the ground, And like a young lion lurking in hiding places. Save my soul from the wicked with Your sword, From men of the world [these moths of the night] whose portion [of enjoyment] is in this life–idle and vain, And whose belly You fill with Your treasure; They are satisfied with children, And they leave what they have left [of wealth] to their children. I will be [fully] satisfied when I awake [to find myself] seeing Your likeness.
Let my verdict of vindication come from Your presence;
Concerning the deeds of men, by the word of Your lips
My steps have held closely to Your paths;
I have called upon You, for You, O God, will answer me;
Wondrously show Your [marvelous and amazing] lovingkindness,
Keep me [in Your affectionate care, protect me] as the apple of Your eye;
From the wicked who despoil and deal violently with me,
They have closed their unfeeling heart [to kindness and compassion];
They track us down and have now surrounded us in our steps;
He is like a lion eager to tear [his prey],
Arise, O L ord , confront him, cast him down;
From men with Your hand, O L ord ,
As for me, I shall see Your face in righteousness;

18.verse_text: 'I love You [fervently and devotedly], O L ord , my strength.' My God, my rock and strength in whom I trust and take refuge; My shield, and the horn of my salvation, my high tower–my stronghold. And I am saved from my enemies. And the streams of ungodliness and torrents of destruction terrified me. The snares of death confronted me. And cried to my God for help; He heard my voice from His temple, And my cry for help came before Him, into His very ears. The foundations of the mountains trembled; They were shaken because He was indignant and angry. And fire from His mouth devoured; Coals were kindled by it. And thick darkness was under His feet. And He sped on the wings of the wind. The darkness of the waters, the thick clouds of the skies. Hailstones and coals of fire. And the Most High uttered His voice, Hailstones and coals of fire. And He sent an abundance of lightning flashes and confused and routed them [in defeat]. And the foundations of the world were laid bare At Your rebuke, O L ord , At the blast of the breath of Your nostrils. He drew me out of many waters. And from those who hated me, for they were too strong for me. But the L ord was my support. He rescued me because He was pleased with me and delighted in me. According to the cleanness of my hands He has rewarded me. And have not wickedly departed from my God. And I did not put away His statutes from me. And I kept myself free from my sin. According to the cleanness of my hands in His sight. With the blameless You show Yourself blameless, And with the crooked You show Yourself astute. But bring down those [arrogant fools] with haughty eyes. The L ord my God illumines my darkness. And by my God I can leap over a wall. The word of the L ord is tested [it is perfect, it is faultless]; He is a shield to all who take refuge in Him. Or who is a rock, except our God, And makes my way blameless? He sets me [securely] upon my high places. So that my arms can bend a bow of bronze. And Your right hand upholds and sustains me; Your gentleness [Your gracious response when I pray] makes me great. So that my feet will not slip. And I did not turn back until they were consumed. They fell [wounded] under my feet. You have subdued under me those who rose up against me. And I silenced and destroyed those who hated me. Even to the L ord [they cried], but He did not answer them. I emptied them out as the dirt of the streets. You have placed me as the head of the nations; A people whom I have not known serve me. Foreigners feign obedience to me. And come trembling out of their strongholds. And may the God of my salvation be exalted, And subdues peoples (nations) under me. Yes, You lift me up above those who rise up against me; You deliver me from the man of violence. And sing praises to Your name. And shows steadfast love and mercy to His anointed, To David and his descendants forever.
The L ord is my rock, my fortress, and the One who rescues me;
I call upon the L ord , who is worthy to be praised;
The cords of death surrounded me,
The cords of Sheol (the nether world, the place of the dead) surrounded me;
In my distress [when I seemed surrounded] I called upon the L ord
Then the earth shook and quaked,
Smoke went up from His nostrils,
He bowed the heavens also and came down;
And He rode upon a cherub (storm) and flew;
He made darkness His hiding place (covering); His pavilion (canopy) around Him,
Out of the brightness before Him passed His thick clouds,
The L ord also thundered in the heavens,
He sent out His arrows and scattered them;
Then the stream beds of the waters appeared,
He reached from on high, He took me;
He rescued me from my strong enemy,
They confronted me in the day of my disaster,
He brought me out into a broad place;
The L ord dealt with me according to my righteousness (moral character, spiritual integrity);
For I have kept the ways of the L ord ,
For all His ordinances were before me,
I was blameless before Him,
Therefore the L ord has rewarded me according to my righteousness (moral character, spiritual integrity),
With the kind (merciful, faithful, loyal) You show Yourself kind,
With the pure You show Yourself pure,
For You save an afflicted and humble people,
For You cause my lamp to be lighted and to shine;
For by You I can crush a troop,
As for God, His way is blameless.
For who is God, but the L ord ?
The God who encircles me with strength
He makes my feet like hinds" feet [able to stand firmly and tread safely on paths of testing and trouble];
He trains my hands for war,
You have also given me the shield of Your salvation,
You enlarge the path beneath me and make my steps secure,
I pursued my enemies and overtook them;
I shattered them so that they were not able to rise;
For You have encircled me with strength for the battle;
You have also made my enemies turn their backs to me [in defeat],
They cried for help, but there was no one to save them–
Then I beat them fine as the dust before the wind;
You have rescued me from the contentions of the people;
As soon as they hear me, they respond and obey me;
Foreigners lose heart,
The L ord lives, blessed be my rock;
The God who avenges me,
He rescues me from my enemies;
Therefore will I give thanks and praise You, O L ord , among the nations,
He gives great triumphs to His king,

19.verse_text: The heavens are telling of the glory of God; And the expanse [of heaven] is declaring the work of His hands. And night after night reveals knowledge. Their voice is not heard. Their words to the end of the world. In them and in the heavens He has made a tent for the sun, It rejoices as a strong man to run his course. And its circuit to the other end of them; And there is nothing hidden from its heat. The statutes of the L ord are reliable and trustworthy, making wise the simple. The commandment of the L ord is pure, enlightening the eyes. The judgments of the L ord are true, they are righteous altogether. Sweeter also than honey and the drippings of the honeycomb. In keeping them there is great reward. Let them not rule and have control over me. Then I will be blameless (complete), And I shall be acquitted of great transgression. Be acceptable and pleasing in Your sight, O L ord , my [firm, immovable] rock and my Redeemer.
Day after day pours forth speech,
There is no speech, nor are there [spoken] words [from the stars];
Yet their voice [in quiet evidence] has gone out through all the earth,
Which is as a bridegroom coming out of his chamber;
The sun"s rising is from one end of the heavens,
The law of the L ord is perfect (flawless), restoring and refreshing the soul;
The precepts of the L ord are right, bringing joy to the heart;
The fear of the L ord is clean, enduring forever;
They are more desirable than gold, yes, than much fine gold;
Moreover, by them Your servant is warned [reminded, illuminated, and instructed];
Who can understand his errors or omissions? Acquit me of hidden (unconscious, unintended) faults .
Also keep back Your servant from presumptuous (deliberate, willful) sins;
Let the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart

20.verse_text: May the L ord answer you (David) in the day of trouble! May the name of the God of Jacob set you securely on high [and defend you in battle]! And support and strengthen you from Zion! And accept your burnt offering. Selah. And fulfill all your plans. And in the name of our God we will set up our banners. May the L ord fulfill all your petitions. He will answer him from His holy heaven With the saving strength of His right hand. But we will remember and trust in the name of the L ord our God. But we have risen and stood upright.
May He send you help from the sanctuary (His dwelling place)
May He remember all your meal offerings
May He grant you your heart"s desire
We will sing joyously over your victory,
Now I know that the L ord saves His anointed;
Some trust in chariots and some in horses,
They have bowed down and fallen,
O L ord , save [the king]; May the King answer us in the day we call.

21.verse_text: O L ord the king will delight in Your strength, And in Your salvation how greatly will he rejoice! And You have not withheld the request of his lips. Selah. You set a crown of pure gold on his head. And You gave it to him, Long life forever and evermore. Splendor and majesty You bestow upon him. You make him joyful with the joy of Your presence. And through the lovingkindness (faithfulness, goodness) of the Most High he will never be shaken. Your right hand will reach those who hate you. The L ord will swallow them up in His wrath, And the fire will devour them. And their descendants from the sons of men. They devised a [malevolent] plot And they will not succeed. You will aim Your bowstring [of divine justice] at their faces. We will sing and praise Your power.
You have given him his heart"s desire,
For You meet him with blessings of good things;
His glory is great because of Your victory;
For You make him most blessed [and a blessing] forever;
For the king [confidently] trusts in the L ord ,
Your hand will reach out and defeat all your enemies;
You will make them as [if in] a blazing oven in the time of your anger;
Their offspring You will destroy from the earth,
For they planned evil against You;
For You will make them turn their backs [in defeat];
Be exalted, L ord , in Your strength;

22.verse_text: My God, my God, why have You forsaken me? Why are You so far from helping me, and from the words of my groaning? And by night, but I find no rest nor quiet. O You who are enthroned in [the holy place where] the praises of Israel [are offered]. They trusted and You rescued them. They trusted in You and were not disappointed or ashamed. I am the scorn of men and despised by the people. They [insultingly] open their lips, they shake their head, saying, Let Him rescue him, because He delights in him.' You made me trust when on my mother"s breasts. From my mother"s womb You have been my God. And there is no one to help. Strong bulls of Bashan have encircled me. Like a ravening and a roaring lion. And all my bones are out of joint. My heart is like wax; It is melted [by anguish] within me. And my [dry] tongue clings to my jaws; And You have laid me in the dust of death. A gang of evildoers has encircled me, They pierced my hands and my feet. They look, they stare at me. O You my help, come quickly to my assistance. My only life from the paw of the dog (the executioner). From the horns of the wild oxen You answer me. In the midst of the congregation I will praise You. All you descendants of Jacob, honor Him. Fear Him [with submissive wonder], all you descendants of Israel. Nor has He hidden His face from him; But when he cried to Him for help, He listened. I will pay my vows [made in the time of trouble] before those who [reverently] fear Him. Those who [diligently] seek Him and require Him [as their greatest need] will praise the L ord . May your hearts live forever! And all the families of the nations will bow down and worship before You, And He rules over the nations. All those who go down to the dust (the dead) will bow before Him, Even he who cannot keep his soul alive. They will tell of the Lord to the next generation. To a people yet to be born–that He has done it [and that it is finished].
O my God, I call out by day, but You do not answer;
But You are holy,
In You our fathers trusted [leaned on, relied on, and were confident];
They cried out to You and were delivered;
But I am [treated as] a worm [insignificant and powerless] and not a man;
All who see me laugh at me and mock me;
'He trusted and committed himself to the L ord , let Him save him.
Yet You are He who pulled me out of the womb;
I was cast upon You from birth;
Do not be far from me, for trouble is near;
Many [enemies like] bulls have surrounded me;
They open wide their mouths against me,
I am poured out like water,
My strength is dried up like a fragment of clay pottery;
For [a pack of] dogs have surrounded me;
I can count all my bones;
They divide my clothing among them And cast lots for my garment.
But You, O L ord , do not be far from me;
Rescue my life from the sword,
Save me from the lion"s mouth;
I will tell of Your name to my countrymen;
You who fear the L ord [with awe-inspired reverence], praise Him!
For He has not despised nor detested the suffering of the afflicted;
My praise will be of You in the great assembly.
The afflicted will eat and be satisfied;
All the ends of the earth will remember and turn to the L ord ,
For the kingship and the kingdom are the L ord " s
All the prosperous of the earth will eat and worship;
Posterity will serve Him;
They will come and declare His righteousness

23.verse_text: The L ord is my Shepherd [to feed, to guide and to shield me], I shall not want. He leads me beside the still and quiet waters. He leads me in the paths of righteousness for His name"s sake. I fear no evil, for You are with me; Your rod [to protect] and Your staff [to guide], they comfort and console me. My cup overflows. And I shall dwell forever [throughout all my days] in the house and in the presence of the L ord .
He lets me lie down in green pastures;
He refreshes and restores my soul (life);
Even though I walk through the [sunless] valley of the shadow of death,
You prepare a table before me in the presence of my enemies. You have anointed and refreshed my head with oil;
Surely goodness and mercy and unfailing love shall follow me all the days of my life,

24.verse_text: The earth is the L ord " s , and the fullness of it, The world, and those who dwell in it. And established it upon the streams and the rivers. And who may stand in His holy place? Who has not lifted up his soul to what is false, Nor has sworn [oaths] deceitfully. And righteousness from the God of his salvation. Who seek Your face, even [as did] Jacob. Selah. And be lifted up, ancient doors, That the King of glory may come in. The L ord strong and mighty, The L ord mighty in battle. And lift them up, ancient doors, That the King of glory may come in. The L ord of hosts, He is the King of glory [who rules over all creation with His heavenly armies]. Selah.
For He has founded it upon the seas
Who may ascend onto the mountain of the L ord ?
He who has clean hands and a pure heart,
He shall receive a blessing from the L ord ,
This is the generation (description) of those who diligently seek Him and require Him as their greatest need,
Lift up your heads, O gates,
Who is the King of glory?
Lift up your heads, O gates,
Who is [He then] this King of glory?

25.verse_text: To You, O L ord , I lift up my soul. Do not let me be ashamed or my hope in You be disappointed; Do not let my enemies triumph over me. Those who turn away from what is right and deal treacherously without cause will be ashamed (humiliated, embarrassed). Teach me Your paths. For You are the God of my salvation; For You [and only You] I wait [expectantly] all the day long. For they have been from of old. According to Your lovingkindness remember me, For Your goodness" sake, O L ord . Therefore He instructs sinners in the way. And He teaches the humble His way. To those who keep His covenant and His testimonies. Pardon my wickedness and my guilt, for they are great. He will teach him [through His word] in the way he should choose. And his descendants will inherit the land. And He will let them know His covenant and reveal to them [through His word] its [deep, inner] meaning. For He will bring my feet out of the net. For I am alone and afflicted. Bring me out of my distresses. And forgive all my sins. They hate me with cruel and violent hatred. Do not let me be ashamed or disappointed, For I have taken refuge in You. For I wait [expectantly] for You. Out of all his troubles.
O my God, in You I [have unwavering] trust [and I rely on You with steadfast confidence],
Indeed, none of those who [expectantly] wait for You will be ashamed;
Let me know Your ways, O L ord ;
Guide me in Your truth and teach me,
Remember, O L ord , Your [tender] compassion and Your lovingkindnesses,
Do not remember the sins of my youth or my transgressions;
Good and upright is the L ord ;
He leads the humble in justice,
All the paths of the L ord are lovingkindness and goodness and truth and faithfulness
For Your name"s sake, O L ord ,
Who is the man who fears the L ord [with awe-inspired reverence and worships Him with submissive wonder]?
His soul will dwell in prosperity and goodness,
The secret [of the wise counsel] of the L ord is for those who fear Him,
My eyes are continually toward the L ord ,
Turn to me [L ord ] and be gracious to me,
The troubles of my heart are multiplied;
Look upon my affliction and my trouble,
Look upon my enemies, for they are many;
Guard my soul and rescue me;
Let integrity and uprightness protect me,
O God, redeem Israel,

26.verse_text: Vindicate me, O L ord , for I have walked in my integrity; I have [relied on and] trusted [confidently] in the L ord without wavering and I shall not slip. Test my heart and my mind. And I have walked [faithfully] in Your truth. Nor seek companionship with pretenders (self-righteous hypocrites). And will not sit with the wicked. And I will go about Your altar, O L ord , And declare all Your wonders. And the place where Your glory dwells. Nor [sweep away] my life with men of bloodshed, And whose right hand is full of bribes. Redeem me and be merciful and gracious to me. In the congregations I will bless the L ord .
Examine me, O L ord , and try me;
For Your lovingkindness is before my eyes,
I do not sit with deceitful or unethical or worthless men,
I hate the company of evildoers,
I will wash my hands in innocence,
That I may proclaim with the voice of thanksgiving
O L ord , I love the habitation of Your house
Do not sweep my soul away with sinners,
In whose hands is a wicked scheme,
But as for me, I shall walk in my integrity;
My foot stands on a level place;

27.verse_text: The L ord is my light and my salvation– Whom shall I fear? The L ord is the refuge and fortress of my life– Whom shall I dread? My adversaries and my enemies, they stumbled and fell. My heart will not fear; Though war arise against me, Even in this I am confident. That I may dwell in the house of the L ord [in His presence] all the days of my life, To gaze upon the beauty [the delightful loveliness and majestic grandeur] of the L ord And to meditate in His temple. In the secret place of His tent He will hide me; He will lift me up on a rock. In His tent I will offer sacrifices with shouts of joy; I will sing, yes, I will sing praises to the L ord . Be gracious and compassionate to me and answer me. 'Your face, O L ord , I will seek [on the authority of Your word].' Do not turn Your servant away in anger; You have been my help; O God of my salvation! Yet the L ord will take me up [adopt me as His child]. And lead me on a level path Because of my enemies [who lie in wait]. For false witnesses have come against me; They breathe out violence. In the land of the living. Be strong and let your heart take courage; Yes, wait for and confidently expect the L ord .
When the wicked came against me to eat up my flesh,
Though an army encamp against me,
One thing I have asked of the L ord , and that I will seek:
For in the day of trouble He will hide me in His shelter;
And now my head will be lifted up above my enemies around me,
Hear, O L ord , when I cry aloud;
When You said, 'Seek My face [in prayer, require My presence as your greatest need],' my heart said to You,
Do not hide Your face from me, Do not abandon me nor leave me,
Although my father and my mother have abandoned me,
Teach me Your way, O L ord ,
Do not give me up to the will of my adversaries,
I would have despaired had I not believed that I would see the goodness of the L ord
Wait for and confidently expect the L ord ;

28.verse_text: To you I call, O L ord , My rock, do not be deaf to me, For if You are silent to me, I will become like those who go down to the pit (grave). As I lift up my hands and heart toward Your innermost sanctuary (Holy of Holies). And with those who do evil, Who speak peace with their neighbors, While malice and mischief are in their hearts. Repay them according to the deeds of their hands; Repay them what they deserve. Nor the deeds of His hands, He will tear them down and not rebuild them. Because He has heard the voice of my supplication. My heart trusts [with unwavering confidence] in Him, and I am helped; Therefore my heart greatly rejoices, And with my song I shall thank Him and praise Him. And He is the fortress of salvation to His anointed. Be their shepherd also, and carry them forever.
Hear the voice of my supplication (specific requests, humble entreaties) as I cry to You for help,
Do not drag me away with the wicked
Repay them according to their work and according to the evil of their practices;
Because they have no regard for the works of the L ord
The L ord is my strength and my [impenetrable] shield;
The L ord is their [unyielding] strength,
Save Your people and bless Your inheritance;

29.verse_text: Ascribe to the L ord , O sons of the mighty, Ascribe to the L ord glory and strength. Worship the L ord in the beauty and majesty of His holiness [as the creator and source of holiness]. The God of glory thunders; The L ord is over many waters. The voice of the L ord is full of majesty. Yes, the L ord breaks in pieces the cedars of Lebanon. And Sirion (Mount Hermon) like a young, wild ox. The L ord shakes the wilderness of Kadesh. And strips the forests bare; And in His temple all are saying, 'Glory!' Yes, the L ord sits as King forever. The L ord will bless His people with peace.
Ascribe to the L ord the glory due His name;
The voice of the L ord is upon the waters;
The voice of the L ord is powerful;
The voice of the L ord breaks the cedars;
He makes Lebanon skip like a calf,
The voice of the L ord rakes flames of fire (lightning).
The voice of the L ord shakes the wilderness;
The voice of the L ord makes the doe labor and give birth
The L ord sat as King at the flood;
The L ord will give [unyielding and impenetrable] strength to His people;

30.verse_text: I will extol and praise You, O L ord , for You have lifted me up, And have not let my enemies rejoice over me. I cried to You for help, and You have healed me. You have kept me alive, so that I would not go down to the pit (grave). And give thanks at the mention of His holy name. Weeping may endure for a night, But a shout of joy comes in the morning. 'I shall never be moved.' You hid Your face, and I was horrified. And to the Lord I made supplication (specific request). Will the dust praise You? Will it declare Your faithfulness [to man]? O L ord , be my helper.' You have taken off my sackcloth and clothed me with joy, O L ord my God, I will give thanks to You forever.
O L ord , You have brought my life up from Sheol (the nether world, the place of the dead);
Sing to the L ord , O you His godly ones,
For His anger is but for a moment, His favor is for a lifetime.
As for me, in my prosperity I said,
By Your favor and grace, O L ord , you have made my mountain stand strong;
I called to You, O L ord ,
'What profit is there in my blood (death), if I go down to the pit (grave)?
'Hear, O L ord , be gracious and show favor to me;
You have turned my mourning into dancing for me;
That my soul may sing praise to You and not be silent.

31.verse_text: In You, O L ord , I have placed my trust and taken refuge; Let me never be ashamed; Before the sons of man! In Your righteousness rescue me. Be my rock of refuge, And a strong fortress to save me. For Your name"s sake You will lead me and guide me. For You are my strength and my stronghold. You have redeemed me, O L ord , the God of truth and faithfulness. But I trust in the L ord [and rely on Him with unwavering confidence]. Because You have seen my affliction; You have taken note of my life"s distresses, You have set my feet in a broad place. My eye is clouded and weakened by grief, my soul and my body also. And my years with sighing; My strength has failed because of my iniquity, And even my body has wasted away. Especially to my neighbors, And an object of dread to my acquaintances; Those who see me on the street run from me. I am like a broken vessel. Terror is on every side; While they schemed together against me, They plotted to take away my life. I said, 'You are my God.' Rescue me from the hand of my enemies and from those who pursue and persecute me. Save me in Your lovingkindness. Let the wicked (godless) be put to shame, let them be silent in Sheol (the nether world, the place of the dead). Which speak insolently and arrogantly against the [consistently] righteous With pride and contempt. Which You have stored up for those who [reverently] fear You, Which You have prepared for those who take refuge in You, You keep them secretly in a shelter (pavilion) from the strife of tongues. For He has shown His marvelous favor and lovingkindness to me [when I was assailed] in a besieged city. 'I am cut off from Your eyes.' Nevertheless You heard the voice of my supplications (specific requests) When I cried to You [for help]. The L ord preserves the faithful [those with moral and spiritual integrity] And fully repays the [self-righteousness of the] arrogant. All you who wait for and confidently expect the L ord .
Incline Your ear to me, deliver me quickly;
Yes, You are my rock and my fortress;
You will draw me out of the net that they have secretly laid for me,
Into Your hand I commit my spirit;
I hate those who pay regard to vain (empty, worthless) idols;
I will rejoice and be glad in Your steadfast love,
And You have not given me into the hand of the enemy;
Be gracious and compassionate to me, O L ord , for I am in trouble;
For my life is spent with sorrow
Because of all my enemies I have become a reproach and disgrace,
I am forgotten like a dead man, out of mind;
For I have heard the slander and whispering of many,
But as for me, I trust [confidently] in You and Your greatness, O L ord ;
My times are in Your hands;
Make Your face shine upon Your servant;
Let me not be put to shame, O L ord , for I call on You;
Let the lying lips be mute,
How great is Your goodness,
In the secret place of Your presence You hide them from the plots and conspiracies of man;
Blessed be the L ord ,
As for me, I said in my alarm,
O love the L ord , all you His godly ones!
Be strong and let your hearts take courage,

32.verse_text: Blessed [fortunate, prosperous, favored by God] is he whose transgression is forgiven, And whose sin is covered. And in whose spirit there is no deceit. Through my groaning all the day long. And I did not hide my wickedness; I said, 'I will confess [all] my transgressions to the L ord '; And You forgave the guilt of my sin. Selah. Surely when the great waters [of trial and distressing times] overflow they will not reach [the spirit in] him. You surround me with songs and shouts of deliverance. Selah. I will counsel you [who are willing to learn] with My eye upon you. Whose trappings include bridle and rein to hold them in check, Otherwise they will not come near to you. But he who trusts in and relies on the L ord shall be surrounded with compassion and lovingkindness. Shout for joy, all you upright in heart.
Blessed is the man to whom the L ord does not impute wickedness,
When I kept silent about my sin , my body wasted away
For day and night Your hand [of displeasure] was heavy upon me; My energy (vitality, strength) was drained away as with the burning heat of summer. Selah.
I acknowledged my sin to You,
Therefore, let everyone who is godly pray to You [for forgiveness] in a time when You [are near and] may be found;
You are my hiding place; You, L ord , protect me from trouble;
I will instruct you and teach you in the way you should go;
Do not be like the horse or like the mule which have no understanding,
Many are the sorrows of the wicked,
Be glad in the L ord and rejoice, you righteous [who actively seek right standing with Him];

33.verse_text: Rejoice in the L ord , you righteous ones; Praise is becoming and appropriate for those who are upright [in heart–those with moral integrity and godly character]. Sing praises to Him with the harp of ten strings. Play skillfully [on the strings] with a loud and joyful sound. And all His work is done in faithfulness. The earth is full of the lovingkindness of the L ord . And all their host by the breath of His mouth. He puts the deeps in storehouses. Let all the inhabitants of the world stand in awe of Him. He commanded, and it stood fast. He makes the thoughts and plans of the people ineffective. The thoughts and plans of His heart through all generations. The people whom He has chosen as His own inheritance. He sees all the sons of man; Upon all the inhabitants of the earth– Who considers and understands all that they do. A warrior is not rescued by his great strength. Nor does it deliver anyone by its great strength. On those who hope [confidently] in His compassion and lovingkindness, And keep them alive in famine. He is our help and our shield. Because we trust [lean on, rely on, and are confident] in His holy name.
Give thanks to the L ord with the lyre;
Sing to Him a new song;
For the word of the L ord is right;
He loves righteousness and justice;
By the word of the L ord were the heavens made,
He gathers the waters of the sea together as in a wineskin;
Let all the earth fear and worship the L ord ;
For He spoke, and it was done;
The L ord nullifies the counsel of the nations;
The counsel of the L ord stands forever,
Blessed [fortunate, prosperous, and favored by God] is the nation whose God is the L ord ,
The L ord looks [down] from heaven;
From His dwelling place He looks closely
He who fashions the hearts of them all,
The king is not saved by the great size of his army;
A horse is a false hope for victory;
Behold, the eye of the L ord is upon those who fear Him [and worship Him with awe-inspired reverence and obedience],
To rescue their lives from death
We wait [expectantly] for the L ord ;
For in Him our heart rejoices,
Let Your [steadfast] lovingkindness, O L ord , be upon us, In proportion as we have hoped in You.

34.verse_text: I will bless the L ord at all times; His praise shall continually be in my mouth. The humble and downtrodden will hear it and rejoice. And let us lift up His name together. And delivered me from all my fears. Their faces will never blush in shame or confusion. And saved him from all his troubles. And He rescues [each of] them. How blessed [fortunate, prosperous, and favored by God] is the man who takes refuge in Him. For to those who fear Him there is no want. But they who seek the L ord will not lack any good thing. I will teach you to fear the L ord [with awe-inspired reverence and worship Him with obedience]. And loves many days, that he may see good? And your lips from speaking deceit. Seek peace and pursue it. And His ears are open to their cry. To cut off the memory of them from the earth. And rescues them from all their distress and troubles. And He saves those who are crushed in spirit (contrite in heart, truly sorry for their sin). But the L ord rescues him from them all. Not one of them is broken. And those who hate the righteous will be held guilty and will be condemned. And none of those who take refuge in Him will be condemned.
My soul makes its boast in the L ord ;
O magnify the L ord with me,
I sought the L ord [on the authority of His word], and He answered me,
They looked to Him and were radiant;
This poor man cried, and the L ord heard him
The angel of the L ord encamps around those who fear Him [with awe-inspired reverence and worship Him with obedience],
O taste and see that the L ord [our God] is good;
O [reverently] fear the L ord , you His saints (believers, holy ones);
The young lions lack [food] and grow hungry,
Come, you children, listen to me;
Who is the man who desires life
Keep your tongue from evil
Turn away from evil and do good;
The eyes of the L ord are toward the righteous [those with moral courage and spiritual integrity]
The face of the L ord is against those who do evil,
When the righteous cry [for help], the L ord hears
The L ord is near to the heartbroken
Many hardships and perplexing circumstances confront the righteous,
He keeps all his bones;
Evil will cause the death of the wicked,
The L ord redeems the soul of His servants,

35.verse_text: Contend, O L ord , with those who contend with me; Fight against those who fight against me. And stand up for my help. Say to my soul, 'I am your salvation.' Let those be turned back [in defeat] and humiliated who plot evil against me. With the angel of the L ord driving them on. With the angel of the L ord pursuing and harassing them. Without cause they dug a pit [of destruction] for my life. Let the net he hid for me catch him; Into that very destruction let him fall. It shall rejoice in His salvation. Who rescues the afflicted from him who is too strong for him [to resist alone], And the afflicted and the needy from him who robs him?' They ask me of things that I do not know. To the sorrow of my soul. I humbled my soul with fasting, And I prayed with my head bowed on my chest. I bowed down in mourning, as one who sorrows for his mother. The slanderers whom I did not know gathered against me; They slandered and reviled me without ceasing. They gnashed at me with their teeth [in malice]. Rescue my life from their destructions, My only life from the young lions. I will praise You among a mighty people. Nor let those who hate me without cause wink their eye [maliciously]. But they devise deceitful words [half-truths and lies] against those who are quiet in the land. They say, 'Aha, aha, our eyes have seen it!' O Lord, do not be far from me. And to my cause, my God and my Lord. And do not let them rejoice over me. Do not let them say, 'We have swallowed him up and destroyed him.' Let those be clothed with shame and dishonor who magnify themselves over me. Let them say continually, 'Let the L ord be magnified, who delights and takes pleasure in the prosperity of His servant.' And Your praise all the day long.
Take hold of shield and buckler ( small shield),
Draw also the spear and javelin to meet those who pursue me.
Let those be ashamed and dishonored who seek my life;
Let them be [blown away] like chaff before the wind [worthless, without substance],
Let their way be dark and slippery,
For without cause they hid their net for me;
Let destruction come upon my enemy by surprise;
Then my soul shall rejoice in the L ord ;
All my bones will say, 'L ord , who is like You,
Malicious witnesses rise up;
They repay me evil for good,
But as for me, when they were sick, my clothing was sackcloth (mourning garment);
I behaved as if grieving for my friend or my brother;
But in my stumbling they rejoiced and gathered together [against me];
Like godless jesters at a feast,
L ord , how long will You look on [without action]?
I will give You thanks in the great congregation;
Do not let those who are wrongfully my enemies rejoice over me;
For they do not speak peace,
They open their mouths wide against me;
You have seen this, O L ord ; do not keep silent.
Wake Yourself up, and arise to my right
Judge me, O L ord my God, according to Your righteousness and justice;
Do not let them say in their heart, 'Aha, that is what we wanted!'
Let those be ashamed and humiliated together who rejoice at my distress;
Let them shout for joy and rejoice, who favor my vindication and want what is right for me;
And my tongue shall declare Your righteousness (justice),

36.verse_text: Transgression speaks [like an oracle] to the wicked (godless) [deep] within his heart; There is no fear (dread) of God before his eyes. Thinking that his sinfulness will not be discovered and hated [by God]. He has ceased to be wise and to do good. He sets himself on a path that is not good; He does not reject or despise evil. Your faithfulness [reaches] to the clouds. Your judgments are like the great deep. O L ord , You preserve man and beast. The children of men take refuge in the shadow of Your wings. And You allow them to drink from the river of Your delights. In Your light we see light. And Your righteousness (salvation) to the upright in heart. And do not let the hand of the wicked drive me away. They have been thrust down and cannot rise.
For he flatters and deceives himself in his own eyes
The words of his mouth are wicked and deceitful;
He plans wrongdoing on his bed;
Your lovingkindness and graciousness, O L ord , extend to the skies,
Your righteousness is like the mountains of God,
How precious is Your lovingkindness, O God!
They drink their fill of the abundance of Your house;
For with You is the fountain of life [the fountain of life-giving water];
O continue Your lovingkindness to those who know You,
Do not let the foot of the proud [person] overtake me,
There those who [are perverse and] do evil have fallen;

37.verse_text: Do not worry because of evildoers, Nor be envious toward wrongdoers; And fade like the green herb. Dwell in the land and feed [securely] on His faithfulness. And He will give you the desires and petitions of your heart. Trust in Him also and He will do it. And your judgment like [the shining of] the noonday [sun]. Do not fret (whine, agonize) because of him who prospers in his way, Because of the man who carries out wicked schemes. Do not fret; it leads only to evil. But those who wait for the L ord , they will inherit the land. Though you look carefully where he used to be, he will not be [found]. And will delight themselves in abundant prosperity and peace. And gnashes at him with his teeth. For He sees that his day [of defeat] is coming. To cast down the afflicted and the needy, To slaughter those who are upright in conduct [those with personal integrity and godly character]. And their bow will be broken. Than the abundance (riches) of many wicked (godless). But the L ord upholds and sustains the righteous [who seek Him]. And their inheritance will continue forever. And in the days of famine they will have plenty and be satisfied. They vanish–like smoke they vanish away. But the righteous is gracious and kind and gives. But those cursed by Him will be cut off. And He delights in his way [and blesses his path]. Because the L ord is the One who holds his hand and sustains him. Yet I have not seen the righteous (those in right standing with God) abandoned Or his descendants pleading for bread. And his descendants are a blessing. And you will dwell [securely in the land] forever. And does not abandon His saints (faithful ones); They are preserved forever, But the descendants of the wicked will [in time] be cut off. And live in it forever. And his tongue speaks justice and truth. Not one of his steps will slip. And seeks to kill him. Or let him be condemned when he is judged. And He will exalt you to inherit the land; [In the end] when the wicked are cut off, you will see it. Spreading and flaunting himself like a cedar in its native soil, I sought him, but he could not be found. There is a [good] future for the man of peace [because a life of honor blesses one"s descendants]. The future of the wicked will be cut off. He is their refuge and stronghold in the time of trouble. He rescues them from the wicked and saves them, Because they take refuge in Him.
For they will wither quickly like the grass,
Trust [rely on and have confidence] in the L ord and do good;
Delight yourself in the L ord ,
Commit your way to the L ord ;
He will make your righteousness [your pursuit of right standing with God] like the light,
Be still before the L ord ; wait patiently for Him and entrust yourself to Him;
Cease from anger and abandon wrath;
For those who do evil will be cut off,
For yet a little while and the wicked one will be gone [forever];
But the humble will [at last] inherit the land
The wicked plots against the righteous
The Lord laughs at him [the wicked one–the one who oppresses the righteous],
The wicked have drawn the sword and bent their bow
The sword [of the ungodly] will enter their own heart,
Better is the little of the righteous [who seek the will of God]
For the arms of the wicked will be broken,
The L ord knows the days of the blameless,
They will not be ashamed in the time of evil,
But the wicked (ungodly) will perish, And the enemies of the L ord will be like the glory of the pastures and like the fat of lambs [that is consumed in smoke],
The wicked borrows and does not pay back,
For those blessed by God will [at last] inherit the land,
The steps of a [good and righteous] man are directed and established by the L ord ,
When he falls, he will not be hurled down,
I have been young and now I am old,
All day long he is gracious and lends,
Depart from evil and do good;
For the L ord delights in justice
The righteous will inherit the land
The mouth of the righteous proclaims wisdom,
The law of his God is in his heart;
The wicked lies in wait for the righteous
The L ord will not leave him in his hand
Wait for and expect the L ord and keep His way,
I have seen a wicked, violent man [with great power]
Yet he passed away, and lo, he was no more;
Mark the blameless man [who is spiritually complete], and behold the upright [who walks in moral integrity];
As for transgressors, they will be completely destroyed;
But the salvation of the righteous is from the L ord ;
The L ord helps them and rescues them;

38.verse_text: O L ord , do not rebuke me in Your wrath, Nor discipline me in Your burning anger. And Your hand has pressed down on me and greatly disciplined me. There is no health in my bones because of my sin. As a heavy burden they weigh too much for me. Because of my foolishness. I go about mourning all day long. And there is no health in my flesh. I groan because of the disquiet and moaning of my heart. And my sighing is not hidden from You. And as for the light of my eyes, even that has also gone from me. And my neighbors stand far away. And those who seek to injure me threaten mischievous things and destruction; They devise treachery all the day long. I am like a mute man who does not open his mouth. In whose mouth are no arguments. You will answer, O Lord my God. Who, when my foot slips, would boast against me.' My sorrow is continually before me. I am filled with anxiety because of my sin. And those who hate me without cause are many. Because I follow what is good. O my God, do not be far from me. O Lord, my Salvation.
For Your arrows have sunk into me and penetrate deeply,
There is no soundness in my flesh because of Your indignation;
For my iniquities have gone over my head [like the waves of a flood];
My wounds are loathsome and foul
I am bent over and greatly bowed down;
For my sides are filled with burning,
I am numb and greatly bruised [deadly cold and completely worn out];
Lord, all my desire is before You;
My heart throbs violently, my strength fails me;
My loved ones and my friends stand aloof from my plague;
Those who seek my life lay snares for me,
But I, like a deaf man, do not hear;
Yes, I am like a man who does not hear,
For in You, O L ord , I hope;
For I pray, 'May they not rejoice over me,
For I am ready to fall;
For I do confess my guilt and iniquity;
But my [numerous] enemies are vigorous and strong,
They repay evil for good, they attack and try to kill me,
Do not abandon me, O L ord ;
Make haste to help me,

39.verse_text: I said, 'I will guard my ways That I may not sin with my tongue; I will muzzle my mouth While the wicked are in my presence.' I refrained even from good, While I was musing the fire burned; Then I spoke with my tongue: And [to appreciate] the extent of my days; Let me know how frail I am [how transient is my stay here]. And my lifetime is as nothing in Your sight. Surely every man at his best is a mere breath [a wisp of smoke, a vapor that vanishes]! Selah. Surely they make an uproar for nothing; Each one builds up riches, not knowing who will receive them. My hope [my confident expectation] is in You. Do not make me the scorn and reproach of the [self-righteous, arrogant] fool. Because it is You who has done it. I am wasting away because of the conflict and opposition of Your hand. You consume like a moth what is precious to him; Surely every man is a mere breath [a wisp of smoke, a vapor that vanishes]. Selah. Do not be silent at my tears; For I am Your temporary guest, A sojourner like all my fathers. Before I depart and am no more.'
I was mute and silent [before my enemies], And my distress grew worse.
My heart was hot within me.
'L ord , let me know my [life"s] end
Behold, You have made my days as [short as] hand widths,
Surely every man walks around like a shadow [in a charade];
'And now, Lord, for what do I expectantly wait?
Save me from all my transgressions;
I am mute, I do not open my mouth,
With rebukes You discipline man for sin;
'Hear my prayer, O L ord , and listen to my cry;
O look away from me, that I may smile and again know joy

40.verse_text: I waited patiently and expectantly for the L ord ; And He inclined to me and heard my cry. And He set my feet upon a rock, steadying my footsteps and establishing my path. Many will see and fear [with great reverence] And will trust confidently in the L ord . And does not regard the proud nor those who lapse into lies. And Your thoughts toward us; There is none to compare with You. If I would declare and speak of your wonders, They would be too many to count. You have opened my ears and given me the capacity to hear [and obey Your word]; Burnt offerings and sin offerings You do not require. In the scroll of the book it is written of me. Your law is within my heart.' Behold, I will not restrain my lips [from proclaiming Your righteousness], As You know, O L ord . I have proclaimed Your faithfulness and Your salvation. I have not concealed Your lovingkindness and Your truth from the great assembly. Your lovingkindness and Your truth will continually preserve me. My sins have overtaken me, so that I am not able to see. They are more numerous than the hairs of my head, And my heart has failed me. O L ord , make haste to help me. Who seek my life to destroy it; Let those be turned back [in defeat] and dishonored Who delight in my hurt. Who say to me, 'Aha, aha [rejoicing in my misfortune]!' Let those who love Your salvation say continually, 'The L ord be magnified!' Still the Lord takes thought and is mindful of me. You are my help and my rescuer. O my God, do not delay.
He brought me up out of a horrible pit [of tumult and of destruction], out of the miry clay,
He put a new song in my mouth, a song of praise to our God;
Blessed [fortunate, prosperous, and favored by God] is the man who makes the L ord his trust,
Many, O L ord my God, are the wonderful works which You have done,
Sacrifice and meal offering You do not desire, nor do You delight in them;
Then I said, 'Behold, I come [to the throne];
I delight to do Your will, O my God;
I have proclaimed good news of righteousness [and the joy that comes from obedience to You] in the great assembly;
I have not concealed Your righteousness within my heart;
Do not withhold Your compassion and tender mercy from me, O L ord ;
For innumerable evils have encompassed me;
Be pleased, O L ord , to save me;
Let those be ashamed and humiliated together
Let those be appalled and desolate because of their shame
Let all who seek You rejoice and be glad in You;
Even though I am afflicted and needy,

41.verse_text: Blessed [by God"s grace and compassion] is he who considers the helpless; The L ord will save him in the day of trouble. And he will be called blessed in the land; You do not hand him over to the desire of his enemies. In his illness, You will restore him to health. Heal my soul, for I have sinned against You.' 'When will he die and his name perish?' While his heart gathers malicious gossip [against me]; When he goes away, he tells it [everywhere]. Against me they devise my hurt [imagining the worst for me], saying, And when he lies down, he will not rise up again.' Who ate my bread, Has lifted up his heel against me [betraying me]. So that I may repay them. Because my enemy does not shout in triumph over me. And You set me in Your presence forever. From everlasting to everlasting [from this age to the next, and forever]. Amen and Amen (so be it).
The L ord will protect him and keep him alive;
The L ord will sustain and strengthen him on his sickbed;
As for me, I said, 'O L ord , be gracious to me;
My enemies speak evil of me, saying,
And when one comes to see me, he speaks empty words,
All who hate me whisper together about me;
'A wicked thing is poured out upon him and holds him;
Even my own close friend in whom I trusted,
But You, O L ord , be gracious to me and restore me [to health],
By this I know that You favor and delight in me,
As for me, You uphold me in my integrity,
Blessed be the L ord , the God of Israel,

42.verse_text: As the deer pants [longingly] for the water brooks, So my soul pants [longingly] for You, O God. The help of my countenance and my God. When will I come and see the face of God? While they say to me all day long, 'Where is your God?' How I used to go along before the great crowd of people and lead them in procession to the house of God [like a choirmaster before his singers, timing the steps to the music and the chant of the song], With the voice of joy and thanksgiving, a great crowd keeping a festival. And why have you become restless and disturbed within me? Hope in God and wait expectantly for Him, for I shall again praise Him For the help of His presence. Therefore I will [fervently] remember You from the land of the Jordan And the peaks of [Mount] Hermon, from Mount Mizar. All Your breakers and Your waves have rolled over me. And in the night His song will be with me, A prayer to the God of my life. Why do I go mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?' While they say continually to me, 'Where is your God?' Why have you become restless and disquieted within me? Hope in God and wait expectantly for Him, for I shall yet praise Him,
My soul (my life, my inner self) thirsts for God, for the living God.
My tears have been my food day and night,
These things I [vividly] remember as I pour out my soul;
Why are you in despair, O my soul?
O my God, my soul is in despair within me [the burden more than I can bear];
Deep calls to deep at the [thundering] sound of Your waterfalls;
Yet the L ord will command His lovingkindness in the daytime,
I will say to God my rock, 'Why have You forgotten me?
As a crushing of my bones [with a sword], my adversaries taunt me,
Why are you in despair, O my soul?

43.verse_text: Judge and vindicate me, O God; plead my case against an ungodly nation. O rescue me from the deceitful and unjust man! Why do I go mourning because of the oppression of the enemy? Let them bring me to Your holy hill And to Your dwelling places. To God, my exceeding joy; With the lyre I will praise You, O God, my God! And why are you restless and disturbed within me? Hope in God and wait expectantly for Him, for I shall again praise Him,
For You are the God of my strength [my stronghold–in whom I take refuge]; why have You rejected me?
O send out Your light and Your truth, let them lead me;
Then I will go to the altar of God,
Why are you in despair, O my soul? The help of my [sad] countenance and my God.

44.verse_text: We have heard with our ears, O God, Our fathers have told us The work You did in their days, In the days of old. Then you planted and established them (Israel); [It was by Your power that] You uprooted the [pagan] peoples, Then You spread them abroad. Nor did their own arm save them, But Your right hand and Your arm and the light of Your presence, Because You favored and delighted in them. Command victories and deliverance for Jacob (Israel). Through Your name we will trample down those who rise up against us. Nor will my sword save me. And You have put them to shame and humiliated those who hate us. And we will praise and give thanks to Your name forever. Selah. And You do not go out with our armies [to lead us to victory]. And those who hate us have taken spoil for themselves. And have scattered us [in exile] among the nations. And have not increased Your wealth by their sale. A scoffing and a derision to those around us. And humiliation has covered my face, Because of the presence of the enemy and the avenger. Nor have we been false to Your covenant [which You made with our fathers]. Nor have our steps wandered from Your path, And covered us with [the deep darkness of] the shadow of death. Or stretched out our hands to a strange god, For He knows the secrets of the heart. We are considered as sheep to be slaughtered. Awaken, do not reject us forever. And forget our affliction and our oppression? Our body clings to the ground. And ransom us for the sake of Your steadfast love.
You drove out the [pagan] nations with Your own hand;
For our fathers did not possess the land [of Canaan] by their own sword,
You are my King, O God;
Through You we will gore our enemies [like a bull];
For I will not trust in my bow,
But You have saved us from our enemies,
In God we have boasted all the day long,
But now You have rejected us and brought us to dishonor,
You make us turn back from the enemy,
You have made us like sheep to be eaten [as mutton]
You sell Your people cheaply,
You have made us the reproach and taunt of our neighbors,
You make us a byword among the nations, A laughingstock among the people.
My dishonor is before me all day long,
Because of the voice of the taunter and reviler,
All this has come upon us, yet we have not forgotten You,
Our heart has not turned back,
Yet You have [distressingly] crushed us in the place of jackals
If we had forgotten the name of our God
Would not God discover this?
But for Your sake we are killed all the day long;
Awake! Why do You sleep, O Lord?
Why do You hide Your face
For our life has melted away into the dust;
Rise up! Come be our help,

45.verse_text: My heart overflows with a good theme; I address my psalm to the King. My tongue is like the pen of a skillful writer. Graciousness is poured upon Your lips; Therefore God has blessed You forever. In Your splendor and Your majesty! For the cause of truth and humility and righteousness; Let Your right hand guide You to awesome things. The peoples (nations) fall under You; Your arrows pierce the hearts of the King"s enemies. The scepter of uprightness is the scepter of Your kingdom. Therefore God, your God, has anointed You Above Your companions with the oil of jubilation. From ivory palaces stringed instruments have made You glad. At Your right hand stands the queen in gold from Ophir. Forget your people and your father"s house; Because He is your Lord, bow down and honor Him. The rich among the people will seek your favor. Her robe is interwoven with gold. The virgins, her companions who follow her, Will be brought to You. They will enter into the King"s palace. You shall make princes in all the land. Therefore the peoples will praise and give You thanks forever and ever.
You are fairer than the sons of men;
Strap Your sword on Your thigh, O mighty One,
And in Your majesty ride on triumphantly
Your throne, O God, is forever and ever;
You have loved righteousness (virtue, morality, justice) and hated wickedness;
All Your garments are fragrant with myrrh, aloes and cassia;
Kings" daughters are among Your noble ladies;
Hear, O daughter, consider and incline your ear [to my instruction]:
Then the King will desire your beauty;
The daughter of Tyre will come with a gift;
Glorious is the King"s daughter within [the palace];
She will be brought to the King in embroidered garments;
With gladness and rejoicing will they be led;
In place of your fathers will be your sons;
I will make Your name to be remembered in all generations;

46.verse_text: God is our refuge and strength [mighty and impenetrable], A very present and well-proved help in trouble. And though the mountains be shaken and slip into the heart of the seas, Though the mountains tremble at its roaring. Selah. The holy dwelling places of the Most High. God will help her when the morning dawns. He raised His voice, the earth melted. The God of Jacob is our stronghold [our refuge, our high tower]. Selah. Who has brought desolations and wonders on the earth. He breaks the bow into pieces and snaps the spear in two; He burns the chariots with fire. I will be exalted among the nations! I will be exalted in the earth.' The God of Jacob is our stronghold [our refuge, our high tower]. Selah.
Therefore we will not fear, though the earth should change
Though its waters roar and foam,
There is a river whose streams make glad the city of God,
God is in the midst of her [His city], she will not be moved;
The nations made an uproar, the kingdoms tottered and were moved;
The L ord of hosts is with us;
Come, behold the works of the L ord ,
He makes wars to cease to the end of the earth;
'Be still and know (recognize, understand) that I am God.
The L ord of hosts is with us;

47.verse_text: O clap your hands, all you people; Shout to God with the voice of triumph and songs of joy. He is a great King over all the earth. And nations under our feet. The glory and excellence of Jacob whom He loves. Selah. The L ord with the sound of a trumpet. Sing praises to our King, sing praises. Sing praises in a skillful psalm and with understanding. God sits on His holy throne. For the shields of the earth belong to God; He is highly exalted.
For the L ord Most High is to be feared [and worshiped with awe-inspired reverence and obedience];
He chooses our inheritance for us,
Sing praises to God, sing praises;
For God is the King of all the earth;
The princes of the people have gathered together as the people of the God of Abraham,

48.verse_text: Great is the L ord , and greatly to be praised, In the city of our God, His holy mountain. Is Mount Zion [the City of David] in the far north, The city of the great King. Has made Himself known as a stronghold. They [came and] passed by together. They were stricken with terror, they fled in alarm. And pain, as that of a woman in childbirth.
