You shattered the ships of Tarshish. In the city of the L ord of hosts, in the city of our God: God will establish her forever. Selah. In the midst of Your temple. So is Your praise to the ends of the earth; Your right hand is full of righteousness (rightness, justice). Let the daughters of Judah rejoice Because of Your [righteous] judgments. Count her towers, Go through her palaces, That you may tell the next generation [about her glory]. Our God forever and ever; He will be our guide even until death.
Fair and beautiful in elevation, the joy of all the earth,
For, lo, the kings assembled themselves,
They saw it, then they were amazed;
As we have heard, so have we seen
We have thought of Your lovingkindness, O God,
As is Your name, O God,
Walk about Zion, go all around her;

49.verse_text: Hear this, all peoples; Listen carefully, all inhabitants of the world, Rich and poor together: And the meditation of my heart will be understanding. On the lyre I will unfold my riddle. When the wickedness of those who would betray me surrounds me [on every side], And boast of the abundance of their riches? Nor give to God a ransom for him– And he should cease trying forever– That he should never see the pit (grave) and undergo decay. The fool and the stupid alike perish And leave their wealth to others. And their dwelling places to all generations; They have named their lands after their own names [ignoring God]. He is like the beasts that perish. And of those after them who approve [and are influenced by] their words. Selah. Death will be their shepherd; And the upright shall rule over them in the morning, So that they have no dwelling [on earth]. For He will receive me. Selah. When the wealth and glory of his house are increased; His glory will not descend after him. And though people praise you when you do well for yourself– They shall never again see the light. Yet who lacks [spiritual] understanding and a teachable heart, is like the beasts that perish.
Both low and high,
My mouth will speak wisdom,
I will incline my ear and consent to a proverb;
Why should I fear in the days of evil,
Even those who trust in and rely on their wealth
None of them can by any means redeem [either himself or] his brother,
For the ransom of his soul is too costly,
So that he should live on eternally,
For he sees that even wise men die;
Their inward thought is that their houses will continue forever,
But man, with all his [self] honor and pomp, will not endure;
This is the fate of those who are foolishly confident,
Like sheep they are appointed for Sheol (the nether world, the place of the dead); And their form and beauty shall be for Sheol to consume,
But God will redeem my life from the power of Sheol,
Be not afraid when [an ungodly] man becomes rich,
For when he dies he will carry nothing away;
Though while he lives he counts himself happy and prosperous–
He shall go to the generation of his fathers;
A man [who is held] in honor,

50.verse_text: The mighty One, God, the L ord , has spoken, And summoned the earth from the rising of the sun to its setting [from east to west]. God has shone forth. Fire devours before Him, And around Him a mighty tempest rages. And the earth, to judge His people: Those who have made a covenant with Me by sacrifice.' For God Himself is judge. Selah. O Israel, I will testify against you: I am God, your God. Your burnt offerings are continually before Me. Nor male goat from your folds. And the cattle on a thousand hills. For the world and all it contains are Mine. Or drink the blood of male goats? And pay your vows to the Most High; I will rescue you, and you shall honor and glorify Me.' 'What right have you to recite My statutes Or to take My covenant on your lips? And cast My words behind you [discarding them]. And you associate with adulterers. And your tongue frames deceit. You slander your own mother"s son. You thought that I was just like you. Now I will reprimand and denounce you and state the case in order before your eyes. Or I will tear you in pieces, and there will be no one to rescue [you]. And to him who orders his way rightly [who follows the way that I show him], I shall show the salvation of God.'
Out of Zion, the perfection of beauty,
May our God come and not keep silent;
He summons the heavens above,
'Gather My godly ones to Me,
And the heavens declare His righteousness,
'Hear, O My people, and I will speak;
I do not reprove you for your sacrifices;
I will accept no young bull from your house
For every beast of the forest is Mine,
I know every bird of the mountains, And everything that moves in the field is Mine.
If I were hungry, I would not tell you,
Shall I eat the flesh of bulls
Offer to God the sacrifice of thanksgiving
Call on Me in the day of trouble;
But to the wicked God says:
For you hate instruction and discipline
When you see a thief, you are pleased with him and condone his behavior,
You give your mouth to evil
You sit and speak against your brother;
These things you have done and I kept silent;
'Now consider this, you who forget God,
He who offers a sacrifice of praise and thanksgiving honors Me;

51.verse_text: Have mercy on me, O God, according to Your lovingkindness; According to the greatness of Your compassion blot out my transgressions. And cleanse me from my sin. My sin is always before me. And done that which is evil in Your sight, So that You are justified when You speak [Your sentence] And faultless in Your judgment. In sin my mother conceived me [and from my beginning I, too, was sinful]. And in the hidden part [of my heart] You will make me know wisdom. Wash me, and I will be whiter than snow. Let the bones which You have broken rejoice. And blot out all my iniquities. And renew a right and steadfast spirit within me. And do not take Your Holy Spirit from me. And sustain me with a willing spirit. And sinners shall be converted and return to You. Then my tongue will sing joyfully of Your righteousness and Your justice. That my mouth may declare Your praise. You are not pleased with burnt offering. A broken and contrite heart [broken with sorrow for sin, thoroughly penitent], such, O God, You will not despise. May You rebuild the walls of Jerusalem. In burnt offering and whole burnt offering; Then young bulls will be offered on Your altar.
Wash me thoroughly from my wickedness and guilt
For I am conscious of my transgressions and I acknowledge them;
Against You, You only, have I sinned
I was brought forth in [a state of] wickedness;
Behold, You desire truth in the innermost being,
Purify me with hyssop, and I will be clean;
Make me hear joy and gladness and be satisfied;
Hide Your face from my sins
Create in me a clean heart, O God,
Do not cast me away from Your presence
Restore to me the joy of Your salvation
Then I will teach transgressors Your ways,
Rescue me from bloodguiltiness, O God, the God of my salvation;
For You do not delight in sacrifice, or else I would give it;
My [only] sacrifice [acceptable] to God is a broken spirit;
By Your favor do good to Zion;
Then will You delight in the sacrifices of righteousness,

52.verse_text: Why do you boast of evil, O mighty man? The lovingkindness of God endures all day long. Like a sharp razor, working deceitfully. And falsehood more than speaking what is right. Selah. O deceitful tongue. He will take you away and tear you away from your tent, And uproot you from the land of the living. Selah. And will [scoffingly] laugh, saying, But trusted in the abundance of his riches, Taking refuge in his wealth.' I trust [confidently] in the lovingkindness of God forever and ever. I will wait on Your name, for it is good, in the presence of Your godly ones.
You love evil more than good,
You love all words that devour,
But God will break you down forever;
The righteous will see it and fear,
'Look, [this is] the man who would not make God his strength [his stronghold and fortress],
But as for me, I am like a green olive tree in the house of God;
I will thank You forever, because You have done it, [You have rescued me and kept me safe].

53.verse_text: The [empty-headed] fool has said in his heart, 'There is no God.' They are corrupt and evil, and have committed repulsive injustice; There is no one who does good. To see if there is anyone who understands, Who seeks after God [who requires Him, who longs for Him as essential to life]. Together they have become filthy and corrupt; There is no one who does good, no, not even one. They eat up My people as though they ate bread And have not called upon God. For God scattered the bones of him who besieged you; You have put them to shame, because God has rejected them. When God restores [the fortunes of] His people, Let Jacob rejoice, let Israel be glad.
God has looked down from heaven upon the children of men
Every one of them has turned aside and fallen away;
Have workers of wickedness no knowledge or no understanding?
There they were, in great terror and dread, where there had been no terror or dread;
Oh, that the salvation of Israel would come out of Zion!

54.verse_text: Save me, O God, by Your name; And vindicate me by Your [wondrous] power. Listen to the words of my mouth. And violent men have sought my life; They have not set God before them. Selah. The Lord is the sustainer of my soul [my upholder]. In Your faithfulness destroy them. I will give thanks and praise Your name, O L ord , for it is good. And my eye has looked with satisfaction (triumph) on my enemies.
For strangers have risen against me
Behold, God is my helper and ally;
He will pay back the evil to my enemies;
With a freewill offering I will sacrifice to You;
For He has rescued me from every trouble,

55.verse_text: Listen to my prayer, O God, And do not hide Yourself from my plea. I am restless and distraught in my complaint and distracted Because of the pressure of the wicked; For they bring down trouble on me, And in anger they persecute me. And the terrors of death have fallen upon me. Horror has overwhelmed me. I would fly away and be at rest. I would lodge in the [peace of the] wilderness. Selah. From the stormy wind and from the tempest.' For I have seen violence and strife in the city. Wickedness and mischief are in her midst. Oppression and deceit do not depart from her streets and market places. Then I could bear it; Nor is it one who has hated me who insolently exalts himself against me– Then I could hide from him. My companion and my familiar friend; Who walked to the house of God in company. Let them go down alive to Sheol (the nether world, the place of the dead), For evil [of every kind] is in their dwelling and in their hearts, in their midst. And the L ord will save me. And He will hear my voice. For there were many against me. Because in them there has been no change [of heart], And they do not fear God [at all]. But his heart was hostile; His words were softer than oil, Yet they were drawn swords. He will never allow the righteous to be shaken (slip, fall, fail). Men of blood and treachery will not live out half their days. But I will [boldly and unwaveringly] trust in You.
Listen to me and answer me;
Because of the voice of the enemy,
My heart is in anguish within me,
Fear and trembling have come upon me;
And I say, 'Oh, that I had wings like a dove!
I would wander far away,
I would hurry to my refuge [my tranquil shelter far away]
Confuse [my enemies], O Lord, divide their tongues [destroying their schemes],
Day and night they go around her walls;
Destruction is within her;
For it is not an enemy who taunts me–
But it is you, a man my equal and my counsel,
We who had sweet fellowship together,
Let death come deceitfully upon them;
As for me, I shall call upon God,
Evening and morning and at noon I will complain and murmur,
He has redeemed my life in peace from the battle that was against me,
God will hear and humble them, Even He who sits enthroned from old– Selah. He has broken his covenant [of friendship and loyalty].
He [my companion] has put out his hands against those who were at peace with him;
The words of his mouth were smoother than butter,
Cast your burden on the L ord [release it] and He will sustain and uphold you;
But You, O God, will bring down the wicked to the pit of destruction;

56.verse_text: Be gracious to me, O God, for man has trampled on me; All day long the adversary oppresses and torments me. For they are many who fight proudly against me. I will put my trust and faith in You. In God I have put my trust; I shall not fear. What can mere man do to me? All their thoughts are against me for evil. They watch my steps, As they have [expectantly] waited to take my life. In anger bring down the peoples, O God! Put my tears in Your bottle. Are they not recorded in Your book? This I know, that God is for me. In the L ord , whose word I praise, What can man do to me? I will give thank offerings to You. Yes, and my feet from stumbling, So that I may walk before God In the light of life.
My enemies have trampled upon me all day long,
In God, whose word I praise;
All day long they twist my words and say hurtful things;
They attack, they hide and lurk,
Cast them out because of their wickedness.
You have taken account of my wanderings;
Then my enemies will turn back in the day when I call;
In God, whose word I praise,
In God have I put my trust and confident reliance; I will not be afraid.
Your vows are binding upon me, O God;
For You have rescued my soul from death,

57.verse_text: Be gracious to me, O God, be gracious and merciful to me, For my soul finds shelter and safety in You, And in the shadow of Your wings I will take refuge and be confidently secure Until destruction passes by. Who accomplishes all things on my behalf [for He completes my purpose in His plan]. He calls to account him who tramples me down. Selah. God will send out His lovingkindness and His truth. I must lie among those who breathe out fire– The sons of men whose teeth are spears and arrows, And their tongue a sharp sword. Let Your glory and majesty be over all the earth. My very life was bowed down. They dug a pit before me; Into the midst of it they themselves have fallen. Selah. I will sing, yes, I will sing praises [to You]! Awake, harp and lyre! I will awaken the dawn. I will sing praises to You among the nations. And Your truth to the clouds. Let Your glory and majesty be over all the earth.
I will cry to God Most High,
He will send from heaven and save me;
Be exalted above the heavens, O God;
They set a net for my steps;
My heart is steadfast, O God, my heart is steadfast and confident!
I will praise and give thanks to You, O Lord, among the people;
For Your faithfulness and lovingkindness are great, reaching to the heavens,
Be exalted above the heavens, O God;

58.verse_text: Do you indeed speak righteousness, O gods (heavenly beings)? Do you judge fairly, O sons of men? On earth you deal out the violence of your hands. These go astray from birth, speaking lies [even twisted partial truths]. They are like the deaf horned viper that stops up its ear, Or of the skillful enchanter casting [cunning] spells. Break out the fangs of the young lions, O L ord . When he aims his arrows, let them be as headless shafts. Like the miscarriage of a woman which never sees the sun. He will sweep them away with a whirlwind, the green and the burning ones alike. He will wash his feet in the blood of the wicked. Surely there is a God who judges on the earth.'
No, in your heart you devise wrongdoing;
The wicked are estranged from the womb;
Their poison is like the venom of a serpent;
So that it does not listen to the voice of charmers,
O God, break their teeth in their mouth;
Let them flow away like water that runs off;
Let them be as a snail which melts away (secretes slime) as it goes along,
Before your cooking pots can feel the fire of thorns [burning under them as fuel],
The [unyieldingly] righteous will rejoice when he sees the vengeance [of God];
Men will say, 'Surely there is a reward for the righteous;

59.verse_text: Deliver me from my enemies, O my God; Set me securely on an inaccessibly high place away from those who rise up against me. And save me from bloodthirsty men. Fierce and powerful men [are uniting together to] launch an attack against me, Not for my wrongdoing nor for any sin of mine, O L ord . Stir Yourself to meet and help me, and see [what they are doing]! Arise to punish all the nations; Spare no one and do not be merciful to any who treacherously plot evil. Selah. And go [prowling] around the city. Swords [of sarcasm, ridicule, slander, and lies] are in their lips, For they say, 'Who hears us?' You scoff at and deride all the nations. For God is my stronghold [my refuge, my protector, my high tower]. God will let me look triumphantly on my enemies [who lie in wait for me]. Scatter them and make them wander [endlessly] back and forth by Your power, and bring them down, O Lord our shield! Let them even be trapped in their pride, And on account of the curses and lies which they tell. Let them know that God rules over Jacob (Israel) To the ends of the earth. Selah. And go [prowling] around the city. And growl all night if they are not satisfied. Yes, I will sing joyfully of Your lovingkindness in the morning; For You have been my stronghold And a refuge in the day of my distress. For God is my stronghold [my refuge, my protector, my high tower], the God who shows me [steadfast] lovingkindness.
Deliver me from those who practice wrongdoing,
Look! They lie in wait for my life;
They run and set themselves against me though there is no guilt in me;
You, O L ord God of hosts, the God of Israel,
They return at evening, they howl and snarl like dogs,
Look how they belch out [insults] with their mouths;
But You, O L ord , will laugh at them [in scorn];
O [God] my strength, I will watch for You;
My God in His [steadfast] lovingkindness will meet me;
Do not kill them, or my people will forget;
For the sin of their mouths and the words of their lips,
Destroy them in wrath, destroy them so that they may be no more;
They return at evening, they howl and snarl like dogs,
They wander around for food [to devour]
But as for me, I will sing of Your mighty strength and power;
To You, O [God] my strength, I will sing praises;

60.verse_text: O God, You have rejected us and cast us off. You have broken [down our defenses and scattered] us; You have been angry; O restore us and turn again to us. Heal its rifts, for it shakes and totters. You have given us wine to drink that makes us stagger and fall. A banner that may be displayed because of the truth. Selah. Save with Your right hand and answer us. 'I will rejoice, I will divide [the land of] Shechem and measure out the Valley of Succoth [west to east]. Ephraim is My helmet; Judah is My scepter. Over Edom I shall throw My shoe [in triumph]; Over Philistia I raise the shout [of victory].' Who will lead me to Edom? And will You not go out with our armies? For the help of man is worthless (ineffectual, without purpose). For He will trample down our enemies.
You have made the land quake, You have split it open;
You have made Your people experience hardship;
You have set up a banner for those who fear You [with awe-inspired reverence and submissive wonder–a banner to shield them from attack],
That Your beloved ones may be rescued,
God has spoken in His holiness [in His promises]:
Gilead is Mine, and Manasseh is Mine;
Who will bring me into the besieged city [of Petra]?
Have You not rejected us, O God?
Give us help against the enemy,
Through God we will have victory,

61.verse_text: Hear my cry, O God; Listen to my prayer. Lead me to the rock that is higher than I [a rock that is too high to reach without Your help]. A strong tower against the enemy. Let me take refuge in the shelter of Your wings. Selah. You have given me the inheritance of those who fear Your name [with reverence]. His years will be like many generations. Appoint lovingkindness and truth to watch over and preserve him. Paying my vows day by day.
From the end of the earth I call to You, when my heart is overwhelmed and weak;
For You have been a shelter and a refuge for me,
Let me dwell in Your tent forever;
For You have heard my vows, O God;
You will prolong the king"s life [adding days upon days];
He will sit enthroned forever before [the face of] God;
So I will sing praise to Your name forever,

62.verse_text: For God alone my soul waits in silence; From Him comes my salvation. My defense and my strong tower; I will not be shaken or disheartened. So that you may murder him, all of you, Like a leaning wall, like a tottering fence? They delight in lies. They bless with [the words of] their mouths, But inwardly they curse. Selah. For my hope is from Him. My fortress and my defense, I will not be shaken or discouraged. He is my rock of [unyielding] strength, my refuge is in God. Pour out your heart before Him. God is a refuge for us. Selah. In the balances they go up [because they have no measurable weight or value]; They are together lighter than a breath. And do not vainly hope in robbery; If riches increase, do not set your heart on them. Twice I have heard this: That power belongs to God. For You compensate every man according to [the value of] his work.
He alone is my rock and my salvation,
How long will you attack a man
They consult only to throw him down from his high position [to dishonor him];
For God alone my soul waits in silence and quietly submits to Him,
He only is my rock and my salvation;
On God my salvation and my glory rest;
Trust [confidently] in Him at all times, O people;
Men of low degree are only a breath (emptiness), and men of [high] rank are a lie (delusion).
Also to You, O Lord, belong lovingkindness and compassion,

63.verse_text: O God, You are my God; with deepest longing I will seek You; My soul [my life, my very self] thirsts for You, my flesh longs and sighs for You, In a dry and weary land where there is no water. To see Your power and Your glory. My lips shall praise You. I will lift up my hands in Your name. And my mouth offers praises [to You] with joyful lips. I meditate and thoughtfully focus on You in the night watches, And in the shadow of Your wings [where I am always protected] I sing for joy. Your right hand upholds me. Will [be destroyed and] go into the depths of the earth [into the underworld]. They will be a prey for foxes. Everyone who swears by Him [honoring the true God, acknowledging His authority and majesty] will glory, For the mouths of those who speak lies will be stopped.
So I have gazed upon You in the sanctuary,
Because Your lovingkindness is better than life,
So will I bless You as long as I live;
My soul [my life, my very self] is satisfied as with marrow and fatness,
When I remember You on my bed,
For You have been my help,
My soul [my life, my very self] clings to You;
But those who seek my life to destroy it
They will be given over to the power of the sword;
But the king will rejoice in God;

64.verse_text: Hear my voice, O God, in my complaint; Guard my life from the terror of the enemy. From the scheming of those who do wrong, They aim venomous words as arrows, Suddenly they shoot at him, without fear. They talk of laying snares secretly; They say, 'Who will discover us?' 'We are ready with a well-conceived plan.' For the inward thought and the heart of a man are deep (mysterious, unsearchable). Suddenly they will be wounded. Their own tongue is against them; All who gaze at them will shake the head [in scorn]. They will declare the work of God, And they will consider and wisely acknowledge what He has done. All the upright in heart will glory and offer praise.
Hide me from the secret counsel and conspiracy of the ungodly,
Who have sharpened their tongues like a sword.
To shoot from ambush at the blameless [one];
They encourage themselves in [their pursuit of] an evil agenda;
They devise acts of injustice, saying,
But God will shoot them with an [unexpected] arrow;
So they will be caused to stumble;
Then all men will fear [God"s judgment];
The righteous will rejoice in the L ord and take refuge in Him;

65.verse_text: To You belongs silence [the submissive wonder of reverence], and [it bursts into] praise in Zion, O God; And to You the vow shall be performed. To You all mankind comes. Yet as for our transgressions, You forgive them [removing them from Your sight]. To dwell in Your courts. We will be filled with the goodness of Your house, Your holy temple. You who are the trust and hope of all the ends of the earth and of the farthest sea; Being clothed with power, The roaring of their waves, And the tumult of the peoples, You make the dawn and the sunset shout for joy. You greatly enrich it; The stream of God is full of water; You provide their grain, when You have prepared the earth. You smooth its ridges; You soften it with showers, You bless its growth. And Your paths overflow. And the hills are encircled with joy. And the valleys are covered with grain; They shout for joy and they sing.
Wickedness and guilt prevail against me;
Blessed is the one whom You choose and bring near
By awesome and wondrous things You answer us in righteousness, O God of our salvation,
Who creates the mountains by His strength,
Who stills the roaring of the seas,
So they who dwell at the ends of the earth stand in awe of Your signs [the evidence of Your presence].
You visit the earth and make it overflow [with water];
You crown the year with Your bounty,
The pastures of the wilderness drip [with dew],
The meadows are clothed with flocks

66.verse_text: Shout joyfully to God, all the earth; Make His praise glorious. Because of the greatness of Your power Your enemies will pretend to be obedient to You. And will sing praises to You; They will praise Your name in song.' Selah. He is awesome in His deeds toward the children of men. They crossed through the river on foot; There we rejoiced in Him. His eyes keep watch on the nations; Do not let the rebellious exalt themselves. Selah. And make the sound of His praise be heard abroad, And does not allow our feet to slip or stumble. You have refined us as silver is refined. We went through fire and through water, Yet You brought us out into a [broad] place of abundance [to be refreshed]. I shall pay You my vows, And my mouth spoke as a promise when I was in distress. With the [sweet] smoke of rams; I will offer bulls with male goats. Selah. And I will tell what He has done for me. He was highly praised with my tongue. The Lord will not hear [me]; He has given heed to the voice of my prayer. Who has not turned away my prayer Nor His lovingkindness from me.
Sing of the honor and glory and magnificence of His name;
Say to God, 'How awesome and fearfully glorious are Your works!
All the earth will [bow down to] worship You [in submissive wonder],
Come and see the works of God,
He turned the sea into dry land;
Who rules by His might forever,
Bless our God, O peoples,
Who keeps us among the living,
For You have tested us, O God;
You brought us into the net; You laid a heavy burden [of servitude] on us.
You made men (charioteers) ride over our heads [in defeat];
I shall come into Your house with burnt offerings;
Which my lips uttered
I shall offer to You burnt offerings of fat lambs,
Come and hear, all who fear God [and worship Him with awe-inspired reverence and obedience],
I cried aloud to Him;
If I regard sin and baseness in my heart [that is, if I know it is there and do nothing about it],
But certainly God has heard [me];
Blessed be God,

67.verse_text: God be gracious and kind-hearted to us and bless us, And make His face shine [with favor] on us– Selah. Your salvation and deliverance among all nations. Let all the peoples praise You. For You will judge the people fairly And guide the nations on earth. Selah. Let all the peoples praise You. God, our God, blesses us. And all the ends of the earth shall fear Him [with awe-inspired reverence and submissive wonder].
That Your way may be known on earth,
Let the peoples praise You, O God;
Let the nations be glad and sing for joy,
Let the peoples praise You, O God;
The earth has yielded its harvest [as evidence of His approval];

68.verse_text: Let God arise, and His enemies be scattered; Let those who hate Him flee before Him. As wax melts before the fire, So let the wicked and guilty perish before [the presence of] God. Yes, let them rejoice with delight. Lift up a song for Him who rides through the desert– His name is the L ord –be in good spirits before Him. Is God in His holy habitation. He leads the prisoners into prosperity, Only the stubborn and rebellious dwell in a parched land. When You marched through the wilderness, Selah. The heavens also poured down rain at the presence of God; Sinai itself trembled at the presence of God, the God of Israel. You confirmed Your inheritance when it was parched and weary. O God, in Your goodness You provided for the poor. The women who proclaim the good news are a great host (army); And the beautiful woman who remains at home divides the spoil [left behind].' You [Israel] are like the wings of a dove [of victory] overlaid with silver, Its feathers glistening with gold [trophies taken from the enemy]. A [high] mountain of many summits is Mount Bashan [rising east of the Jordan]. At the mountain [of the city of Zion] which God has desired for His dwelling place? Yes, the L ord will dwell there forever. The Lord is among them as He was at Sinai, in holiness. You have received gifts among men, Even from the rebellious also, that the L ord God may dwell there. The God who is our salvation! Selah. The hairy scalp of one who goes on in his guilty ways. I will bring them back from the depths of the [Red] Sea, That the tongue of your dogs may have its share from your enemies.' The procession of my God, my King, into the sanctuary [in holiness]. Between them the maidens playing on tambourines. The L ord , you who are from [Jacob] the fountain of Israel. The princes of Judah and their company [the southern tribes], The princes of Zebulun and the princes of Naphtali [the northern tribes]. Show Yourself strong, O God, who acted on our behalf. [Pagan] kings will bring gifts to You [out of respect]. The herd of bulls (the leaders) with the calves of the peoples; Trampling underfoot the pieces of silver; He has scattered the peoples who delight in war. Ethiopia will quickly stretch out her hands [with the offerings of submission] to God. Sing praises to the Lord! Selah. Behold, He sends out His voice, a mighty and majestic voice. His majesty is over Israel And His strength is in the skies. The God of Israel gives strength and power to His people. Blessed be God!
As smoke is driven away, so drive them away;
But let the righteous be glad; let them be in good spirits before God,
Sing to God, sing praises to His name;
A father of the fatherless and a judge and protector of the widows,
God makes a home for the lonely;
O God, when You went out before Your people,
The earth trembled;
You, O God, sent abroad plentiful rain;
Your flock found a dwelling place in it;
The Lord gives the command [to take Canaan];
'The kings of the [enemies"] armies flee, they flee,
When you lie down [to rest] among the sheepfolds,
When the Almighty scattered [the Canaanite] kings in the land of Canaan, It was snowing on Zalmon. And to G od the Lord belong escapes from death [setting us free].
A mountain of God is the mountain of Bashan;
Why do you look with envy, mountains with many peaks,
The chariots of God are myriads, thousands upon thousands;
You have ascended on high, You have led away captive Your captives;
Blessed be the Lord, who bears our burden day by day,
God is to us a God of acts of salvation;
Surely God will shatter the head of His enemies,
The Lord said, 'I will bring your enemies back from Bashan;
That your foot may crush them in blood,
They have seen Your [solemn] procession, O God,
The singers go in front, the players of instruments last;
Bless God in the congregations, [give thanks, gratefully praise Him],
The youngest is there, Benjamin, ruling them,
Your God has commanded your strength [your power in His service and your resistance to temptation];
Because of Your temple at Jerusalem
Rebuke the beasts [living] among the reeds [in Egypt],
Princes and envoys shall come from Egypt;
Sing to God, O kingdoms of the earth,
To Him who rides in the highest heavens, the ancient heavens,
Ascribe strength to God;
O God, You are awesome and profoundly majestic from Your sanctuary;

69.verse_text: Save me, O God, For the waters have threatened my life [they have come up to my neck]. I have come into deep waters, where a flood overwhelms me. My eyes fail while I wait [with confident expectation] for my God. Those who would destroy me are powerful, being my enemies wrongfully; I am forced to restore what I did not steal. My wrongs are not hidden from You. Do not let those who seek You [as necessary for life itself] be dishonored through me, O God of Israel, Confusion and dishonor have covered my face. And an alien to my mother"s sons. And the [mocking] insults of those who insult You have fallen on me. It became my reproach. I became a byword [a mere object of scorn] to them. And I am the song of the drunkards. O God, in the greatness of Your favor and in the abundance of Your lovingkindness, Answer me with truth [that is, the faithfulness of Your salvation]. Let me be rescued from those who hate me and from the deep waters. Nor the deep waters swallow me up, Nor the pit [of Sheol] shut its mouth over me. According to the greatness of Your compassion, turn to me. For I am in distress; answer me quickly. Ransom me because of my enemies [so that they do not delight in my distress]. My adversaries are all before You [each one fully known]. I looked for sympathy, but there was none, And for comforters, but I found none. And for my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink. And when they are in peace [secure at their sacrificial feasts], may it become a trap. And make their loins shake continually [in terror and weakness]. And let [the fierceness of] Your burning anger overtake them. May no one dwell in their tents. And they tell of the pain of those whom You have pierced and wounded. And may they not be recorded with the righteous (those in right standing with God). May Your salvation, O God, set me [securely] on high. And magnify Him with thanksgiving. Or a young bull with horns and hoofs. You who seek God [requiring Him as your greatest need], let your heart revive and live. And does not despise His who are prisoners. The seas and everything that moves in them. That His servants may remain there and possess it. And those who love His name will dwell in it.
I have sunk in deep mire, where there is no foothold;
I am weary with my crying; my throat is parched;
Those who hate me without cause are more than the hairs of my head;
O God, You know my folly;
Do not let those who wait [confidently] for You be ashamed through me, O Lord G od of hosts;
Because for Your sake I have borne reproach;
I have become estranged from my brothers
For zeal for Your house has consumed me,
When I wept and humbled myself with fasting,
When I made sackcloth my clothing [as one in mourning],
They who sit in the [city"s] gate talk about me and mock me,
But as for me, my prayer is to You, O L ord , at an acceptable and opportune time;
Rescue me from the mire and do not let me sink;
Do not let the floodwater overwhelm me,
Answer me, O L ord , for Your lovingkindness is sweet and good and comforting;
Do not hide Your face from Your servant,
Draw near to my soul and redeem it;
You know my reproach and my shame and my dishonor [how I am insulted];
Reproach and insults have broken my heart and I am so sick.
They (self-righteous hypocrites) also gave me gall [poisonous and bitter] for my food,
May their table [with all its abundance and luxury] become a snare [to them];
May their eyes be dimmed so that they cannot see,
Pour out Your indignation on them,
May their encampment be desolate;
For they have persecuted him whom You have struck,
Add [unforgiven] iniquity to their iniquity [in Your book], And may they not come into Your righteousness.
May they be blotted out of the book of life [and their lives come to an end]
But I am sorrowful and in pain;
I will praise the name of God with song
And it will please the L ord better than an ox
The humble have seen it and are glad;
For the L ord hears the needy
Let heaven and earth praise Him,
For God will save Zion and rebuild the cities of Judah,
The descendants of His servants will inherit it,

70.verse_text: O God, come quickly to save me; O L ord , come quickly to help me! Who seek my life; Let them be turned back and humiliated Who delight in my hurt. Who say, 'Aha, aha!' May those who love Your salvation say continually, 'Let God be magnified!' Come quickly to me, O God! You are my help and my rescuer; O L ord , do not delay.
Let those be ashamed and humiliated
Let them be turned back because of their shame and disgrace
May all those who seek You [as life"s first priority] rejoice and be glad in You;
But I am afflicted and needy;

71.verse_text: In you, O L ord , I have put my trust and confidently taken refuge; Let me never be put to shame. Incline Your ear to me and save me. You have given the commandment to save me, For You are my rock and my fortress. From the grasp of the unrighteous and ruthless man. O Lord G od , You are my trust and the source of my confidence from my youth. You are He who took me from my mother"s womb and You have been my benefactor from that day. My praise is continually of You. For You are my strong refuge. And with Your glory all day long. Do not abandon me when my strength fails and I am weak. Those who watch for my life have consulted together, Pursue and seize him, for there is no one to rescue him .' O my God, come quickly to help me! Let them be covered with reproach and dishonor, who seek to injure me. And will praise You yet more and more. And of Your [deeds of] salvation all day long, For their number is more than I know. I will make mention of Your righteousness, Yours alone. And I still declare Your wondrous works and miraculous deeds. Until I declare Your [mighty] strength to this generation, Your power to all who are to come. You who have done great things; O God, who is like You, [who is Your equal]? Will revive and renew me again, And will bring me up again from the depths of the earth. And turn to comfort me. Your truth and faithfulness, O my God; To You I will sing praises with the lyre, O Holy One of Israel. And my soul, which You have redeemed. For they are ashamed, for they are humiliated who seek my injury.
In Your righteousness deliver me and rescue me;
Be to me a rock of refuge and a sheltering stronghold to which I may continually come;
Rescue me, O my God, from the hand of the wicked (godless),
For You are my hope;
Upon You have I relied and been sustained from my birth;
I am as a wonder to many,
My mouth is filled with Your praise
Do not cast me off nor send me away in the time of old age;
For my enemies have spoken against me;
Saying, 'God has abandoned him;
O God, do not be far from me;
Let those who attack my life be ashamed and consumed;
But as for me, I will wait and hope continually,
My mouth shall tell of Your righteousness
I will come with the mighty acts of the Lord G od [and in His strength];
O God, You have taught me from my youth,
And even when I am old and gray-headed, O God, do not abandon me,
Your righteousness, O God, reaches to the [height of the] heavens,
You who have shown me many troubles and distresses
May You increase my greatness (honor)
I will also praise You with the harp,
My lips will shout for joy when I sing praises to You,
My tongue also will speak of Your righteousness all day long;

72.verse_text: Give the king [knowledge of] Your judgments, O God, And [the spirit of] Your righteousness to the king"s son [to guide all his ways]. And Your afflicted with justice. And the hills, in [the establishment of] righteousness. Save the children of the needy And crush the oppressor, And as long as the moon [reflects light], throughout all generations. Like showers that water the earth. And peace abound until the moon is no more. And from the River [Euphrates] to the ends of the earth. The kings of Sheba and Seba will offer gifts. All nations will serve him. The afflicted and abused also, and him who has no helper. And he will save the lives of the needy. And their blood will be precious in His sight. And let them pray for him continually; Let them bless and praise him all day long. Its fruit will wave like [the cedars of] Lebanon, And those of the city will flourish like grass of the earth. May his name continue as long as the sun; And let men bless themselves by him; Let all nations call him blessed. Who alone does wonderful things. And may the whole earth be filled with His glory. Amen and Amen.
May he judge Your people with righteousness,
The mountains will bring peace and prosperity to the people,
May he bring justice to the poor among the people,
Let them fear You [with awe-inspired reverence and worship You with obedience] while the sun endures,
May he come down like rain on the mown grass,
In his days may the righteous flourish,
May he also rule from sea to sea
The nomads of the desert will bow before him, And his enemies will lick the dust.
The kings of Tarshish and of the islands will bring offerings;
Yes, all kings will bow down before him,
For he will rescue the needy when he cries for help,
He will have compassion on the poor and needy,
He will redeem their life from oppression and fraud and violence,
So may he live, and may the gold of Sheba be given to him;
There will be an abundance of grain in the soil on the top of the mountains;
May his name endure forever;
Blessed be the L ord God, the God of Israel,
Blessed be His glorious name forever;
The prayers of David son of Jesse are ended.

73.verse_text: Truly God is good to Israel, To those who are pure in heart. My steps had almost slipped. As I saw the prosperity of the wicked. Their body is fat and pampered. Nor are they plagued like mankind. Violence covers them like a garment [like a long, luxurious robe]. The imaginations of their mind run riot [with foolishness]. They speak loftily [with malice]. And their tongue swaggers through the earth. And waters of abundance [offered by the irreverent] are [blindly] drunk by them. Is there knowledge [of us] with the Most High?' Who always prosper and are at ease [in the world]; they have increased in wealth. And washed my hands in innocence. And punished every morning. I would have betrayed the generation of Your children. It was too great an effort for me and too painful Then I understood [for I considered] their end. You cast them down to destruction. They are completely swept away by sudden terrors! O Lord, when stirred, [You observe the wicked], You will despise their image. And I was pierced within [as with the fang of an adder], I was like a beast before You. You have taken hold of my right hand. And afterward receive me to honor and glory. And besides You, I desire nothing on earth. But God is the rock and strength of my heart and my portion forever. You have destroyed all those who are unfaithful and have abandoned You. I have made the Lord G od my refuge and placed my trust in Him, That I may tell of all Your works.
But as for me, my feet came close to stumbling,
For I was envious of the arrogant
For there are no pains in their death,
They are not in trouble as other men,
Therefore pride is their necklace;
Their eye bulges from fatness [they have more than the heart desires];
They mock and wickedly speak of oppression;
They set their mouth against the heavens,
Therefore his people return to this place,
They say, 'How does God know?
Behold, these are the ungodly,
Surely then in vain I have cleansed my heart
For all the day long have I been stricken,
If I had said, 'I will say this,' [and expressed my feelings],
When I considered how to understand this,
Until I came into the sanctuary of God;
Surely You set the wicked-minded and immoral on slippery places;
How they are destroyed in a moment!
Like a dream [which seems real] until one awakens,
When my heart was embittered
Then I was senseless and ignorant;
Nevertheless I am continually with You;
You will guide me with Your counsel,
Whom have I in heaven [but You]?
My flesh and my heart may fail,
For behold, those who are far from You will perish;
But as for me, it is good for me to draw near to God;

74.verse_text: O God, why have You rejected us forever? Why does Your anger smoke against the sheep of Your pasture? Which You have redeemed to be the tribe of Your inheritance; Remember Mount Zion, where You have dwelt. The enemy has damaged everything within the sanctuary. They have set up their own emblems for signs [of victory]. An axe in a forest of trees [to set a record of destruction]. They smash with hatchets and hammers. They have burned all the meeting places of God in the land. There is no longer any prophet [to guide us], Nor does any among us know for how long. Is the enemy to revile Your name forever? Remove Your hand from Your chest, destroy them! Working salvation in the midst of the earth. You gave him as food for the creatures of the wilderness. You dried up ever-flowing rivers. You have established and prepared the [heavenly] light and the sun. You have made summer and winter. And a foolish and impious people has spurned Your name. Do not forget the life of Your afflicted forever. For the dark places of the land are full of the habitations of violence. Let the afflicted and needy praise Your name. Remember how the foolish man scoffs at You all day long. The uproar of those who rise against You, which ascends continually [to Your ears].
Remember Your congregation, which You have purchased of old,
Turn your footsteps [quickly] toward the perpetual ruins;
In the midst of Your meeting place Your enemies have roared [with their battle cry];
It seems as if one had lifted up
And now all the carved work [of the meeting place]
They have burned Your sanctuary to the ground; They have profaned the dwelling place of Your name. You broke the heads of the sea monsters in the waters.
They said in their heart, 'Let us completely subdue them.'
We do not see our symbols;
O God, how long will the adversary scoff?
Why do You withdraw Your hand, even Your right hand [from judging the enemy]?
Yet God is my King of old,
You divided the [Red] Sea by Your strength;
You crushed the heads of Leviathan (Egypt);
You broke open fountains and streams;
The day is Yours, the night also is Yours;
You have defined and established all the borders of the earth [the divisions of land and sea and of the nations];
Remember this, O L ord , the enemy has scoffed,
Oh, do not hand over the soul of your turtledove to the wild beast;
Consider the covenant [You made with Abraham],
Let not the oppressed return dishonored;
Arise, O God, plead Your own cause;
Do not forget the [clamoring] voices of Your adversaries,

75.verse_text: We give thanks and praise to You, O God, we give thanks, For Your [wonderful works declare that Your] name is near; People declare Your wonders. I will judge with equity,' [says the L ord ]. It is I who will steady its pillars. Selah. And to the wicked, "Do not lift up the horn [of self-glorification]. Do not speak with a stiff neck." ' Nor from the desert comes exaltation. He puts down one and lifts up another. It is well mixed and fully spiced, and He pours out from it; And all the wicked of the earth must drain it and drink down to its dregs. I will sing praises to the God of Jacob. But the horns of the righteous will be lifted up.
'The earth and all the inhabitants of it melt [in tumultuous times].
I said to the arrogant, "Do not boast;"
Do not lift up your [defiant and aggressive] horn on high,
For not from the east, nor from the west,
For a cup [of His wrath] is in the hand of the L ord , and the wine foams;
But as for me, I will declare it and rejoice forever;
All the horns of the wicked He will cut off,

76.verse_text: God is known in Judah; His name is great in Israel. His dwelling place is in Zion. The shield, the sword, and the weapons of war. Selah. More majestic than the mountains of prey. They have slept the sleep [of death]; And none of the warriors could use his hands. Both rider and horse were cast into a dead sleep [of death]. Who may stand in Your presence when once You are angry? The earth feared and was quiet To save all the humble of the earth. Selah. With a remnant of wrath You will clothe and arm Yourself. Let all who are around Him bring gifts to Him who is to be feared [with awe-inspired reverence]. He is awesome and feared by the kings of the earth.
There He broke the flaming arrows,
The stouthearted have been stripped of their spoil,
At Your rebuke, O God of Jacob,
You, even You, are to be feared [with the submissive wonder of reverence];
You caused judgment to be heard from heaven;
For the wrath of man shall praise You;
Make vows to the L ord your God and fulfill them;
He will cut off the spirit of princes;

77.verse_text: My voice rises to God, and I will cry aloud; My voice rises to God, and He will hear me. My soul refused to be comforted. I sigh [in prayer], and my spirit grows faint. Selah. I am so troubled that I cannot speak. The years [of prosperity] of long, long ago. I will meditate with my heart, And my spirit searches: And will He never be favorable again? Have His promises ended for all time? Or has He in anger withdrawn His compassion? Selah. That the right hand of the Most High has changed [and His lovingkindness is withheld].' Yes, I will [wholeheartedly] remember Your wonders of old. And thoughtfully consider all Your [great and wondrous] deeds. What god is great like our God? You have demonstrated Your power among the people. The sons of Jacob and Joseph. Selah. The waters saw You, they were in anguish; The deeps also trembled. The skies sent out a sound [of rumbling thunder]; Your arrows (lightning) flashed here and there. The lightnings illumined the world; The earth trembled and shook. And Your paths through the great waters, And Your footprints were not traceable. By the hand of Moses and Aaron [to the promised goal].
In the day of my trouble I [desperately] sought the Lord; In the night my hand was stretched out [in prayer] without weariness;
I remember God; then I am disquieted and I groan;
You have held my eyelids open;
I have considered the ancient days,
I will remember my song in the night;
Will the Lord reject forever?
Has His lovingkindness ceased forever?
Has God forgotten to be gracious?
And I said, 'This is my grief,
I will [solemnly] remember the deeds of the L ord ;
I will meditate on all Your works
Your way, O God, is holy [far from sin and guilt].
You are the [awesome] God who works [powerful] wonders;
You have with Your [great] arm redeemed Your people,
The waters [of the Red Sea] saw You, O God;
The clouds poured down water;
The voice of Your thunder was in the whirlwind;
Your way [of escape for Your people] was through the sea,
You led Your people like a flock

78.verse_text: Listen, O my people, to my teaching; Incline your ears to the words of my mouth [and be willing to learn]. I will utter dark and puzzling sayings of old [that contain important truth]– And our fathers have told us. But [we will] tell to the generation to come the praiseworthy deeds of the L ord , And [tell of] His great might and power and the wonderful works that He has done. And appointed a law in Israel, Which He commanded our fathers That they should teach to their children [the great facts of God"s transactions with Israel], May arise and recount them to their children, And not forget the works of God, But keep His commandments, A stubborn and rebellious generation, A generation that did not prepare its heart to know and follow God, And whose spirit was not faithful to God. Yet they turned back in the day of battle. And refused to walk according to His law; And His miraculous wonders that He had shown them. In the land of Egypt, in the field of Zoan [where Pharaoh resided]. And He made the waters stand up like [water behind] a dam. And all the night with a light of fire. And gave them abundant [water to] drink like the ocean depths. And caused waters to run down like rivers. By rebelling against the Most High in the desert. By asking for food according to their [selfish] appetite. They said, 'Can God prepare [food for] a table in the wilderness? And the streams overflowed; Can He give bread also? Or will He provide meat for His people?' A fire was kindled against Jacob, And His anger mounted up against Israel, And they did not trust in His salvation (His power to save). And opened the doors of heaven; And gave them the grain of heaven. God sent them provision in abundance. And by His [unlimited] power He guided the south wind. And winged birds (quail) like the sand of the seas. Around their tents. He gave them what they craved. And while their food was in their mouths, And killed some of the strongest of them, And subdued the choice young men of Israel. For they did not believe in His wonderful and extraordinary works. And their years in sudden terror. And they returned [to Him] and searched diligently for God [for a time]. And the Most High God their Redeemer. And lied to Him with their tongues. Nor were they faithful to His covenant. Many times He restrained His anger And did not stir up all His wrath. A wind that goes and does not return. And grieved Him in the desert! And distressed the Holy One of Israel. Nor the day when He redeemed them from the enemy, And His wonders in the field of Zoan [where Pharaoh resided], And their streams, so that they could not drink. And frogs which destroyed them. And the fruit of their labor to the locust. And their sycamore trees with frost. And their flocks and herds to thunderbolts. His fury and indignation and distress, A band of angels of destruction [among them]. He did not spare their souls from death, But turned over their lives to the plague. The first and best of their strength in the tents [of the land of the sons] of Ham. And guided them in the wilderness like [a good shepherd with] a flock. But the sea engulfed their enemies. To this mountain [Zion] which His right hand had acquired. And allotted their land as an inheritance, measured out and partitioned; And He had the tribes of Israel dwell in their tents [the tents of those who had been dispossessed]. And did not keep His testimonies (laws). They were twisted like a warped bow [that will not respond to the archer"s aim]. And moved Him to jealousy with their carved images [by denying Him the love, worship, and obedience that is rightfully and uniquely His]. And utterly rejected Israel, [greatly hating her ways], The tent in which He had dwelled among men, And His glory into the hand of the enemy (the Philistines). And was infuriated with His inheritance (Israel). And His [bereaved] virgins had no wedding songs. And His widows could not weep. Like a [mighty] warrior who awakens from the sleep of wine [fully conscious of his power]. He subjected them to lasting shame and dishonor. And did not choose the tribe of Ephraim [in which the tabernacle stood]. Mount Zion, which He loved [to replace Shiloh as His capital]. Like the earth which He has established forever. And took him from the sheepfolds; To shepherd Jacob His people, And Israel His inheritance. And guided them with his skillful hands.
I will open my mouth in a parable [to instruct using examples];
Which we have heard and known,
We will not hide them from their children,
For He established a testimony (a specific precept) in Jacob
That the generation to come might know them, that the children still to be born
That they should place their confidence in God
And not be like their fathers–
The sons of Ephraim were armed as archers and carrying bows,
They did not keep the covenant of God
And they forgot His [incredible] works
He did marvelous things in the sight of their fathers
He divided the [Red] Sea and allowed them to pass through it,
In the daytime He led them with a cloud
He split rocks in the wilderness
He brought streams also from the rock [at Rephidim and Kadesh]
Yet they still continued to sin against Him
And in their hearts they put God to the test
Then they spoke against God;
Behold, He struck the rock so that waters gushed out
Therefore, when the L ord heard, He was full of wrath;
Because they did not believe in God [they did not rely on Him, they did not adhere to Him],
Yet He commanded the clouds from above
And He rained down manna upon them to eat
Man ate the bread of angels;
He caused the east wind to blow in the heavens
He rained meat upon them like the dust,
And He let them fall in the midst of their camp,
So they ate and were well filled,
Before they had satisfied their desire,
The wrath of God rose against them
In spite of all this they still sinned,
Therefore He consumed their days like a breath [in emptiness and futility]
When He killed [some of] them, then those remaining sought Him,
And they remembered that God was their rock,
Nevertheless they flattered Him with their mouths
For their heart was not steadfast toward Him,
But He, the source of compassion and lovingkindness, forgave their wickedness and did not destroy them;
For He [graciously] remembered that they were mere [human] flesh,
How often they rebelled against Him in the wilderness
Again and again they tempted God,
They did not remember [the miracles worked by] His [powerful] hand,
How He worked His miracles in Egypt
And turned their rivers into blood,
He sent among them swarms of flies which devoured them,
He also gave their crops to the grasshopper,
He destroyed their vines with [great] hailstones
He gave over their cattle also to the hailstones,
He sent upon them His burning anger,
He leveled a path for His anger [to give it free run];
He killed all the firstborn in Egypt,
But God led His own people forward like sheep
He led them safely, so that they did not fear;
So He brought them to His holy land,
He also drove out the nations before the sons of Israel
Yet they tempted and rebelled against the Most High God
They turned back and acted unfaithfully like their fathers;
For they provoked Him to [righteous] anger with their high places [devoted to idol worship]
When God heard this, He was filled with [righteous] wrath;
So that He abandoned the tabernacle at Shiloh,
And gave up His strength and power (the ark of the covenant) into captivity,
He also handed His people over to the sword,
The fire [of war] devoured His young men,
His priests [Hophni and Phinehas] fell by the sword,
Then the Lord awakened as from sleep,
He drove His enemies backward;
Moreover, He rejected the tent of Joseph,
But He chose the tribe of Judah [as Israel"s leader],
And He built His sanctuary [exalted] like the heights [of the heavens],
He also chose David His servant
From tending the ewes with nursing young He brought him
So David shepherded them according to the integrity of his heart;

79.verse_text: O God, the nations have invaded [the land of Your people] Your inheritance; They have defiled Your sacred temple; They have laid Jerusalem in ruins. The flesh of Your godly ones to the beasts of the earth. And there was no one to bury them. A derision and mockery to those who encircle us. Will Your jealousy [which cannot endure a divided allegiance] burn like fire? And on the kingdoms that do not call on Your name. And made his pasture desolate. Let Your compassion and mercy come quickly to meet us, For we have been brought very low. Rescue us, forgive us our sins for Your name"s sake. Let there be known [without delay] among the nations in our sight [and to this generation], Your vengeance for the blood of Your servants which has been poured out. According to the greatness of Your power keep safe those who are doomed to die. The taunts with which they have taunted You, O Lord. Will give You thanks forever; We will declare and publish Your praise from generation to generation.
They have given the dead bodies of Your servants as food to the birds of the heavens,
They have poured out their blood like water all around Jerusalem,
We have become an object of taunting to our neighbors [because of our humiliation],
How long, O L ord ? Will You be angry forever?
Pour out Your wrath on the [Gentile] nations that do not know You,
O do not remember against us the sins and guilt of our forefathers.
Help us, O God of our salvation, for the glory of Your name;
Why should the [Gentile] nations say, 'Where is their God?'
Let the groaning and sighing of the prisoner come before You;
And return into the lap of our neighbors sevenfold
So we Your people, the sheep of Your pasture,

80.verse_text: Hear us O Shepherd of Israel, You who lead Joseph like a flock; You who sit enthroned above the cherubim [of the ark of the covenant], shine forth! And come to save us! Cause Your face to shine on us [with favor and approval], and we will be saved. How long will You be angry with the prayers of Your people? And You have made them drink [bitter] tears in abundance. And our enemies laugh [at our suffering] among themselves. And cause Your face to shine on us [with favor and approval], and we will be saved. You drove out the [Canaanite] nations and planted the vine [in Canaan]. And it took deep root and filled the land. And its branches were like the cedars of God. And its branches to the [Euphrates] River. So that all who pass by pick its fruit? And the insects of the field feed on it. Look down from heaven and see, and take care of this vine, And [look down on] the son that You have reared and strengthened for Yourself. They perish at the rebuke of Your [angry] appearance. Upon the son of man whom You have made strong for Yourself. Revive us and we will call on Your name. Cause Your face to shine on us [in favor and approval], and we shall be saved.
Before Ephraim and Benjamin and Manasseh, stir up Your power
O L ord God of hosts,
You have fed them the bread of tears,
You make us an object of contention to our neighbors,
Restore us, O God of hosts;
You uprooted a vine (Israel) from Egypt;
You cleared away the ground before it,
The mountains were covered with its shadow,
Israel sent out its branches to the [Mediterranean] Sea,
Why have You broken down its walls and hedges,
A boar from the woods eats it away,
Turn again [in favor to us], O God of hosts;
Even the stock which Your right hand has planted,
It is burned with fire, it is cut down;
Let Your hand be upon the man of Your right hand,
Then we shall not turn back from You;
Restore us, O L ord God of hosts;

81.verse_text: Sing aloud to God our strength; Shout for joy to the God of Jacob (Israel). The sweet sounding lyre with the harp. An ordinance of the God of Jacob. When He went throughout the land of Egypt. I heard the language [of One whom] I did not know, saying, His hands were freed from the basket. I answered you in the secret place of thunder; I tested you at the waters of Meribah. Selah. O Israel, if you would listen to Me! Nor shall you worship any foreign god. Who brought you up from the land of Egypt. Open your mouth wide and I will fill it. And Israel did not [consent to] obey Me. To walk in [the path of] their own counsel. That Israel would walk in My ways! And turn My hand against their adversaries; And their time of punishment would be forever. And with honey from the rock I would satisfy you.'
Raise a song, sound the timbrel,
Blow the trumpet at the New Moon, At the full moon, on our feast day.
For this is a statute for Israel,
He established it for a testimony in Joseph
'I removed the burden from his shoulder;
You called in [the time of] trouble and I rescued you;
Hear, O My people, and I will admonish you–
Let there be no strange god among you,
I am the L ord your God,
'But My people would not listen to My voice,
So I gave them up to the stubbornness of their heart,
Oh, that My people would listen to Me,
Then I would quickly subdue and humble their enemies
Those who hate the L ord would pretend obedience to Him and cringe before Him,
But I would feed Israel with the finest of the wheat;

82.verse_text: God stands in the divine assembly; He judges among the gods (divine beings). And show partiality to the wicked? Selah. Do justice and maintain the rights of the afflicted and destitute. Rescue them from the hand of the wicked. They walk on in the darkness [of complacent satisfaction]; All the foundations of the earth [the fundamental principles of the administration of justice] are shaken. Indeed, all of you are sons of the Most High. And fall like any one of the princes.' For to You belong all the nations.
How long will you judge unjustly
The rulers do not know nor do they understand;
Nevertheless you will die like men
Arise, O God, judge the earth!

83.verse_text: Do not keep silent, O God; Do not hold Your peace or be still, O God. And those who hate You have raised their heads [in hatred of You]. And conspire together against Your hidden and precious ones. Let the name of Israel be remembered no more.' Against You they make a covenant– Of Moab and the Hagrites, Philistia with the inhabitants of Tyre. They have helped the children of Lot [the Ammonites and the Moabites] and have been an arm [of strength] to them. Selah. As with Sisera and Jabin at the brook of Kishon, Who became like dung for the earth. And all their princes like Zebah and Zalmunna, The pastures of God.' Like chaff before the wind [worthless and without substance]. And like the flame sets the mountains on fire, And terrify them with [the violence of] Your storm. That they may [persistently] seek Your name, O L ord . Yes, let them be humiliated and perish, Are the Most High over all the earth.
For behold, Your enemies are in tumult,
They concoct crafty schemes against Your people,
They have said, 'Come, and let us wipe them out as a nation;
For they have conspired together with one mind;
The tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites,
Assyria also has joined with them;
Deal with them as [You did] with Midian,
Make their nobles like Oreb and Zeeb
Who said, 'Let us possess for ourselves
O my God, make them like whirling dust,
So pursue them with Your tempest
Fill their faces with shame and disgrace,
Let them be ashamed and dismayed forever;
That they may know that You alone, whose name is the L ord ,

84.verse_text: How lovely are Your dwelling places, O L ord of hosts! My heart and my flesh sing for joy to the living God. And the swallow a nest for herself, where she may lay her young– Even Your altars, O L ord of hosts, My King and my God. They will be singing Your praises all the day long. Selah. The early rain also covers it with blessings. Each of them appears before God in Zion. Listen, O God of Jacob! Selah. And look at the face of Your anointed [the king as Your representative]. I would rather stand [as a doorkeeper] at the threshold of the house of my God Than to live [at ease] in the tents of wickedness. The L ord bestows grace and favor and honor; No good thing will He withhold from those who walk uprightly. How blessed and greatly favored is the man who trusts in You [believing in You, relying on You, and committing himself to You with confident hope and expectation].
My soul (my life, my inner self) longs for and greatly desires the courts of the L ord ;
The bird has found a house,
Blessed and greatly favored are those who dwell in Your house and Your presence;
Blessed and greatly favored is the man whose strength is in You, In whose heart are the highways to Zion.
Passing through the Valley of Weeping ( Baca), they make it a place of springs;
They go from strength to strength [increasing in victorious power];
O L ord God of hosts, hear my prayer;
For a day in Your courts is better than a thousand [anywhere else];
For the L ord God is a sun and shield;

85.verse_text: O L ord , You have [at last] shown favor to Your land [of Canaan]; You have restored [from Babylon] the captives of Jacob (Israel). You have covered all their sin. Selah. You have turned away from Your burning anger. And cause Your indignation toward us to cease. Will You prolong Your anger to all generations? That Your people may rejoice in You? And grant us Your salvation. But let them not turn again to folly. That glory [the manifest presence of God] may dwell in our land. Righteousness and peace kiss each other. And righteousness looks down from heaven. And our land will yield its produce. And will make His footsteps into a way [in which to walk].
You have forgiven the wickedness of Your people;
You have withdrawn all Your wrath,
Restore us, O God of our salvation,
Will You be angry with us forever?
Will You not revive us and bring us to life again,
Show us Your lovingkindness, O L ord ,
I will hear [with expectant hope] what God the L ord will say, For He will speak peace to His people, to His godly ones–
Surely His salvation is near to those who [reverently] fear Him [and obey Him with submissive wonder],
Steadfast love and truth and faithfulness meet together;
Indeed, the L ord will give what is good,

86.verse_text: Incline Your ear, O L ord , and answer me, For I am distressed and needy [I long for Your help]. O You my God, save Your servant, who trusts in You [believing in You and relying on You, confidently committing everything to You]. For to You I cry out all the day long. For to You, O Lord, I lift up my soul [all that I am–in prayer]. And abundant in lovingkindness and overflowing in mercy to all those who call upon You. And listen attentively to the voice of my supplications (specific requests)! For You will answer me. Nor are there any works [of wonder and majesty] like Yours. And they shall glorify Your name. You alone are God. I will walk and live in Your truth; Direct my heart to fear Your name [with awe-inspired reverence and submissive wonder]. And will glorify Your name forevermore. And You have rescued my life from the depths of Sheol [from death]. A band of violent men have sought my life, And they have not set You before them. Slow to anger and abounding in lovingkindness and truth. Grant Your strength [Your might and the power to resist temptation] to Your servant, And save the son of Your handmaid. That those who hate me may see it and be ashamed, Because You, O L ord , helped and comforted me.
Protect my life (soul), for I am godly and faithful;
Be gracious and merciful to me, O Lord,
For You, O Lord, are good, and ready to forgive [our sins, sending them away, completely letting them go forever and ever];
Hear, O L ord , my prayer;
In the day of my trouble I will call upon You,
There is no one like You among the gods, O Lord,
All nations whom You have made shall come and kneel down in worship before You, O Lord,
For You are great and do wondrous works!
Teach me Your way, O L ord ,
I will give thanks and praise You, O Lord my God, with all my heart;
For great is Your lovingkindness and graciousness toward me;
O God, arrogant and insolent men have risen up against me;
But You, O Lord, are a God [who protects and is] merciful and gracious,
Turn to me, and be gracious to me;
Show me a sign of [Your] goodwill,

87.verse_text: His foundation is on the holy mountain. More than all the dwellings of Jacob (Israel). O city of God [Jerusalem]. Selah. Behold, Philistia and Tyre with Ethiopia (Cush)– "This one was born there." ' And the Most High Himself will establish her. 'This one was born there.' Selah. 'All my springs and sources of joy are in you [Jerusalem, city of God].'
The L ord loves the gates of Zion
Glorious things are spoken of you,
'I will mention Rahab (Egypt) and Babylon among those who know Me–
But of Zion it will be said, 'This one and that one were born in her,'
The L ord will count, when He registers the peoples,
The singers as well as the players of flutes will say,

88.verse_text: O L ord , the God of my salvation, I have cried out [for help] by day and in the night before You. Incline Your ear to my cry! And my life draws near the grave (Sheol, the place of the dead). I am like a man who has no strength [a mere shadow], Like the slain who lie in a [nameless] grave, Whom You no longer remember, And they are cut off from Your hand. In dark places, in the depths. And You have afflicted me with all Your waves. Selah. I am shut up and I cannot go out. O L ord , I have called on You every day; I have spread out my hands to You [in prayer]. Shall the departed spirits arise and praise You? Selah. Or Your faithfulness in Abaddon (the underworld)? And Your righteousness in the land of forgetfulness [where the dead forget and are forgotten]? And in the morning my prayer will come to You. Why do You hide Your face from me? I suffer Your terrors; I am overcome. Your terrors have destroyed me. They have completely encompassed me. My familiar friends are in darkness.
Let my prayer come before You and enter into Your presence;
For my soul is full of troubles,
I am counted among those who go down to the pit (grave);
Cast away [from the living] and abandoned among the dead,
You have laid me in the lowest pit,
Your wrath has rested heavily upon me,
You have put my friends far from me; You have made me an object of loathing to them.
My eye grows dim with sorrow.
Will You perform wonders for the dead?
Will Your lovingkindness be declared in the grave
Will Your wonders be known in the darkness?
But I have cried out to You, O L ord , for help;
O L ord , why do You reject me?
I was afflicted and close to death from my youth on;
Your fierce wrath has swept over me;
They have surrounded me like flood waters all day long;
Lover and friend You have placed far from me;

89.verse_text: I will sing of the goodness and lovingkindness of the L ord forever; With my mouth I will make known Your faithfulness from generation to generation. In the heavens [unchangeable and majestic] You will establish Your faithfulness.' I have sworn to David My servant, And I will build up your throne for all generations.' Selah. Your faithfulness also in the assembly of the holy ones. Who among the divine beings is like the L ord , And awesome above all those who are around Him? Your faithfulness surrounds You [as an intrinsic, unchangeable part of Your very being]. When its waves rise, You still them. You have scattered Your enemies with Your mighty arm. The world and all that is in it, You have founded and established them. Mount Tabor and Mount Hermon shout for joy at Your name. Mighty is Your hand, Your right hand is exalted. Lovingkindness and truth go before You. They walk, O L ord , in the light and favor of Your countenance! And in Your righteousness they are exalted. And by Your favor our horn is exalted. And our king to the Holy One of Israel. And said, 'I have given help to one who is mighty [giving him the power to be a champion for Israel]; I have exalted one chosen from the people. With My holy oil I have anointed him, My arm also shall strengthen him. Nor will the wicked man afflict or humiliate him. And strike those who hate him. And in My name shall his horn be exalted [great power and prosperity shall be conferred upon him]. And his right hand on the rivers [the tributaries of the Euphrates]. My God, and the rock of my salvation." The highest of the kings of the earth. And My covenant will be confirmed to him. And his throne [will endure] as the days of heaven. And do not walk in My ordinances, And do not keep My commandments, And [correct] their wickedness with stripes. Nor allow My faithfulness to fail. Nor will I alter the utterance of My lips. I will not lie to David. And his throne [will continue] as the sun before Me. And the witness in the heavens is ever faithful.' Selah. You have been full of wrath against Your anointed. You have profaned his crown [by casting it] in the dust. You have brought his strongholds to ruin. He has become the scorn of his neighbors. You have made all his enemies rejoice. And have not made him [strong enough] to stand in battle. And have hurled his throne to the ground. You have covered him with shame. Selah. Will You hide Yourself forever? Will Your wrath burn like fire? For what vanity, [for what emptiness, for what futility, for what wisp of smoke] You have created all the sons of men! Can he rescue his soul from the [powerful] hand of Sheol (the nether world, the place of the dead)? Selah. Which You swore to David in Your faithfulness? With which they have mocked the footsteps of Your anointed. Amen and Amen.
For I have said, 'Goodness and lovingkindness will be built up forever;
[God has said] 'I have made a covenant with My chosen one;
I will establish your seed forever
The heavens (angels) praise Your wonders, O L ord ,
For who in the heavens can be compared to the L ord ?
A God greatly feared and reverently worshiped in the council of the holy [angelic] ones,
O L ord God of hosts, who is like You, O mighty L ord ?
You rule the swelling of the sea;
You have crushed Rahab (Egypt) like one who is slain;
The heavens are Yours, the earth also is Yours;
The north and the south, You have created them;
You have a strong arm;
Righteousness and justice are the foundation of Your throne;
Blessed and happy are the people who know the joyful sound [of the trumpet"s blast]!
In Your name they rejoice all the day,
For You are the glory of their strength [their proud adornment],
For our shield belongs to the L ord ,
Once You spoke in a vision to Your godly ones,
I have found David My servant;
With whom My hand shall be established and steadfast;
The enemy will not outwit him,
I will crush his adversaries before him,
My faithfulness and My steadfast lovingkindness shall be with him,
I will also set his hand on the [Mediterranean] sea,
He will cry to Me, "You are my Father,
I will also make him My firstborn (preeminent),
My lovingkindness I will keep for him forevermore,
His descendants I will establish forever,
'If his children turn away from My law
If they break My statutes
Then I will punish their transgression with the rod [of discipline],
Nevertheless, I will not break off My lovingkindness from him,
My covenant I will not violate,
Once [for all] I have sworn by My holiness, [My vow which cannot be violated];
His descendants shall endure forever
It shall be established forever like the moon,
But [in apparent contradiction of all this] You [the faithful L ord ] have cast off and rejected;
You have spurned and repudiated the covenant with Your servant;
You have broken down all his [city] walls;
All who pass along the road rob him;
You have exalted the right hand of his foes;
Also, You have turned back the edge of his sword
You have put an end to his splendor
You have shortened the days of his youth;
How long, O L ord ?
Remember how fleeting my lifetime is;
What man can live and not see death?
O Lord, where are Your former lovingkindnesses [so abundant in the days of David and Solomon],
Remember, O Lord, the reproach of Your servants [scorned, insulted, and disgraced]; How I bear in my heart the reproach of all the many peoples,
With which Your enemies have taunted, O L ord ,
Blessed be the L ord forevermore!

90.verse_text: Lord, You have been our dwelling place [our refuge, our sanctuary, our stability] in all generations. Or before You had given birth to the earth and the world, Even from everlasting to everlasting, You are [the eternal] God. And say, 'Return [to the earth], O children of [mortal] men!' Are like yesterday when it is past, Or as a watch in the night. In the morning they are like grass which grows anew– In the evening it wilts and withers away.
