And by Your wrath we have been terrified. Our secret sins [which we tried to conceal, You have placed] in the [revealing] light of Your presence. We have finished our years like a whispered sigh. Or even, if because of strength, eighty years; Yet their pride [in additional years] is only labor and sorrow, For it is soon gone and we fly away. And Your wrath, [who connects it] with the [reverent] fear that is due You? That we may cultivate and bring to You a heart of wisdom. Be compassionate toward Your servants–revoke Your sentence. That we may rejoice and be glad all our days. And the years we have suffered evil. And Your [glorious] majesty to their children. Confirm for us the work of our hands– Yes, confirm the work of our hands.
You turn man back to dust,
For a thousand years in Your sight
You have swept them away like a flood, they fall asleep [forgotten as soon as they are gone];
In the morning it flourishes and springs up;
For we have been consumed by Your anger
You have placed our wickedness before you,
For all our days pass away in Your wrath;
The days of our life are seventy years–
Who understands the power of Your anger? [Who connects this brevity of life among us with Your judgment of sin?]
So teach us to number our days,
Turn, O L ord [from Your fierce anger]; how long will it be?
O satisfy us with Your lovingkindness in the morning [now, before we grow older],
Make us glad in proportion to the days You have afflicted us,
Let Your work [the signs of Your power] be revealed to Your servants
And let the [gracious] favor of the Lord our God be on us;

91.verse_text: He who dwells in the shelter of the Most High Will remain secure and rest in the shadow of the Almighty [whose power no enemy can withstand]. My God, in whom I trust [with great confidence, and on whom I rely]!' And from the deadly pestilence. And under His wings you will find refuge; His faithfulness is a shield and a wall. Nor of the arrow that flies by day, Nor of the destruction (sudden death) that lays waste at noon. And ten thousand at your right hand, But danger will not come near you. And witness the [divine] repayment of the wicked [as you watch safely from the shelter of the Most High]. Even the Most High, your dwelling place, Nor will any plague come near your tent. To protect and defend and guard you in all your ways [of obedience and service]. So that you do not [even] strike your foot against a stone. The young lion and the serpent you will trample underfoot. I will set him [securely] on high, because he knows My name [he confidently trusts and relies on Me, knowing I will never abandon him, no, never]. I will be with him in trouble; I will rescue him and honor him. And I will let him see My salvation.'
I will say of the L ord , 'He is my refuge and my fortress,
For He will save you from the trap of the fowler,
He will cover you and completely protect you with His pinions,
You will not be afraid of the terror of night,
Nor of the pestilence that stalks in darkness,
A thousand may fall at your side
You will only [be a spectator as you] look on with your eyes
Because you have made the L ord , [who is] my refuge,
For He will command His angels in regard to you,
They will lift you up in their hands,
You will tread upon the lion and cobra;
'Because he set his love on Me, therefore I will save him;
He will call upon Me, and I will answer him;
With a long life I will satisfy him

92.verse_text: It is a good and delightful thing to give thanks to the L ord , To sing praises to Your name, O Most High, And Your faithfulness by night, With a solemn sound on the lyre. At the works of Your hands I joyfully sing. Your thoughts are very deep [beyond man"s understanding]. Nor does a [self-righteous] fool understand this: And all evildoers flourish, They will be destroyed forever. For behold, Your enemies will perish; All who do evil will be scattered. I am anointed with fresh oil [for Your service]. My ears hear of the evildoers who rise up against me. They will grow like a cedar in Lebanon [majestic and stable]. They will flourish in the courts of our God. He is my rock, and there is no unrighteousness in Him.
To declare Your lovingkindness in the morning
With an instrument of ten strings and with the harp,
For You, O L ord , have made me glad by Your works;
How great are Your works, O L ord !
A senseless man [in his crude and uncultivated state] knows nothing,
That though the wicked sprout up like grass
But You, L ord , are on high forever.
For behold, Your enemies, O L ord ,
But my horn [my emblem of strength and power] You have exalted like that of a wild ox;
My eye has looked on my foes;
The righteous will flourish like the date palm [long-lived, upright and useful];
Planted in the house of the L ord ,
[Growing in grace] they will still thrive and bear fruit and prosper in old age; They will flourish and be vital and fresh [rich in trust and love and contentment];
[They are living memorials] to declare that the L ord is upright and faithful [to His promises];

93.verse_text: The L ord reigns, He is clothed with majesty and splendor; The L ord has clothed and encircled Himself with strength; the world is firmly established, it cannot be moved. You are from everlasting. The floods have lifted up their voice; The floods lift up their pounding waves. More than the mighty breakers of the sea, The L ord on high is mighty. Holiness adorns Your house, O L ord , forever.
Your throne is established from of old;
The floods have lifted up, O L ord ,
More than the sounds of many waters,
Your precepts are fully confirmed and completely reliable;

94.verse_text: O L ord God, You to whom vengeance belongs, O God, You to whom vengeance belongs, shine forth [in judgment]! Give to the proud a fitting compensation. How long will the wicked rejoice in triumph? All who do evil boast proudly. And afflict and abuse Your heritage. And murder the fatherless. Nor does the God of Jacob (Israel) notice it.' And you [dull-minded] fools, when will you become wise and understand? He who formed the eye, does He not see? Does He not rebuke and punish, He who teaches man knowledge? That they are a mere breath (vain, empty, futile). And whom You teach from Your law, Until the pit is dug for the wicked and ungodly. Nor will He abandon His inheritance. And all the upright in heart will follow it. Who will take a stand for me against those who do wickedness? I would soon have dwelt in [the land of] silence. Your compassion and lovingkindness, O L ord , will hold me up. Your comforts delight me. One which frames and devises mischief by decree [under the sacred name of law]? And condemn the innocent to death. And my God the rock of my refuge. And will destroy them by means of their own evil; The L ord our God will wipe them out.
Rise up, O Judge of the earth;
O L ord , how long will the wicked,
They pour out words, speaking arrogant things;
They crush Your people, O L ord ,
They kill the widow and the alien
Yet they say, 'The L ord does not see,
Consider thoughtfully, you senseless (stupid ones) among the people;
He who made the ear, does He not hear?
He who instructs the nations,
The L ord knows the thoughts of man,
Blessed [with wisdom and prosperity] is the man whom You discipline and instruct, O L ord ,
That You may grant him [power to calm himself and find] peace in the days of adversity,
For the L ord will not abandon His people,
For judgment will again be righteous,
Who will stand up for me against the evildoers?
If the L ord had not been my help,
If I say, 'My foot has slipped,'
When my anxious thoughts multiply within me,
Can a throne of destruction be allied with You,
They band themselves together against the life of the righteous
But the L ord has become my high tower and defense,
He has turned back their own wickedness upon them

95.verse_text: O come, let us sing joyfully to the L ord ; Let us shout joyfully to the rock of our salvation. Let us shout joyfully to Him with songs. And a great King above all gods, The peaks of the mountains are His also. And His hands formed the dry land. Let us kneel before the L ord our Maker [in reverent praise and prayer]. And we are the people of His pasture and the sheep of His hand. Today, if you will hear His voice, And as at Massah [the place of testing] in the wilderness, They tried Me, even though they had seen My work [of miracles]. And I said, "They are a people who err in their heart, And they do not acknowledge or regard My ways." "They absolutely shall not enter My rest [the land of promise]." '
Let us come before His presence with a song of thanksgiving;
For the L ord is a great God
In whose hand are the depths of the earth;
The sea is His, for He made it [by His command];
O come, let us worship and bow down,
Do not harden your hearts and become spiritually dull as at Meribah [the place of strife],
For forty years I was grieved and disgusted with that generation,
Therefore I swore [an oath] in My wrath,

96.verse_text: O sing to the L ord a new song; Sing to the L ord , all the earth! Proclaim good news of His salvation from day to day. His marvelous works and wonderful deeds among all the peoples. He is to be feared above all gods. But the L ord made the heavens. Strength and beauty are in His sanctuary. Ascribe to the L ord glory and strength. Bring an offering and come into His courts. Tremble [in submissive wonder] before Him, all the earth. Indeed, the world is firmly and securely established, it shall not be moved; He will judge and rule the people with fairness.' Let the sea roar, and all the things it contains; Then all the trees of the forest will sing for joy For He is coming to judge the earth. He will judge the world with righteousness And the peoples in His faithfulness.
Sing to the L ord , bless His name;
Declare His glory among the nations,
For great is the L ord and greatly to be praised;
For all the gods of the peoples are [worthless, lifeless] idols,
Splendor and majesty are before Him;
Ascribe to the L ord , O families of the peoples,
Ascribe to the L ord the glory of His name;
Worship the L ord in the splendor of holiness;
Say among the nations, 'The L ord reigns;
Let the heavens be glad, and let the earth rejoice;
Let the field be exultant, and all that is in it.
Before the L ord , for He is coming,

97.verse_text: The L ord reigns, let the earth rejoice; Let the many islands and coastlands be glad. Righteousness and justice are the foundation of His throne. And burns up His adversaries on all sides. The earth has seen and trembled. At the presence of the Lord of the whole earth. And all the peoples see His glory and brilliance. Who boast in idols. Worship Him, all you gods! And the daughters (cities) of Judah rejoiced [in relief] Because of Your judgments, O L ord . You are exalted far above all gods. He protects the souls of His godly ones (believers), He rescues them from the hand of the wicked. And [irrepressible] joy [is spread] for the upright in heart [who delight in His favor and protection]. And praise and give thanks at the remembrance of His holy name.
Clouds and thick darkness surround Him [as at Sinai];
His lightnings have illuminated the world;
The mountains melted like wax at the presence of the L ord ,
Let all those be [deeply] ashamed who serve carved images,
Zion heard this and was glad,
For You are the L ord Most High over all the earth;
You who love the L ord , hate evil;
Light is sown [like seed] for the righteous and illuminates their path,
Rejoice in the L ord , you righteous ones [those whose moral and spiritual integrity places them in right standing with God],

98.verse_text: O sing to the L ord a new song, For He has done marvelous and wonderful things; He has [openly] revealed His righteousness in the sight of the nations. All the ends of the earth have witnessed the salvation of our God. Shout [in jubilation] and sing for joy and sing praises. With the lyre and the sound of melody. Shout with joy before the King, the L ord . The world and those who dwell in it. Let the mountains sing together for joy and delight He will judge the world with righteousness And the peoples with fairness. His right hand and His holy arm have gained the victory for Him.
The L ord has made known His salvation;
He has [graciously] remembered His lovingkindness and His faithfulness to the house of Israel;
Shout joyfully to the L ord , all the earth;
Sing praises to the L ord with the lyre,
With trumpets and the sound of the horn
Let the sea thunder and roar, and all the things it contains,
Let the rivers clap their hands;
Before the L ord , for He is coming to judge the earth;

99.verse_text: The L ord reigns, let the peoples tremble [with submissive wonder]! He sits enthroned above the cherubim, let the earth shake! And He is exalted and magnified above all the peoples. Holy is He. You have established fairness; You have executed justice and righteousness in Jacob (Israel). And worship at His footstool; Holy is He. And Samuel was among those who called on His name; They called upon the L ord and He answered them. They kept His testimonies And the statutes that He gave them. You were a forgiving God to them, And yet an avenger of their evil practices. And worship at His holy hill [Zion, the temple mount], For the L ord our God is holy.
The L ord is great in Zion,
Let them [reverently] praise Your great and awesome name;
The strength of the King loves justice and righteous judgment;
Exalt the L ord our God
Moses and Aaron were among His priests,
He spoke to them in the pillar of cloud;
You answered them, O L ord our God;
Exalt the L ord our God

100.verse_text: Shout joyfully to the L ord , all the earth. Come before His presence with joyful singing. We are His people and the sheep of His pasture. And His courts with praise. Be thankful to Him, bless and praise His name. His mercy and lovingkindness are everlasting, His faithfulness [endures] to all generations.
Serve the L ord with gladness and delight;
Know and fully recognize with gratitude that the L ord Himself is God; It is He who has made us, not we ourselves [and we are His].
Enter His gates with a song of thanksgiving
For the L ord is good;

101.verse_text: I will sing of [steadfast] lovingkindness and justice; To You, O L ord , I will sing praises. When will You come to me? I will walk in my house in integrity and with a blameless heart. I hate the practice of those who fall away [from the right path]; It will not grasp hold of me. I will not tolerate evil. The one who has a haughty look and a proud (arrogant) heart I will not tolerate. He who walks blamelessly is the one who will minister to and serve me. He who tells lies and half-truths will not continue [to remain] in my presence. That I may cut off from the city of the L ord all those who do evil.
I will behave wisely and follow the way of integrity.
I will set no worthless or wicked thing before my eyes.
A perverse heart shall depart from me;
Whoever secretly slanders his neighbor, him I will silence;
My eyes will be on the faithful (honorable) of the land, that they may dwell with me;
He who practices deceit will not dwell in my house;
Morning after morning I will destroy all the wicked in the land,

102.verse_text: Hear my prayer, O L ord , And let my cry for help come to You! Incline Your ear to me; In the day when I call, answer me quickly. And my bones have been scorched like a hearth. Indeed, [absorbed by my heartache] I forget to eat my food. My bones cling to my flesh. I am like a [desolate] owl of the wasteland. I have become like a lonely bird on a housetop. Those who ridicule me use my name as a curse. And have mingled my drink with tears For You have lifted me up and thrown me away. And as for me, I wither away like grass. And [the fame and glory of] Your name [endures] to all generations. For it is time to be gracious and show favor to her; Yes, the appointed time [the moment designated] has come. And feel pity for her dust. And all the kings of the earth [will recognize] Your glory. He has appeared in His glory and brilliance; And has not despised their prayer. That a people yet to be created will praise the L ord . From heaven the L ord gazed on the earth, To set free those who were doomed to death, And His praise in Jerusalem, And the kingdoms, to serve the L ord . He has shortened my days. Your years are [eternal] throughout all generations. The heavens are the work of Your hands. Yes, all of them will wear out like a garment. Like clothing You will change them and they shall be changed. And Your years will never end. And their descendants will be established before You.'
Do not hide Your face from me in the day of my distress!
For my days have vanished in smoke,
My heart has been struck like grass and withered,
Because of the sound of my groaning [in suffering and trouble]
I am like a [mournful] vulture of the wilderness;
I am sleepless and lie awake [mourning],
My enemies taunt me all day long;
For I have eaten ashes like bread,
Because of Your indignation and Your wrath,
My days are like an evening shadow that lengthens and vanishes [with the sun];
But You, O L ord , are enthroned forever [ruling eternally as sovereign];
You will arise and have compassion on Zion,
For Your servants find [melancholy] pleasure in the stones [of her ruins]
So the nations will fear the name of the L ord ,
For the L ord has built up Zion;
He has regarded the prayer of the destitute,
Let this be recorded for the generation to come,
For He looked down from His holy height [of His sanctuary],
To hear the sighing of the prisoner,
So that people may declare the name of the L ord in Zion
When the peoples are gathered together,
He has exhausted my strength [humbling me with sorrow] in the way;
I said, 'O my God, do not take me away in the midst of my days;
At the beginning You founded the earth;
Even they will perish, but You endure;
But You remain the same,
The children of Your servants will continue,

103.verse_text: Bless and affectionately praise the L ord , O my soul, And all that is [deep] within me, bless His holy name. And do not forget any of His benefits; Who heals all your diseases; Who crowns you [lavishly] with lovingkindness and tender mercy; So that your youth is renewed like the [soaring] eagle. And justice for all the oppressed. His acts to the children of Israel. Slow to anger and abounding in compassion and lovingkindness. Nor will He keep His anger forever. Nor rewarded us [with punishment] according to our wickedness. So great is His lovingkindness toward those who fear and worship Him [with awe-filled respect and deepest reverence]. So far has He removed our transgressions from us. So the L ord loves those who fear and worship Him [with awe-filled respect and deepest reverence]. He remembers that we are [merely] dust. Like a flower of the field, so he flourishes. And its place knows it no longer. And His righteousness to children"s children, And remember to do His commandments [imprinting His word on their hearts]. And His sovereignty rules over all [the universe]. You mighty ones who do His commandments, Obeying the voice of His word! You who serve Him and do His will. Bless and affectionately praise the L ord , O my soul!
Bless and affectionately praise the L ord , O my soul,
Who forgives all your sins,
Who redeems your life from the pit,
Who satisfies your years with good things,
The L ord executes righteousness
He made known His ways [of righteousness and justice] to Moses,
The L ord is merciful and gracious,
He will not always strive with us,
He has not dealt with us according to our sins [as we deserve],
For as the heavens are high above the earth,
As far as the east is from the west,
Just as a father loves his children,
For He knows our [mortal] frame;
As for man, his days are like grass;
For the wind passes over it and it is no more,
But the lovingkindness of the L ord is from everlasting to everlasting on those who [reverently] fear Him,
To those who honor and keep His covenant,
The L ord has established His throne in the heavens,
Bless the L ord , you His angels,
Bless the L ord , all you His hosts,
Bless the L ord , all you works of His, in all places of His dominion;

104.verse_text: Bless and affectionately praise the L ord , O my soul! O L ord my God, You are very great; You are clothed with splendor and majesty, Who stretches out the heavens like a tent curtain, Who makes the clouds His chariot, Who walks on the wings of the wind, Flames of fire His ministers. So that it will not be moved forever and ever. The waters were standing above the mountains. At the sound of Your thunder they hurried away. To the place which You established for them. So that they will not return to cover the earth. Their waters flow among the mountains. The wild donkeys quench their thirst there. They lift up their voices and sing among the branches. The earth is satisfied with the fruit of His works. And all that the earth produces for cultivation by man, So that he may bring food from the earth– So that he may make his face glisten with oil, And bread to sustain and strengthen man"s heart. The cedars of Lebanon which He has planted, As for the stork, the fir trees are her house. The sun knows the [exact] place of its setting. In which prowls about every wild beast of the forest. And seek their food from God. And lie down in their dens. And remains at his labor until evening. In wisdom You have made them all; The earth is full of Your riches and Your creatures. In which are swarms without number, Creatures both small and great. And Leviathan [the sea monster], which You have formed to play there. To give them their food in its appointed season. You open Your hand, they are filled and satisfied with good [things]. You take away their breath, they die And return to their dust. You renew the face of the ground. May the L ord rejoice and be glad in His works– He touches the mountains, and they smoke. I will sing praise to my God while I have my being. As for me, I will rejoice and be glad in the L ord . And let the wicked be no more. Bless and affectionately praise the L ord , O my soul. Praise the L ord ! (Hallelujah!)
[You are the One] who covers Yourself with light as with a garment,
Who lays the beams of His upper chambers in the waters [above the firmament],
Who makes winds His messengers,
He established the earth on its foundations,
You covered it with the deep as with a garment;
At Your rebuke they fled;
The mountains rose, the valleys sank down
You set a boundary [for the waters] that they may not cross over,
You send springs into the valleys;
They give drink to every beast of the field;
Beside them the birds of the heavens have their nests;
He waters the mountains from His upper chambers;
He causes grass to grow for the cattle,
And wine which makes the heart of man glad,
The trees of the L ord drink their fill,
Where the birds make their nests;
The high mountains are for the wild goats; The rocks are a refuge for the shephanim.
He made the moon for the seasons;
You [O L ord ] make darkness and it becomes night,
The young lions roar after their prey
When the sun arises, they withdraw
Man goes out to his work
O L ord , how many and varied are Your works!
There is the sea, great and broad,
There the ships [of the sea] sail,
They all wait for You
You give it to them, they gather it up;
You hide Your face, they are dismayed;
You send out Your Spirit, they are created;
May the glory of the L ord endure forever;
He looks at the earth, and it trembles;
I will sing to the L ord as long as I live;
May my meditation be sweet and pleasing to Him;
Let sinners be consumed from the earth,

105.verse_text: O give thanks to the L ord , call upon His name; Make known His deeds among the people. Speak of all His wonderful acts and devoutly praise them. Let the hearts of those who seek and require the L ord [as their most essential need] rejoice. Seek and deeply long for His face and His presence continually. His amazing deeds and the judgments uttered by His mouth [on His enemies, as in Egypt], O you sons of Jacob, His chosen ones! His judgments are in all the earth. And His sworn oath to Isaac, To Israel as an everlasting covenant, As the measured portion of your inheritance.' Very few [in fact], and strangers in it; From one kingdom to another people, He rebuked kings for their sakes, saying, And do My prophets no harm.' Joseph, who was sold as a slave. The word of the L ord tested and refined him. The ruler of the peoples [of Egypt], and set him free. And ruler of all his possessions, That he might teach his elders wisdom. Thus Jacob sojourned in the land of Ham. And made them more powerful than their enemies. To deal craftily with His servants. And Aaron, whom He had chosen. Great miracles in the land of Ham (Egypt). And Moses and Aaron did not rebel against His words. And caused their fish to die. Even in the chambers of their kings. And gnats in all their territory. With flaming fire in their land. And shattered the [ice-laden] trees of their territory. And the young locusts, even without number, And devoured the fruit of their ground. The first fruits and chief substance of all their strength. And among their tribes there was not one who stumbled. For the dread and fear of them had fallen on the Egyptians. And a fire to illumine the night. And satisfied them with the bread of heaven. It ran in the dry places like a river. To Abraham His servant; And His chosen ones with a joyful shout, So that they would possess the fruits of those peoples" labor, And keep His laws [obediently accepting and honoring and valuing them]. Praise the L ord ! (Hallelujah!)
Sing to Him, sing praises to Him;
Glory in His holy name;
Seek and deeply long for the L ord and His strength [His power, His might];
Remember [with awe and gratitude] the wonderful things which He has done,
O you offspring of Abraham, His servant,
He is the L ord our God;
He has remembered His covenant forever, The word which He commanded and established to a thousand generations, He cut off every source of bread. He was put in chains of iron,
The covenant which He made with Abraham,
Which He confirmed to Jacob as a statute,
Saying, 'To you I will give the land of Canaan
When there were only a few men in number,
And they wandered from one nation to another,
He allowed no man to oppress them;
'Do not touch My anointed ones,
And He called for a famine upon the land [of Egypt];
He sent a man before them,
His feet they hurt with shackles;
Until the time that his word [of prophecy regarding his brothers] came true,
The king sent and released him,
He made Joseph lord of his house
To imprison his princes at his will,
Israel also came into Egypt;
There the L ord greatly increased [the number of] His people,
He turned the heart [of the Egyptians] to hate His people,
He sent Moses His servant,
They exhibited His wondrous signs among them,
He sent [thick, oppressive] darkness and made the land dark;
He turned Egypt"s waters into blood
Their land swarmed with frogs,
He spoke, and there came swarms of flies
He gave them hail for rain,
He struck their vines also and their fig trees,
He spoke, and the [migratory] locusts came,
And ate up all the vegetation in their land,
He also struck down all the firstborn in their land,
He brought the sons of Israel out [of Egypt] with silver and gold,
Egypt was glad when they departed,
The L ord spread a cloud as a covering [by day],
The Israelites asked, and He brought quail,
He opened the rock and water flowed out;
For He remembered His holy word
He brought out His people with joy,
He gave them the lands of the nations [of Canaan],
So that they might observe His precepts

106.verse_text: Praise the L ord ! (Hallelujah!) Oh give thanks to the L ord , for He is good; For His mercy and lovingkindness endure forever! Or who can proclaim all His praise [that is due Him]? Who practice righteousness at all times. Visit me with Your salvation [when You rescue them], That I may rejoice in the gladness of Your nation, That I may glory with Your inheritance. We have committed iniquity, we have behaved wickedly. They did not remember the abundance of Your mercies nor imprint Your lovingkindnesses on their hearts, That He might make His [supreme] power known. And He led them through the depths as through a pasture. And redeemed them from the hand of the [Egyptian] enemy. Not one of them was left. They sang His praise. They did not [patiently] wait for His counsel and purpose [to be revealed regarding them], And tempted God [with their insistent desires] in the desert. But sent a wasting disease among them. And Aaron [the high priest], the holy one of the L ord , And engulfed the company of Abiram. The flame consumed the wicked. And worshiped a cast image. For the image of an ox that eats grass. Who had done such great things in Egypt, Awesome things at the Red Sea. [And He would have done so] had not Moses, His chosen one, stepped into the gap before Him, To turn away His wrath from destroying them. They did not believe in His word nor rely on it, They did not listen to the voice of the L ord . That He would cause them to fall in the wilderness, And scatter them in the lands [of the earth]. And ate sacrifices offered to the dead. And a plague broke out among them. And so the plague was halted. To all generations forever. So that it went hard with Moses on their account; Moses spoke recklessly with his lips. As the L ord commanded them, And learned their ways, Which became a [dreadful] snare to them. Even the blood of their sons and of their daughters, Whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan; And the land was polluted with their blood. They played the prostitute in their own deeds [by giving their worship, which belongs to God alone, to other 'gods']. And those who hated them ruled over them. And they were subdued under the [powerful] hand of their enemies. But they were rebellious in their counsel, And sank down in their wickedness. When He heard their cry; And relented [rescinding their sentence] according to the greatness of His lovingkindness [when they cried out to Him], Among those who had carried them away captive. And gather us from among the nations, That we may give thanks to Your holy name And glory in praising You. From everlasting even to everlasting. And let all the people say, 'Amen.' Praise the L ord ! (Hallelujah!)
Who can put into words the mighty deeds of the L ord ?
Blessed are those who observe justice [by honoring God"s precepts],
Remember me, O L ord , when You favor Your people.
That I may see the prosperity of Your chosen ones,
We have sinned like our fathers;
Our fathers in Egypt did not understand nor appreciate Your miracles; But they were rebellious at the sea, at the Red Sea. And He detested His own inheritance.
Nevertheless He saved them for His name"s sake,
He rebuked the Red Sea, and it dried up;
So He saved them from the hand of the one that hated them,
And the waters covered their adversaries;
Then Israel believed in [the validity of] His words;
But they quickly forgot His works;
But lusted intensely in the wilderness
So He gave them their request,
They envied Moses in the camp,
Therefore the earth opened and swallowed Dathan,
And a fire broke out in their company;
They made a calf in Horeb (Sinai)
Thus they exchanged [the true God who was] their glory
They forgot God their Savior,
Wonders in the land of Ham,
Therefore He said He would destroy them,
Then they despised the pleasant land [of Canaan];
But they sulked and complained in their tents;
Therefore He lifted up His hand [swearing] to them,
And that He would cast out their descendants among the nations
They joined themselves also to [the idol] Baal of Peor,
Thus they provoked Him to anger with their practices,
Then Phinehas [the priest] stood up and interceded,
And that was credited to him for righteousness,
They provoked Him to anger at the waters of Meribah,
Because they were rebellious against His Spirit,
They did not destroy the [pagan] peoples [in Canaan],
But they mingled with the [idolatrous] nations
And served their idols,
They even sacrificed their sons and their daughters to demons
And shed innocent blood,
In this way they became unclean in their practices;
Therefore the anger of the L ord was kindled against His people
He gave them into the hands of the nations,
Their enemies also oppressed them,
Many times He rescued them;
Nevertheless He looked [sympathetically] at their distress
And He remembered His covenant for their sake,
He also made them objects of compassion
Save us, O L ord our God,
Blessed be the L ord , the God of Israel,

107.verse_text: O give thanks to the L ord , for He is good; For His compassion and lovingkindness endure forever! Whom He has redeemed from the hand of the adversary, From the east and from the west, And did not find a way to an inhabited city. They fainted. And He rescued them from their distresses. To an inhabited city [where they could establish their homes]. And for His wonderful acts to the children of men! And fills the hungry appetite with what is good. Prisoners [bound] in misery and chains, And spurned the counsel of the Most High. They stumbled and there was no one to help. And He saved them from their distresses. And broke their bonds apart. And for His wonderful acts to the children of men! And cut the bars of iron apart. And because of their sins, were afflicted. And they drew near to the gates of death. And He saved them from their distresses. And rescued them from their destruction. And for His wonderful acts to the children of men! And speak of His deeds with shouts of joy! Who do business on great waters; And His wonders in the deep. Which lifted up the waves of the sea. Their courage melted away in their misery. And were at their wits" end [all their wisdom was useless]. And He brought them out of their distresses. So that the waves of the sea were still. And He guided them to their desired haven (harbor). And for His wonderful acts to the children of men! And praise Him at the seat of the elders. And springs of water into a thirsty ground; Because of the wickedness of those who dwell in it. And a dry land into springs of water; So that they may establish an inhabited city, And produce an abundant harvest. And He does not let [the number of] their cattle decrease. Through oppression, misery, and sorrow, And makes them wander in a pathless wasteland. And makes their families like a flock. But all unrighteousness shuts its mouth. And [thoughtfully] consider the lovingkindness of the L ord .
Let the redeemed of the L ord say so,
And gathered them from the lands, From the north and from the south.
They wandered in the wilderness in a [solitary] desert region;
Hungry and thirsty,
Then they cried out to the L ord in their trouble,
He led them by the straight way,
Let them give thanks to the L ord for His lovingkindness,
For He satisfies the parched throat,
Some dwelt in darkness and in the deep (deathly) darkness,
Because they had rebelled against the precepts of God
Therefore He humbled their heart with hard labor;
Then they cried out to the L ord in their trouble,
He brought them out of darkness and the deep (deathly) darkness
Let them give thanks to the L ord for His lovingkindness,
For He has shattered the gates of bronze
Fools, because of their rebellious way,
They detested all kinds of food,
Then they cried out to the L ord in their trouble,
He sent His word and healed them,
Let them give thanks to the L ord for His lovingkindness,
And let them offer the sacrifices of thanksgiving,
Those who go down to the sea in ships,
They have seen the works of the L ord ,
For He spoke and raised up a stormy wind,
They went up toward the heavens [on the crest of the wave], they went down again to the depths [of the watery trough];
They staggered and trembled like a drunken man,
Then they cried out to the L ord in their trouble,
He hushed the storm to a gentle whisper,
Then they were glad because of the calm,
Let them give thanks to the L ord for His lovingkindness,
Let them exalt Him also in the congregation of the people,
He turns rivers into a wilderness,
A productive land into a [barren] salt waste,
He turns a wilderness into a pool of water
And there He has the hungry dwell,
And sow fields and plant vineyards,
Also He blesses them so that they multiply greatly,
When they are diminished and bowed down (humbled)
He pours contempt on princes
Yet He sets the needy securely on high, away from affliction,
The upright see it and rejoice;
Who is wise? Let him observe and heed these things;

108.verse_text: O God, my heart is steadfast [with confident faith]; I will sing, I will sing praises, even with my soul. I will awaken the dawn! And I will sing praises to You among the nations. Your truth reaches to the skies. And Your glory above all the earth. Save with Your right hand, and answer me! 'I will rejoice, I will portion out Shechem [as I divide Canaan among My people], And measure out the Valley of Succoth. Ephraim also is the helmet of My head [My stronghold, My defense]; Over Edom I will throw My shoe [to show Edom is Mine]; Over Philistia I will shout [in triumph].' Who will lead me to Edom? And will You not go out, O God, with our armies? For deliverance by man is in vain [a worthless hope]. For it is He who will trample down our enemies.
I will praise and give thanks to You, O L ord , among the people;
For Your lovingkindness is great and higher than the heavens;
Be exalted [in majesty], O God, above the heavens,
That Your beloved [ones] may be rescued,
God has spoken in His holiness:
Gilead is Mine, Manasseh is Mine; Judah is My scepter.
Who will bring me into the fortified city [of Petra]?
Have You not rejected us, O God?
Give us help against the adversary,
With God we will do valiantly,

109.verse_text: O God of my praise! Do not keep silent, They have spoken against me with a lying tongue. And have fought against me without a cause. But I am in prayer. And hatred for my love. And let an attacker stand at his right hand [to kill him]. Let his prayer [for help] result [only] in sin. And let another take his office. And his wife a widow. Let them seek their food and be driven far from their ruined homes. And let strangers plunder the product of his labor. Nor let anyone be gracious to his fatherless children. And in the following generation let their name be blotted out. And do not let the sin of his mother be blotted out. That He may cut off their memory from the earth; But persecuted the suffering and needy man, And the brokenhearted, to put them to death. He did not delight in blessing, so it was far from him. And it seeped into his inner self like water And like [anointing] oil into his bones. And as a sash with which he is constantly bound. And of those who speak evil against my life. Because Your lovingkindness (faithfulness, compassion) is good, O rescue me; And my heart is wounded within me. I am shaken off like the locust. And my flesh is gaunt and without fatness. When they see me, they shake their heads [in derision]. Save me according to Your lovingkindness– You, L ord , have done it. When adversaries arise, let them be ashamed, But let Your servant rejoice. And let them cover themselves with their own shame as with a robe. And in the midst of many I will praise Him. To save him from those who judge his soul.
For the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of the deceitful are opened against me;
They have also surrounded me with words of hatred,
In return for my love, they attack me,
They have repaid me evil for good,
Appoint a wicked man against him,
When he enters into dispute, let wickedness come about.
Let his days be few;
Let his children be fatherless
Let his children wander and beg;
Let the creditor seize all that he has,
Let there be no one to extend kindness to him,
Let his descendants be cut off,
Let the wickedness of his fathers be remembered by the L ord ;
Let them be before the L ord continually,
Because the man did not remember to show kindness,
He also loved cursing, and it came [back] to him;
He clothed himself with cursing as with his garment,
Let it be to him as a robe with which he covers himself,
Let this be the reward of my attackers from the L ord ,
But You, O G od , the Lord, show kindness to me, for Your name"s sake;
For I am suffering and needy,
I am vanishing like a shadow when it lengthens and fades;
My knees are unsteady from fasting;
I also have become a reproach and an object of taunting to others;
Help me, O L ord my God;
And let them know that this is Your hand;
Let them curse, but You bless.
Let my attackers be clothed with dishonor,
I will give great praise and thanks to the L ord with my mouth;
For He will stand at the right hand of the needy,

110.verse_text: The L ord (Father) says to my Lord (the Messiah, His Son), 'Sit at My right hand Until I make Your enemies a footstool for Your feet [subjugating them into complete submission].' 'Rule in the midst of Your enemies.' In the splendor of holiness, from the womb of the dawn, Your young men are to You as the dew. According to the order of Melchizedek.' He will fill them with corpses, He will crush the chief men over a broad country. Therefore He will lift up His head [triumphantly].
The L ord will send the scepter of Your strength from Zion, saying,
Your people will offer themselves willingly [to participate in Your battle] in the day of Your power;
The L ord has sworn [an oath] and will not change His mind: ' You are a priest forever He will crush kings in the day of His wrath.
The L ord is at Your right hand,
He will execute judgment [in overwhelming punishment] among the nations;
He will drink from the brook by the wayside;

111.verse_text: Praise the L ord ! (Hallelujah!) I will give thanks to the L ord with all my heart, In the company of the upright and in the congregation. Studied by all those who delight in them. And His righteousness endures forever. The L ord is gracious and merciful and full of loving compassion. He will remember His covenant forever. In giving them the heritage of the nations. All His precepts are sure (established, reliable, trustworthy). They are done in [absolute] truth and uprightness. He has ordained His covenant forever; Holy and awesome is His name–[inspiring reverence and godly fear]. A good understanding and a teachable heart are possessed by all those who do the will of the L ord ; His praise endures forever.
Great are the works of the L ord ,
Splendid and majestic is His work,
He has made His wonderful acts to be remembered;
He has given food to those who fear Him [with awe-inspired reverence];
He has declared and made known to His people the power of His works,
The works of His hands are truth and [absolute] justice;
They are upheld forever and ever;
He has sent redemption to His people;
The [reverent] fear of the L ord is the beginning (the prerequisite, the absolute essential, the alphabet) of wisdom;

112.verse_text: Praise the L ord ! (Hallelujah!) Blessed [fortunate, prosperous, and favored by God] is the man who fears the L ord [with awe-inspired reverence and worships Him with obedience], Who delights greatly in His commandments. The generation of the upright will be blessed. And his righteousness endures forever. He is gracious and compassionate and righteous (upright–in right standing with God). He conducts his affairs with justice. The righteous will be remembered forever. His heart is steadfast, trusting [confidently relying on and believing] in the L ord . While he looks [with satisfaction] on his adversaries. His righteousness endures forever; His horn will be exalted in honor. He will gnash his teeth and melt away [in despair and death]; The desire of the wicked will perish and come to nothing.
His descendants will be mighty on earth;
Wealth and riches are in his house,
Light arises in the darkness for the upright;
It is well with the man who is gracious and lends;
He will not fear bad news;
His heart is upheld, he will not fear
He has given freely to the poor;
The wicked will see it and be angered,

113.verse_text: Praise the L ord ! ( Hallelujah!) Praise, O servants of the L ord , Praise the name of the L ord . From this time forth and forever. The name of the L ord is to be praised [with awe-inspired reverence]. And His glory above the heavens. Who is enthroned on high, The heavens and the earth? And lifts the needy from the ash heap, With the princes of His people. As a joyful mother of children. Praise the L ord ! (Hallelujah!)
Blessed be the name of the L ord
From the rising of the sun to its setting
The L ord is high above all nations,
Who is like the L ord our God,
He raises the poor out of the dust
That He may seat them with princes,
He makes the barren woman live in the house

114.verse_text: When Israel came out of Egypt, The house of Jacob from a people of strange language, And Israel His dominion. The Jordan turned back. The [little] hills, like lambs. O Jordan, that you turn back? O [little] hills, like lambs? At the presence of the God of Jacob (Israel), The flint into a fountain of water.
What ails you, O sea, that you flee?
O mountains, that you leap like rams,
Tremble, O earth, at the presence of the Lord,
Who turned the rock into a pool of water,

115.verse_text: Not to us, O L ord , not to us, But to Your name give glory Because of Your lovingkindness, because of Your truth and faithfulness. 'Where, now, is their God?' He does whatever He pleases. The work of man"s hands. They have eyes, but they cannot see; They have noses, but they cannot smell; They have feet, but they cannot walk; Nor can they make a sound with their throats. Everyone who trusts in them. He is their help and their shield. He is their help and their shield. He is their help and their shield. He will bless the house of Israel; He will bless the house of Aaron. Both the small and the great. You and your children. Who made heaven and earth. But the earth He has given to the children of men. Nor do any who go down into silence; From this time forth and forever. Praise the L ord ! (Hallelujah!)
But our God is in heaven;
The idols [of the nations] are silver and gold,
They have mouths, but they cannot speak;
They have ears, but they cannot hear;
They have hands, but they cannot feel;
Those who make them will become like them,
O Israel, trust and take refuge in the L ord ! [Be confident in Him, cling to Him, rely on His word!]
O house of Aaron, trust in the L ord ;
You who [reverently] fear the L ord , trust in the L ord ;
The L ord has been mindful of us; He will bless,
He will bless those who fear and worship the L ord [with awe-inspired reverence and submissive wonder],
May the L ord give you [great] increase,
May you be blessed of the L ord ,
The heavens are the heavens of the L ord ,
The dead do not praise the L ord ,
But as for us, we will bless and affectionately and gratefully praise the L ord

116.verse_text: I love the L ord , because He hears [and continues to hear] My voice and my supplications (my pleas, my cries, my specific needs). Therefore I will call on Him as long as I live. And the terrors of Sheol came upon me; I found distress and sorrow. 'O L ord , please save my life!' Yes, our God is compassionate. I was brought low [humbled and discouraged], and He saved me. For the L ord has dealt bountifully with you. My eyes from tears, And my feet from stumbling and falling. In the land of the living. 'I am greatly afflicted.' 'All men are liars.' For all His benefits toward me? [How can I repay Him for His precious blessings?] And call on the name of the L ord . Yes, in the presence of all His people. Is the death of His godly ones [so He watches over them]. I am Your servant, the son of Your handmaid; You have unfastened my chains. And will call on the name of the L ord . Yes, in the presence of all His people, In the midst of you, O Jerusalem. Praise the L ord ! (Hallelujah!)
Because He has inclined His ear to me,
The cords and sorrows of death encompassed me,
Then I called on the name of the L ord :
Gracious is the L ord , and [consistently] righteous;
The L ord protects the simple (childlike);
Return to your rest, O my soul,
For You have rescued my life from death,
I will walk [in submissive wonder] before the L ord
I believed [and clung to my God] when I said,
What will I give to the L ord [in return]
I will lift up the cup of salvation
I will pay my vows to the L ord ,
Precious [and of great consequence] in the sight of the L ord
O L ord , truly I am Your servant;
I will offer to You the sacrifice of thanksgiving,
I will pay my vows to the L ord ,
In the courts of the L ord " s house (temple)–

117.verse_text: O praise the L ord , all you nations! Praise Him, all you people! And the truth of the L ord endures forever. Praise the L ord ! (Hallelujah!)
For His lovingkindness prevails over us [and we triumph and overcome through Him],

118.verse_text: O give thanks to the L ord , for He is good; For His lovingkindness endures forever. 'His lovingkindness endures forever.' 'His lovingkindness endures forever.' 'His lovingkindness endures forever.' The L ord answered me and set me free. What can [mere] man do to me? Therefore I will look [in triumph] on those who hate me. Than to trust in man. Than to trust in princes. In the name of the L ord I will surely cut them off. In the name of the L ord I will cut them off. They flare up and are extinguished like a fire of thorns; In the name of the L ord I will surely cut them off. But the L ord helped me. And He has become my salvation. The right hand of the L ord does valiantly. The right hand of the L ord does valiantly. And declare the works and recount the illustrious acts of the L ord . But He has not given me over to death. I shall enter through them, I shall give thanks to the L ord . The righteous will enter through it. And You have become my salvation [my Rescuer, my Savior]. It is marvelous in our eyes. Let us rejoice and be glad in it. O L ord , we beseech You, send now prosperity and give us success! We have blessed you from the house of the L ord [you who come into His sanctuary under His guardianship]. [You are] my God, I extol You. For His lovingkindness endures forever.
Oh let Israel say,
Oh let the house of Aaron say,
Oh let those who [reverently] fear the L ord , say,
Out of my distress I called on the L ord ;
The L ord is on my side; I will not fear.
The L ord is on my side, He is among those who help me;
It is better to take refuge in the L ord
It is better to take refuge in the L ord
All nations encompassed me;
They encompassed me, yes, they surrounded me [on every side];
They swarmed around me like bees;
You [my enemy] pushed me violently so that I was falling,
The L ord is my strength and song,
The sound of joyful shouting and salvation is in the tents of the righteous:
The right hand of the L ord is exalted;
I will not die, but live,
The L ord has disciplined me severely,
Open to me the [temple] gates of righteousness;
This is the gate of the L ord ;
I will give thanks to You, for You have heard and answered me;
The stone which the builders rejected Has become the chief corner stone . Bind the festival sacrifices with cords to the horns of the altar.
This is from the L ord and is His doing;
This [day in which God has saved me] is the day which the L ord has made;
O L ord , save now, we beseech You;
Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the L ord ;
The L ord is God, and He has given us light [illuminating us with His grace and freedom and joy].
You are my God, and I give thanks to You;
O give thanks to the L ord , for He is good;

119.verse_text: How blessed and favored by God are those whose way is blameless [those with personal integrity, the upright, the guileless], Who walk in the law [and who are guided by the precepts and revealed will] of the L ord . And who [consistently] seek Him and long for Him with all their heart. They walk in His ways. That we should follow them with [careful] diligence. To observe and keep Your statutes [obediently accepting and honoring them]! When I look [with respect] to all Your commandments [as my guide]. When I learn [through discipline] Your righteous judgments [for my transgressions]. Do not utterly abandon me [when I fail]. By keeping watch [on himself] according to Your word [conforming his life to Your precepts]. Do not let me wander from Your commandments [neither through ignorance nor by willful disobedience]. That I may not sin against You. Teach me Your statutes. All the ordinances of Your mouth. As much as in all riches. And [thoughtfully] regard Your ways [the path of life established by Your precepts]. I will not forget Your word. That I may live and keep Your word [treasuring it and being guided by it day by day]. Wonderful things from Your law. Do not hide Your commandments from me. For Your ordinances at all times. Who wander from Your commandments. For I observe Your testimonies. Your servant meditates on Your statutes. And my counselors. Revive and refresh me according to Your word. Teach me Your statutes. So that I will meditate (focus my thoughts) on Your wonderful works. Renew and strengthen me according to [the promises of] Your word. And graciously grant me Your law. I have placed Your ordinances before me . O L ord , do not put me to shame! For You will give me a heart that is willing. And I will [steadfastly] observe it to the end. And observe it with all my heart. For I delight in it. And not to dishonest gain and envy. And restore me [with renewed energy] in Your ways. As that which produces [awe-inspired] reverence for You. For Your ordinances are good. Renew me through Your righteousness. Your salvation according to Your promise; For I trust [completely] in Your word [and its reliability]. For I wait for Your ordinances. Forever and ever [writing Your precepts on my heart]. For I seek and deeply long for Your precepts. And shall not be ashamed. Which I love. Which I love; And I will meditate on Your statutes. In which You have made me hope. That Your word has revived me and given me life. Yet I do not turn away from Your law. And I have taken comfort. In the house of my pilgrimage. And keep Your law. That I observe Your precepts [accepting them with loving obedience]. I have promised to keep Your words. Be merciful and gracious to me according to Your promise. And turned my feet to [follow and obey] Your testimonies. To keep Your commandments. But I have not forgotten Your law. Because of Your righteous ordinances. And of those who keep and honor Your precepts. Teach me Your statutes. O L ord , according to Your promise. For I have believed and trusted and relied on Your commandments. But now I keep and honor Your word [with loving obedience]. Teach me Your statutes. But I will keep Your precepts with all my heart. But I delight in Your law. That I may learn Your statutes. Than thousands of gold and silver pieces. Give me understanding and a teachable heart, that I may learn Your commandments. Because I wait for Your word. And that in faithfulness You have disciplined me. According to Your word (promise) to Your servant. For Your law is my delight. But I will meditate on Your precepts. Even those who have known Your testimonies. So that I will not be ashamed. I wait for Your word. Saying, 'When will You comfort me?' Yet I do not forget Your statutes. When will You execute judgment on those who persecute me? Men who do not conform to Your law. They have persecuted me with a lie; help me [L ord ]! So that I may keep and obey the testimony of Your mouth. Your word is settled in heaven [standing firm and unchangeable]. You have established the earth, and it stands [securely]. For all things [all parts of the universe] are Your servants. Then I would have perished in my time of trouble. For by them You have revived me and given me life. For I have [diligently] sought Your precepts and required them [as my greatest need]. But I will consider Your testimonies. Your commandment is exceedingly broad and extends without limits [into eternity]. It is my meditation all the day. For Your words are always with me. For Your testimonies are my meditation. Because I have observed and kept Your precepts. That I may keep Your word. For You Yourself have taught me. Sweeter than honey to my mouth! Therefore I hate every false way. And a light to my path. That I will keep Your righteous ordinances. Renew and revive me [giving me life], O L ord , according to Your word. And teach me Your ordinances. Yet I do not forget Your law. Yet I do not wander from Your precepts. For they are the joy of my heart. Forever, even to the end. But I love and treasure Your law. I wait for Your word. That I may keep the commandments of my God [honoring and obeying them]. And do not let me be ashamed of my hope [in Your great goodness]. That I may have regard for Your statutes continually. For their deceitfulness is useless. Therefore I love Your testimonies. And I am afraid and in awe of Your judgments. Do not leave me to those who oppress me. Do not let the arrogant oppress me. And for [the fulfillment of] Your righteous word. And teach me Your statutes. That I may know Your testimonies. They have broken Your law. Yes, more than refined gold. I hate every false way. Therefore my soul keeps them. Their unfolding gives understanding to the simple (childlike). Because I longed for Your commandments. As is Your way to those who love Your name. Do not let any human weakness have power over me [causing me to be separated from You]. That I may keep Your precepts. And teach me Your statutes. Because people do not keep Your law. And upright are Your judgments. And in great faithfulness. Because my enemies have forgotten Your words. Therefore Your servant loves it. But I do not forget Your precepts. And Your law is truth. Yet Your commandments are my delight and my joy. Give me understanding [the ability to learn and a teachable heart] that I may live. I will observe Your statutes. And I will keep Your testimonies. I wait for Your word. That I may meditate on Your word. O L ord , renew and refresh me according to Your ordinances. They are far from Your law. And all Your commandments are truth. That You have founded them forever. For I do not forget Your law. Revive me and give me life according to [the promise of] Your word. For they do not seek Your statutes. Revive me and give me life according to Your ordinances. Yet I do not turn away from Your testimonies. Because they do not respect Your law. Revive me and give me life, O L ord , according to Your lovingkindness. And every one of Your righteous ordinances endures forever. But my heart stands in [reverent] awe of Your words [so I can expect You to help me]. As one who finds great treasure. But I love Your law. Because of Your righteous ordinances. Nothing makes them stumble. And I do Your commandments. I love them greatly. For all my ways are [fully known] before You. Give me understanding [the ability to learn and a teachable heart] according to Your word [of promise]. Deliver me according to Your word. For You teach me Your statutes. For all Your commandments are righteous. For I have chosen Your precepts. And Your law is my delight. And let Your ordinances help me. Seek Your servant, for I do not forget Your commandments.
Blessed and favored by God are those who keep His testimonies,
They do no unrighteousness;
You have ordained Your precepts,
Oh, that my ways may be established
Then I will not be ashamed
I will give thanks to You with an upright heart,
I shall keep Your statutes;
How can a young man keep his way pure?
With all my heart I have sought You, [inquiring of You and longing for You];
Your word I have treasured and stored in my heart,
Blessed and reverently praised are You, O L ord ;
With my lips I have told of
I have rejoiced in the way of Your testimonies,
I will meditate on Your precepts
I will delight in Your statutes;
Deal bountifully with Your servant,
Open my eyes [to spiritual truth] so that I may behold
I am a stranger on the earth;
My soul is crushed with longing
You rebuke the presumptuous and arrogant, the cursed ones,
Take reproach and contempt away from me,
Even though princes sit and talk to one another against me,
Your testimonies also are my delight
My earthly life clings to the dust;
I have told of my ways, and You have answered me;
Make me understand the way of Your precepts,
My soul dissolves because of grief;
Remove from me the way of falsehood and unfaithfulness,
I have chosen the faithful way;
I cling tightly to Your testimonies;
I will run the way of Your commandments [with purpose],
Teach me, O L ord , the way of Your statutes,
Give me understanding [a teachable heart and the ability to learn], that I may keep Your law;
Make me walk in the path of Your commandments,
Incline my heart to Your testimonies
Turn my eyes away from vanity [all those worldly, meaningless things that distract–let Your priorities be mine],
Establish Your word and confirm Your promise to Your servant,
Turn away my reproach which I dread,
I long for Your precepts;
May Your lovingkindness also come to me, O L ord ,
So I will have an answer for the one who taunts me,
And do not take the word of truth utterly out of my mouth,
I will keep Your law continually,
And I will walk at liberty,
I will also speak of Your testimonies before kings
For I shall delight in Your commandments,
And I shall lift up my hands to Your commandments,
Remember [always] the word and promise to Your servant,
This is my comfort in my affliction,
The arrogant utterly ridicule me,
I have remembered [carefully] Your ancient ordinances, O L ord ,
Burning indignation has seized me because of the wicked, Who reject Your law. But as for me, I did not turn away from Your precepts.
Your statutes are my songs
O L ord , I remember Your name in the night,
This has become mine [as the gift of Your grace],
The L ord is my portion;
I sought Your favor with all my heart;
I considered my ways
I hurried and did not delay
The cords of the wicked have encircled and ensnared me,
At midnight I will rise to give thanks to You
I am a companion of all who [reverently] fear You,
The earth, O L ord , is full of Your lovingkindness and goodness;
You have dealt well with Your servant,
Teach me good judgment (discernment) and knowledge,
Before I was afflicted I went astray,
You are good and do good;
The arrogant have forged a lie against me,
Their heart is insensitive like fat [their minds are dull and brutal],
It is good for me that I have been afflicted,
The law from Your mouth is better to me
Your hands have made me and established me;
May those who [reverently] fear You see me and be glad,
I know, O L ord , that Your judgments are fair,
O may Your lovingkindness and graciousness comfort me,
Let Your compassion come to me that I may live,
Let the arrogant be ashamed and humiliated, for they sabotage me with a lie;
May those who fear You [with submissive wonder] turn to me,
May my heart be blameless in Your statutes,
My soul languishes and grows weak for Your salvation;
My eyes fail [with longing, watching] for [the fulfillment of] Your promise,
For I have become like a wineskin [blackened and shriveled] in the smoke [in which it hangs],
How many are the days of Your servant [which he must endure]?
The arrogant (godless) have dug pits for me,
All Your commandments are faithful and trustworthy.
They had almost destroyed me on earth,
According to Your steadfast love refresh me and give me life,
Forever, O L ord ,
Your faithfulness continues from generation to generation;
They continue this day according to Your ordinances,
If Your law had not been my delight,
I will never forget Your precepts,
I am Yours, save me [as Your own];
The wicked wait for me to destroy me,
I have seen that all [human] perfection has its limits [no matter how grand and perfect and noble];
Oh, how I love Your law!
Your commandments make me wiser than my enemies,
I have better understanding and deeper insight than all my teachers [because of Your word],
I understand more than the aged [who have not observed Your precepts],
I have restrained my feet from every evil way,
I have not turned aside from Your ordinances,
How sweet are Your words to my taste,
From Your precepts I get understanding;
Your word is a lamp to my feet
I have sworn [an oath] and have confirmed it,
I am greatly afflicted;
Accept and take pleasure in the freewill offerings of my mouth, O L ord ,
My life is continually in my hand,
The wicked have laid a snare for me,
I have taken Your testimonies as a heritage forever,
I have inclined my heart to perform Your statutes
I hate those who are double-minded,
You are my hiding place and my shield;
Leave me, you evildoers,
Uphold me according to Your word [of promise], so that I may live;
Uphold me that I may be safe,
You have turned Your back on all those who wander from Your statutes,
You have removed all the wicked of the earth like dross [for they have no value];
My flesh trembles in [reverent] fear of You,
I have done justice and righteousness;
Be the guarantee for Your servant for good [as Judah was the guarantee for Benjamin];
My eyes fail [with longing, watching] for [the fulfillment of] Your salvation,
Deal with Your servant according to Your [gracious] lovingkindness,
I am Your servant; give me understanding [the ability to learn and a teachable heart]
It is time for the L ord to act;
Therefore I love Your commandments more than gold,
Therefore I esteem as right all Your precepts concerning everything;
Your testimonies are wonderful;
The unfolding of Your [glorious] words give light;
I opened my mouth and panted [with anticipation],
Turn to me and be gracious to me and show me favor,
Establish my footsteps in [the way of] Your word;
Redeem me from the oppression of man;
Make Your face shine [with pleasure] upon Your servant,
My eyes weep streams of water
Righteous are You, O L ord ,
You have commanded Your testimonies in righteousness
My zeal has [completely] consumed me,
Your word is very pure (refined);
I am small and despised,
Your righteousness is an everlasting righteousness,
Trouble and anguish have found me,
Your righteous testimonies are everlasting;
I cried with all my heart; answer me, O L ord !
I cried to You; save me
I rise before dawn and cry [in prayer] for help;
My eyes anticipate the night watches and I awake before the call of the watchman,
Hear my voice according to Your [steadfast] lovingkindness;
Those who follow after wickedness approach;
You are near, O L ord ,
Of old I have known from Your testimonies
Look upon my agony and rescue me,
Plead my cause and redeem me;
Salvation is far from the wicked,
Great are Your tender mercies and steadfast love, O L ord ;
Many are my persecutors and my adversaries,
I see the treacherous and loathe them,
Consider how I love Your precepts;
The sum of Your word is truth [the full meaning of all Your precepts],
Princes persecute me without cause,
I rejoice at Your word,
I hate and detest falsehood,
Seven times a day I praise You,
Those who love Your law have great peace;
I hope and wait [with complete confidence] for Your salvation, O L ord ,
My soul keeps Your testimonies [hearing and accepting and obeying them];
I keep Your precepts and Your testimonies,
Let my [mournful] cry come before You, O L ord ;
Let my supplication come before You;
Let my lips speak praise [with thanksgiving],
Let my tongue sing [praise for the fulfillment] of Your word,
Let Your hand be ready to help me,
I long for Your salvation, O L ord ,
Let my soul live that it may praise You,
I have gone astray like a lost sheep;

120.verse_text: In my trouble I cried to the L ord , And He answered me. And from a deceitful tongue. You deceitful tongue?– and I live among the tents of Kedar [among hostile people]! With those who hate peace. They are for war.
Rescue my soul, O L ord , from lying lips,
What shall be given to you, and what more shall be done to you,
Sharp arrows of the warrior, With the burning coals of the broom tree.
Woe to me, for I sojourn in Meshech,
Too long my soul has had its dwelling
I am for peace, but when I speak,

121.verse_text: I will lift up my eyes to the hills [of Jerusalem]– From where shall my help come? Who made heaven and earth. He who keeps you will not slumber. Will neither slumber [briefly] nor sleep [soundly]. The L ord is your shade on your right hand. Nor the moon by night. He will keep your life. From this time forth and forever.
My help comes from the L ord ,
He will not allow your foot to slip;
The L ord is your keeper;
The sun will not strike you by day,
The L ord will protect you from all evil;
The L ord will guard your going out and your coming in [everything that you do]

122.verse_text: I was glad when they said to me, 'Let us go to the house of the L ord .' Within your gates, O Jerusalem, As a city that is firmly joined together; [As was decreed as] an ordinance for Israel, To give thanks to the name of the L ord . The thrones of the house of David. 'May they prosper who love you [holy city]. And prosperity within your palaces.' I will now say, 'May peace be within you.' I will seek your (the city"s) good.
To which the [twelve] tribes go up, even the tribes of the L ord ,
For there the thrones of judgment were set,
Pray for the peace of Jerusalem:
May peace be within your walls
For the sake of my brothers and my friends,
For the sake of the house of the L ord our God [which is Jerusalem],

123.verse_text: Unto you I lift up my eyes, O You who are enthroned in the heavens! And as the eyes of a maid to the hand of her mistress, So our eyes look to the L ord our God, Until He is gracious and favorable toward us. For we are greatly filled with contempt. With the scoffing of those who are at ease, And with the contempt of the proud [who disregard God"s law].
Behold, as the eyes of servants look to the hand of their master,
Be gracious to us, O L ord , be gracious and favorable toward us,

124.verse_text: 'If it had not been the L ord who was on our side,' Let Israel now say, When men rose up against us, When their wrath was kindled against us; The torrent would have swept over our soul; Who has not given us as prey to be torn by their teeth. The trap is broken and we have escaped. Who made heaven and earth.
'If it had not been the L ord who was on our side
Then they would have [quickly] swallowed us alive,
Then the waters would have engulfed us,
Then the raging waters would have swept over our soul.'
We have escaped like a bird from the snare of the fowlers;
Our help is in the name of the L ord ,

125.verse_text: Those who trust in and rely on the L ord [with confident expectation] Are like Mount Zion, which cannot be moved but remains forever. So the L ord surrounds His people From this time forth and forever. So that the righteous will not reach out their hands to do wrong. And to those who are upright in their hearts. The L ord will lead them away with those who do evil. Peace be upon Israel.
For the scepter of wickedness shall not rest on the land of the righteous,
Do good, O L ord , to those who are good
But as for those who turn aside to their crooked ways [in unresponsiveness to God],

126.verse_text: When the L ord brought back the captives to Zion (Jerusalem), We were like those who dream [it seemed so unreal]. And our tongue with joyful shouting; Then they said among the nations, 'The L ord has done great things for them.' We are glad! As the stream-beds in the South (the Negev) [are restored by torrents of rain]. Will indeed come again with a shout of joy, bringing his sheaves with him.
Then our mouth was filled with laughter
The L ord has done great things for us;
Restore our captivity, O L ord ,
They who sow in tears shall reap with joyful singing.
He who goes back and forth weeping, carrying his bag of seed [for planting],

127.verse_text: Unless the L ord builds the house, They labor in vain who build it; Unless the L ord guards the city, The watchman keeps awake in vain. To retire late, To eat the bread of anxious labors– For He gives [blessings] to His beloved even in his sleep. The fruit of the womb a reward. So are the children of one"s youth. They will not be ashamed When they speak with their enemies [in gatherings] at the [city] gate.
It is vain for you to rise early,
Behold, children are a heritage and gift from the L ord ,
Like arrows in the hand of a warrior,
How blessed [happy and fortunate] is the man whose quiver is filled with them;

128.verse_text: Blessed [happy and sheltered by God"s favor] is everyone who fears the L ord [and worships Him with obedience], Who walks in His ways and lives according to His commandments. You will be happy and blessed and it will be well with you. Within the innermost part of your house; Your children will be like olive plants Around your table. Who fears the L ord [and worships Him with obedience]. And may you see the prosperity of Jerusalem all the days of your life; Peace be upon Israel!
For you shall eat the fruit of [the labor of] your hands,
Your wife shall be like a fruitful vine
Behold, for so shall the man be blessed and divinely favored
May the L ord bless you from Zion [His holy mountain],
Indeed, may you see your [family perpetuated in your] children"s children.

129.verse_text: 'Many times they have persecuted me (Israel) from my youth,' Let Israel now say, Yet they have not prevailed against me. They made their furrows [of suffering] long [in Israel].' He has cut in two the [thick] cords of the wicked [which enslaved the people of Israel]. Be put to shame and turned backward [in defeat]. Which withers before it grows up, Nor the binder of sheaves his arms, 'The blessing of the L ord be upon you; We bless you in the name of the L ord .'
'Many times they have persecuted me from my youth,
The [enemies, like] plowers plowed on my back;
Let them be like the grass on the housetops,
With which the reaper does not fill his hand,
Nor do those who pass by say,

130.verse_text: Out of the depths [of distress] I have cried to You, O L ord . Let Your ears be attentive To the voice of my supplications. O Lord, who could stand [before you in judgment and claim innocence]? That You may be feared and worshiped [with submissive wonder]. And in His word do I hope. More than the watchmen for the morning; More than the watchmen for the morning. For with the L ord there is lovingkindness, And with Him is abundant redemption. From all his sins.
If You, L ord , should keep an account of our sins and treat us accordingly,
But there is forgiveness with You,
I wait [patiently] for the L ord , my soul [expectantly] waits,
My soul waits for the Lord
O Israel, hope in the L ord ;

131.verse_text: L ord , my heart is not proud, nor my eyes haughty; Nor do I involve myself in great matters, Or in things too difficult for me. Like a weaned child [resting] with his mother, My soul is like a weaned child within me [composed and freed from discontent]. From this time forth and forever.
Surely I have calmed and quieted my soul;
O Israel, hope in the L ord

132.verse_text: O L ord , remember on David"s behalf All his hardship and affliction; And vowed to the Mighty One of Jacob: Nor get into my bed– Nor my eyelids to slumber, A dwelling place for the Mighty One of Jacob (Israel).' We found it in the field of Jaar. Let us worship at His footstool. You and the ark [the symbol] of Your strength. And let Your godly ones shout for joy. Do not turn away the face of Your anointed. A truth from which He will not turn back: And My testimony which I will teach them, Their children also shall sit upon your throne forever.' He has desired it for His dwelling place: 'Here will I dwell, for I have desired it. I will satisfy her poor with bread. And her godly ones will shout aloud for joy. I have prepared a lamp for My anointed [fulfilling the promises]. But upon himself shall his crown shine.'
How he swore to the L ord
'I absolutely will not enter my house,
I certainly will not permit my eyes to sleep
Until I find a place for the L ord ,
Behold, we heard of it at Ephrathah;
Let us go into His tabernacle;
Arise, O L ord , to Your resting place,
Let Your priests be clothed with righteousness (right living),
For the sake of Your servant David,
The L ord swore to David 'One of your descendants I will set upon your throne.
If your children will keep My covenant
For the L ord has chosen Zion;
'This is My resting place forever' [says the L ord ];
I will abundantly bless her provisions;
Her priests also I will clothe with salvation,
There I will make the horn (strength) of David grow;
His enemies I will clothe with shame,

133.verse_text: Behold, how good and how pleasant it is For brothers to dwell together in unity! Coming down on the beard, Even the beard of Aaron, Coming down upon the edge of his [priestly] robes [consecrating the whole body]. Coming down on the hills of Zion; For there the L ord has commanded the blessing: life forevermore.
It is like the precious oil [of consecration] poured on the head,
It is like the dew of [Mount] Hermon

134.verse_text: Behold, bless and praise the L ord , all servants of the L ord (priests, Levites), Who stand and serve by night in the house of the L ord . And bless the L ord . He who made heaven and earth.
Lift up your hands to the sanctuary
May the L ord bless you from Zion,

135.verse_text: Praise the L ord ! (Hallelujah!) Praise the name of the L ord ; Praise Him, O servants of the L ord (priests, Levites), In the courts of the house of our God, Sing praises to His name, for it is gracious and lovely. Israel for His own special treasure and possession. And that our Lord is above all gods. In the heavens and on the earth, in the seas and all deeps– Who makes lightning for the rain, Who brings the wind from His storehouses; Both of man and animal; Upon Pharaoh and all his servants. And killed mighty kings, Og, king of Bashan, And all the kingdoms of Canaan; A heritage to Israel His people. Your fame and remembrance, O L ord , [endures] throughout all generations. And He will have compassion on His servants [revealing His mercy]. The work of men"s hands. They have eyes, but they do not see; Nor is there any breath in their mouths. So is everyone who trusts in and relies on them. O house of Aaron, bless the L ord ; You who fear the L ord [and worship Him with obedience], bless the L ord [with grateful praise]! Who dwells [with us] at Jerusalem. Praise the L ord ! (Hallelujah!)
You who stand in the house of the L ord ,
Praise the L ord , for the L ord is good;
For the L ord has chosen [the descendants of] Jacob for Himself,
For I know that the L ord is great
Whatever the L ord pleases, He does,
Who causes the clouds to rise from the ends of the earth;
Who struck the firstborn of Egypt,
Who sent signs and wonders into your midst, O Egypt,
Who struck many nations
Sihon, king of the Amorites,
And He gave their land as a heritage,
Your name, O L ord , endures forever,
For the L ord will judge His people
The idols of the nations are silver and gold,
They have mouths, but they do not speak;
They have ears, but they do not hear,
Those who make idols are like them [absolutely worthless–spiritually blind, deaf, and powerless];
O house of Israel, bless and praise the L ord [with gratitude];
O house of Levi, bless the L ord ;
Blessed be the L ord from Zion,

136.verse_text: Give thanks to the L ord , for He is good; For His lovingkindness (graciousness, mercy, compassion) endures forever. For His lovingkindness endures forever. For His lovingkindness endures forever.
