For His lovingkindness endures forever; For His lovingkindness endures forever; For His lovingkindness endures forever; For His lovingkindness endures forever; For His lovingkindness endures forever; For His lovingkindness endures forever; For His lovingkindness endures forever; For His lovingkindness endures forever; For His lovingkindness endures forever; For His lovingkindness endures forever; For His lovingkindness endures forever; For His lovingkindness endures forever; For His lovingkindness endures forever; For His lovingkindness endures forever; For His lovingkindness endures forever; For His lovingkindness endures forever; For His lovingkindness endures forever; For His lovingkindness endures forever; For His lovingkindness endures forever; For His lovingkindness endures forever; For His lovingkindness endures forever; For His lovingkindness endures forever; For His lovingkindness (graciousness, mercy, compassion) endures forever.
Give thanks to the God of gods,
Give thanks to the Lord of lords,
To Him who alone does great wonders,
To Him who made the heavens with skill,
To Him who stretched out the earth upon the waters,
To Him who made the great lights,
The sun to rule over the day,
The moon and stars to rule by night,
To Him who struck the firstborn of Egypt,
And brought Israel out from among them,
With a strong hand and with an outstretched arm,
To Him who divided the Red Sea into parts,
And made Israel pass through the midst of it,
But tossed Pharaoh and his army into the Red Sea,
To Him who led His people through the wilderness,
To Him who struck down great kings,
And killed mighty kings,
Sihon, king of the Amorites,
And Og, king of Bashan,
And gave their land as a heritage,
Even a heritage to Israel His servant,
Who [faithfully] remembered us in our lowly condition,
And has rescued us from our enemies,
Who gives food to all flesh,
Give thanks to the God of heaven,

137.verse_text: By the rivers of Babylon, There we [captives] sat down and wept, When we remembered Zion [the city God imprinted on our hearts]. We hung our harps. And our tormentors [who made a mockery of us demanded] amusement, saying, 'Sing us one of the songs of Zion.' In a strange and foreign land? Let my right hand forget [her skill with the harp]. If I do not remember you, If I do not prefer Jerusalem Above my chief joy. The day of [the fall of] Jerusalem, Who said 'Down, down [with her] To her very foundation.' How blessed will be the one Who repays you [with destruction] as you have repaid us. Against the rock.
On the willow trees in the midst of Babylon
For there they who took us captive demanded of us a song with words,
How can we sing the L ord " s song
If I forget you, O Jerusalem,
Let my tongue cling to the roof of my mouth
Remember, O L ord , against the sons of Edom,
O daughter of Babylon, you devastator,
How blessed will be the one who seizes and dashes your little ones

138.verse_text: I will give You thanks with all my heart; I sing praises to You before the [pagan] gods. And give thanks to Your name for Your lovingkindness and Your truth; For You have magnified Your word together with Your name. And You made me bold and confident with [renewed] strength in my life. When they have heard of the promises of Your mouth [which were fulfilled]. For great is the glory and majesty of the L ord . He regards the lowly [and invites them into His fellowship]; But the proud and haughty He knows from a distance. You will stretch out Your hand against the wrath of my enemies, And Your right hand will save me. Your [unwavering] lovingkindness, O L ord , endures forever– Do not abandon the works of Your own hands.
I will bow down [in worship] toward Your holy temple
On the day I called, You answered me;
All the kings of the land will give thanks and praise You, O L ord ,
Yes, they will sing of the ways of the L ord [joyfully celebrating His wonderful acts],
Though the L ord is exalted,
Though I walk in the midst of trouble, You will revive me;
The L ord will accomplish that which concerns me;

139.verse_text: O L ord , you have searched me [thoroughly] and have known me. You understand my thought from afar. And You are intimately acquainted with all my ways. Behold, O L ord , You know it all. And [You have] placed Your hand upon me. It is too high [above me], I cannot reach it. Or where can I flee from Your presence? If I make my bed in Sheol (the nether world, the place of the dead), behold, You are there. If I dwell in the remotest part of the sea, And Your right hand will take hold of me. And the night will be the only light around me,' But the night shines as bright as the day; Darkness and light are alike to You. You knit me [together] in my mother"s womb. Wonderful are Your works, And my soul knows it very well. When I was being formed in secret, And intricately and skillfully formed [as if embroidered with many colors] in the depths of the earth. And in Your book were all written The days that were appointed for me, When as yet there was not one of them [even taking shape]. How vast is the sum of them! When I awake, I am still with You. Go away from me, therefore, men of bloodshed. Your enemies take Your name in vain. And do I not loathe those who rise up against You? They have become my enemies. Test me and know my anxious thoughts; And lead me in the everlasting way.
You know when I sit down and when I rise up [my entire life, everything I do];
You scrutinize my path and my lying down,
Even before there is a word on my tongue [still unspoken],
You have enclosed me behind and before,
Such [infinite] knowledge is too wonderful for me;
Where can I go from Your Spirit?
If I ascend to heaven, You are there;
If I take the wings of the dawn,
Even there Your hand will lead me,
If I say, 'Surely the darkness will cover me,
Even the darkness is not dark to You and conceals nothing from You,
For You formed my innermost parts;
I will give thanks and praise to You, for I am fearfully and wonderfully made;
My frame was not hidden from You,
Your eyes have seen my unformed substance;
How precious also are Your thoughts to me, O God!
If I could count them, they would outnumber the sand.
O that You would kill the wicked, O God;
For they speak against You wickedly,
Do I not hate those who hate You, O L ord ?
I hate them with perfect and utmost hatred;
Search me [thoroughly], O God, and know my heart;
And see if there is any wicked or hurtful way in me,

140.verse_text: Rescue me, O L ord , from evil men; Protect me from violent men. They continually [gather together and] stir up wars. Poison of a viper is under their lips. Selah. Protect me from violent men Who intend to trip up my steps. They have spread a net by the wayside; They have set traps for me. Selah. Listen to the voice of my supplications, O L ord . You have covered my head in the day of battle. Do not further their evil device, that they not be exalted. Selah. May the mischief of their own lips come upon them. Let them be thrown into the fire, Into deep [water] pits from which they cannot rise. Let evil quickly hunt the violent man [to overthrow him and stop his evil acts].' And [will secure] justice for the poor. The upright will dwell in Your presence.
They devise evil things in their hearts;
They sharpen their tongues like a serpent"s;
Keep me, O L ord , from the hands of the wicked;
The proud have hidden a trap for me, and cords;
I said to the L ord , 'You are my God;
O G od the Lord, the strength of my salvation,
Do not grant, O L ord , the desires of the wicked;
'Those who surround me raise their heads;
Let burning coals fall upon them;
Do not let a slanderer be established in the earth;
I know [with confidence] that the L ord will maintain the cause of the afflicted,
Surely the righteous will give thanks to Your name;

141.verse_text: L ord , I call upon You; hurry to me. Listen to my voice when I call to You. The lifting up of my hands as the evening offering. Keep watch over the door of my lips [to keep me from speaking thoughtlessly]. Or to practice deeds of wickedness With men who plan and do evil; And let me not eat of their delicacies (be tempted by their gain). It is [the choicest anointing] oil on the head; Let my head not refuse [to accept and acknowledge and learn from] it; For still my prayer is against their wicked deeds. And they [who followed them] will hear my words, for they are pleasant (just). Our bones have been scattered at the mouth of Sheol [by the injustices of the wicked]. In You I take refuge; do not pour out my life nor leave me defenseless. And from the snares of those who do evil. While I pass by and safely escape [from danger].
Let my prayer be counted as incense before You;
Set a guard, O L ord , over my mouth;
Do not incline my heart to [consent to or tolerate] any evil thing,
Let the righteous [thoughtfully] strike (correct) me–it is a kindness [done to encourage my spiritual maturity].
Their [wicked, godless] judges are thrown down the sides of the rocky cliff,
As when the one plows and breaks open the ground [and the soil scatters behind him],
For my eyes are toward You, O G od , the Lord;
Keep me from the jaws of the trap which they have set for me,
Let the wicked fall into their own nets,

142.verse_text: I cry aloud with my voice to the L ord ; I make supplication with my voice to the L ord . I declare my trouble before Him. You knew my path. In the way where I walk They have hidden a trap for me. For there is no one who has regard for me [to act in my favor]. Escape has failed me and I have nowhere to run; No one cares about my life. I said, 'You are my refuge, My portion in the land of the living. For I am brought very low; Rescue me from my persecutors, For they are stronger than I. So that I may give thanks and praise Your name; The righteous will surround me [in triumph], For You will look after me.'
I pour out my complaint before Him;
When my spirit was overwhelmed and weak within me [wrapped in darkness],
Look to the right [the point of attack] and see;
I cried out to You, O L ord ;
Bring my soul out of prison (adversity),

143.verse_text: Hear my prayer, O L ord , Listen to my supplications! Answer me in Your faithfulness, and in Your righteousness. For in Your sight no man living is righteous or justified. He has crushed my life down to the ground; He has made me dwell in dark places, like those who have been long dead. My heart grows numb within me. I meditate on all that You have done; I ponder the work of Your hands. My throat thirsts for You, as a parched land [thirsts for water]. Selah. Do not hide Your face from me, Or I will become like those who go down into the pit (grave). For I trust in You. Teach me the way in which I should walk, For I lift up my soul to You. I take refuge in You. For You are my God; Let Your good Spirit lead me on level ground. In Your righteousness bring my life out of trouble. And destroy all those who afflict my life, For I am Your servant.
And do not enter into judgment with Your servant,
For the enemy has persecuted me,
Therefore my spirit is overwhelmed and weak within me [wrapped in darkness];
I remember the days of old;
I reach out my hands to You;
Answer me quickly, O L ord , my spirit fails;
Let me hear Your lovingkindness in the morning,
Rescue me, O L ord , from my enemies;
Teach me to do Your will [so that I may please You],
Save my life, O L ord , for Your name"s sake;
In your lovingkindness, silence and destroy my enemies

144.verse_text: Blessed be the L ord , my Rock and my great strength, Who trains my hands for war And my fingers for battle; My high tower and my rescuer, My shield and He in whom I take refuge, Who subdues my people under me. Or the son of man that You think of him? His days are like a shadow that passes away. Touch the mountains, and they will smoke. Send out Your arrows and confuse and embarrass and frustrate them. Set me free and rescue me from great waters, Out of the hands of [hostile] foreigners [who surround us] And whose right hand is a right hand of falsehood. Upon a harp of ten strings I will sing praises to You, Who sets David His servant free from the evil sword. Whose mouth speaks deceit [without restraint], And whose right hand is a right hand of falsehood. And our daughters like corner pillars fashioned for a palace; And our flocks bring forth thousands and ten thousands in our fields; Without mishap and without loss, And let there be no outcry in our streets! How blessed [fortunate, prosperous, and favored] are the people whose God is the L ord !
L ord , what is man that You take notice of him?
Man is like a mere breath;
Bow Your heavens, O L ord , and come down;
Flash lightning and scatter my enemies;
Stretch out Your hand from above;
I will sing a new song to You, O God;
Set me free and rescue me from the hand of [hostile] foreigners,
Let our sons in their youth be like plants full grown,
Let our barns be full, supplying every kind of produce,
How blessed and favored are the people in such circumstance;

145.verse_text: I will exalt You, my God, O King, And [with gratitude and submissive wonder] I will bless Your name forever and ever. Yes, [with awe-inspired reverence] I will praise Your name forever and ever. And His greatness is [so vast and profound as to be] unsearchable [incomprehensible to man]. And shall declare Your mighty and remarkable acts. And on Your wonderful works, I will meditate. And [with gratitude and submissive wonder] I will tell of Your greatness. And will sing joyfully of Your righteousness. Slow to anger and abounding in lovingkindness. And His tender mercies are over all His works [the entirety of things created]. And Your godly ones will bless You. And talk of Your power, And the glorious majesty of Your kingdom. And Your dominion endures throughout all generations. And raises up all those who are bowed down. And You give them their food in due time. And satisfy the desire of every living thing. And gracious and kind in all His works. To all who call on Him in truth (without guile). He also will hear their cry and will save them. But all the wicked He will destroy. And all flesh will bless and gratefully praise His holy name forever and ever.
Every day I will bless You and lovingly praise You;
Great is the L ord , and highly to be praised,
One generation shall praise Your works to another,
On the glorious splendor of Your majesty
People will speak of the power of Your awesome acts,
They will overflow [like a fountain] when they speak of Your great and abundant goodness
The L ord is gracious and full of compassion,
The L ord is good to all,
All Your works shall give thanks to You and praise You, O L ord ,
They shall speak of the glory of Your kingdom
To make known to the sons of men Your mighty acts
Your kingdom is an everlasting kingdom,
The L ord upholds all those [of His own] who fall
The eyes of all look to You [in hopeful expectation],
You open Your hand
The L ord is [unwaveringly] righteous in all His ways
The L ord is near to all who call on Him,
He will fulfill the desire of those who fear and worship Him [with awe-inspired reverence and obedience];
The L ord keeps all who love Him,
My mouth will speak the praise of the L ord ,

146.verse_text: Praise the L ord ! (Hallelujah!) Praise the L ord , O my soul! I will sing praises to my God as long as I live. In mortal man, in whom there is no salvation (help). In that very day his thoughts and plans perish. Whose hope is in the L ord his God, The sea, and all that is in them, Who keeps truth and is faithful forever, Who gives food to the hungry. The L ord sets free the prisoners. The L ord lifts up those who are bowed down; He supports the fatherless and the widow; But He makes crooked the way of the wicked. Your God, O Zion, to all generations. Praise the L ord ! (Hallelujah!)
While I live I will praise the L ord ;
When his spirit leaves him, he returns to the earth;
How blessed and graciously favored is he whose help is the God of Jacob (Israel),
Who executes justice for the oppressed,
The L ord opens the eyes of the blind; The L ord loves the righteous [the upright in heart].
The L ord protects the strangers;
The L ord shall reign forever,

147.verse_text: Praise the L ord ! For it is good to sing praises to our [gracious and majestic] God; Praise is becoming and appropriate. He is gathering [together] the exiles of Israel. And binds up their wounds [healing their pain and comforting their sorrow]. He calls them all by their names. His understanding is inexhaustible [infinite, boundless]. He casts the wicked down to the ground. Sing praises to our God with the lyre, Who provides rain for the earth, Who makes grass grow on the mountains. And to the young ravens that for which they cry. Nor does He take pleasure in the legs (strength) of a man. Those who wait for His mercy and lovingkindness. Praise your God, O Zion! He has blessed your children within you. He satisfies you with the finest of the wheat. His word runs very swiftly. He scatters the frost like ashes. Who can stand before His cold? He causes His wind to blow and the waters to flow. His statutes and His ordinances to Israel. They have not known [understood, appreciated, heeded, or cherished] His ordinances. Praise the L ord ! (Hallelujah!)
The L ord is building up Jerusalem;
He heals the brokenhearted
He counts the number of the stars;
Great is our [majestic and mighty] Lord and abundant in strength;
The L ord lifts up the humble;
Sing to the L ord with thanksgiving;
Who covers the heavens with clouds,
He gives to the beast its food,
He does not delight in the strength (military power) of the horse,
The L ord favors those who fear and worship Him [with awe-inspired reverence and obedience],
Praise the L ord , O Jerusalem!
For He has strengthened the bars of your gates,
He makes peace in your borders;
He sends His command to the earth;
He gives [to the earth] snow like [a blanket of] wool;
He casts out His ice like fragments;
He sends out His word and melts the ice;
He declares His word to Jacob,
He has not dealt this way with any [other] nation;

148.verse_text: Praise the L ord ! Praise the L ord from the heavens; Praise Him in the heights! Praise Him, all His hosts (armies)! Praise Him, all stars of light! And the waters above the heavens! For He commanded and they were created. He has made a decree which shall not pass away. Sea monsters and all deeps; Stormy wind, fulfilling His orders; Fruitful trees and all cedars; Creeping things and winged birds; Princes and all judges of the earth; Old men and children. For His name alone is exalted and supreme; His glory and majesty are above earth and heaven. Praise for all His godly ones; For the people of Israel, a people near to Him. Praise the L ord ! (Hallelujah!)
Let them praise the name of the L ord ,
He has also established them forever and ever;
Praise the L ord from the earth,
Lightning and hail, snow and fog;
Kings of the earth and all people;
Let them praise the name of the L ord ,
He has lifted up a horn for His people [giving them strength, prosperity, dignity, and preeminence],

149.verse_text: Praise the L ord ! Sing to the L ord a new song, And praise Him in the congregation of His godly ones (believers). Let Zion"s children rejoice in their King. Let them sing praises to Him with the tambourine and lyre. He will beautify the humble with salvation. Let them sing for joy on their beds. And a two-edged sword in their hands, And punishment on the peoples, And their nobles with fetters of iron, This is the honor for all His godly ones. Praise the L ord ! (Hallelujah!)
Let Israel rejoice in their Maker;
Let them praise His name with dancing;
For the L ord takes pleasure in His people;
Let the godly ones exult in glory;
Let the high praises of God be in their throats,
To execute vengeance on the nations
To bind their kings with chains
To execute on them the judgment written.

150.verse_text: Praise the L ord ! Praise God in His sanctuary; Praise Him in His mighty heavens. Praise Him according to [the abundance of] His greatness. Praise Him with harp and lyre. Praise Him with stringed instruments and flute. Praise Him with loud cymbals. Praise the L ord ! (Hallelujah!)
Praise Him for His mighty acts;
Praise Him with tambourine and dancing;
Let everything that has breath and every breath of life praise the L ord !
